SourceText: Sorry to hear that things are difficult between you and your children @fields.user_name. Sometimes it’s easy, sometimes it’s not. Let go of the mistakes and celebrate the wins, however small! Remember you can always get extra support by typing "Help".
text: Jammer om te hoor dinge is moeilik tussen jou en jou kinders @fields.user_name. Soms is dit maklik, soms nie. Vergeet van die foute en vier die oorwinnings, maak nie saak hoe klein nie! Onthou, jy kan altyd ekstra ondersteuning kry deur "Help" te tik.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Be gentle with yourself @fields.user_name. Just because something didn’t go well today, or you lost your temper, this doesn’t define who you are as a parent. Remind yourself of the things you did well today, even if they may seem small.
text: Moenie so hard wees op jouself nie @fields.user_name. Net omdat iets vandag skeefgeloop het, of jy jou humeur verloor het, definieer jou nie as ouer nie. Herinner jouself aan die dinge wat jy goed gedoen het vandag, selfs al lyk dit baie klein.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: If you have already noticed some changes in your life or relationship with your children, that's great!
text: As jy reeds 'n paar veranderinge in jou lewe of verhouding met jou kinders opgemerk het, is dit wonderlik!

SourceText: If you have not noticed any changes, please keep it up. Sometimes these things take time to change. We know you can do it!

SourceText: If you have not noticed any changes, please keep it up. Sometimes these things take time to change. I know you can do it!
text: Nog geen veranderinge nie? Byt asseblief vas. Hierdie dinge neem soms tyd om te verander. Ek weet jy kan dit doen!

SourceText: It can be exhausting when your children have too much energy or can't focus on one thing. Sometimes, your children need opportunities to be very active and run around to help them be calm afterwards.
text: Dit kan uitputtend wees as jou kinders te veel energie het of nie op een ding kan fokus nie. Soms het jou kinders die kans nodig om baie aktief te wees en rond te hardloop om hulle te help rustig maak.

SourceText: Would you like suggestions for active and calm things to do with your child?
text: Wil jy graag voorstelle hê vir aktiewe en rustige dinge om met jou kind te doen?

SourceText: Remember that you’re in charge of what they eat, but not how much. Newborns have stomach the size of a grape! They need to eat often (sometimes in the middle of the night). It’s important to build trust around eating, especially as your baby starts on solid food. Let them know you are listening to their wishes in the eating department. They’ll be ravenous again soon!
text: Onthou, jy is in beheer van wat hulle eet, maar nie hoe baie hulle eet nie. Pasgeborenes se mae is so groot soos 'n druiwekorrel! Hulle moet dikwels eet (soms in die middel van die nag). Dis belangrik om vertroue te bou rondom eet, veral wanneer jou baba met vaste kos begin. Laat hulle weet jy luister na hulle wense wanneer dit by eet kom. Hulle gaan gou-gou weer rasend honger wees!

SourceText: Your baby will cry as soon as a caregiver’s attention is diverted and are cranky as well as clingy. Prioritise being there for them and give them physical contact when needed.
text: Jou baba gaan huil sodra 'n versorger se aandag elders is, en is nukkerig asook klouerig. Maak dit 'n prioriteit om dáár te wees vir hulle en gee hulle fisiese kontak wanneer nodig.

SourceText: Would you like to learn more?
text: Wil jy graag meer uitvind?

SourceText: Your baby or toddler may sometimes want something that they cannot have. If they start whining, first check to see if there is something wrong (are they actually hungry or tired)? If they continue, try to redirect their attention to something else. You should also try to ignore their behaviour while attending to them for comfort and support
text: Jou baba of kleuter wil soms iets hê wat hulle nie kan kry nie. Wanneer hulle begin kerm, kyk eers of daar nie iets verkeerd is nie (is hulle nie dalk honger of moeg nie)? As hulle aanhou, probeer hulle aandag met iets anders aftrek. Probeer ook hulle gedrag ignoreer terwyl jy hulle troos en gemaklik maak

SourceText: Sorry, I don't understand what you mean.
text: Jammer, ek verstaan nie wat jy bedoel nie.

SourceText: Check to see why @fields.child_nickname is in a bad mood. Are they tired or hungry? Or maybe they are not feeling well? Or maybe they need some more loving attention. Be a reassuring presence for @fields.child_nickname when they are having a difficult day.
text: Probeer uitvind hoekom @fields.child_nickname in 'n slegte bui is. Is hulle moeg of honger? Of dalk voel hulle nie lekker nie? Of dalk het hulle bietjie meer liefdevolle aandag nodig. Wees 'n gerusstellende teenwoordigheid vir @fields.child_nickname wanneer hulle 'n moeilike dag het.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Check to see why your baby is in a bad mood. Are they tired or hungry? Or maybe they are not feeling well? Or maybe they need some more loving attention. Be a reassuring presence for your baby when they are having a difficult day.

SourceText: Unfortunately, your baby will go through phases for the next 2 years of sleeping poorly. Try wearing @fields.child_nickname close to you, feeding them and carrying them in a sling. And hang in there, remember it’s a phase. You and @fields.child_nickname will get through it together!
text: Ongelukkig gaan jou baba vir die volgende 2 jaar deur fases gaan van slegte slaap. Probeer om @fields.child_nickname teenaan jou te hou, te voed en te dra in 'n draagband (‘sling’). En byt vas, dis net 'n fase. Jy en @fields.child_nickname gaan saam hierdeur kom!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Unfortunately, your baby will go through phases for the next 2 years of sleeping poorly. Try wearing your baby close to you, feeding them and carrying them in a sling. And hang in there, remember it’s a phase. You and your baby will get through it together!
text: Ongelukkig gaan jou baba vir die volgende 2 jaar deur fases gaan van slegte slaap. Probeer om jou baba teenaan jou te hou, te voed en te dra in 'n draagband (‘sling’). En byt vas, dis net 'n fase. Jy en jou baba gaan saam hierdeur kom!

SourceText: Pay close attention to @fields.child_nickname in case they try something dangerous! Just because they are able to play on their own now, doesn’t mean you can look away for long. Redirect mischievous behaviours into practice waving, imitation games, singing and moving games and pretending to talk on the phone!
text: Let mooi op vir in geval @fields.child_nickname iets gevaarliks probeer doen! Net omdat hulle nou op hulle eie kan speel, beteken nie jy kan vir lank wegkyk nie. Herlei ondeunde gedrag na ander aktiwiteite, bv. oefen om te waai, maak mekaar na, sing en beweeg, en maak of jy op die foon praat!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Try to stay calm and support @fields.child_nickname as they move through the tantrum. Your priority is to ensure that they don’t hurt themselves. Don’t add to @fields.child_nickname’s anger by shouting and showing angry emotions. This won’t help.

SourceText: Try to stay calm and support your toddler as they move through the tantrum. Your priority is to ensure that they don’t hurt themselves. Don’t add to your child’s anger by shouting and showing angry emotions. This won’t help.

SourceText: Babies are much more likely to want to do things if you make the activity fun and playful. Patience is also a must. Take a deep breath if you notice yourself getting frustrated by @fields.child_nickname.

SourceText: It is hard to find time to have fun with your children. How many days in the past week did you do something fun together? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)
text: Dis moeilik om tyd te kry vir lekker dinge doen saam met jou kinders. Hoeveel dae in die afgelope week het julle iets lekkers saam gedoen? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

SourceText: If you don't want to answer, please type 99.
text: As jy nie wil antwoord nie, tik 99.

SourceText: Sorry, I don't understand what you mean. Please reply with a number between 0 and 7.
text: Jammer, ek verstaan nie wat jy bedoel nie. Antwoord asseblief met 'n nommer tussen 0 en 7.

SourceText: Amazing that you keep doing fun things with your child. You are the best parent they could wish for!
text: Wonderlik dat jy aanhou om lekker dinge saam met jou kind te doen. Jy is die beste ouer waarvoor hulle kon vra!

SourceText: Great that you are setting aside time with your child – it is THE foundation for a happy home!
text: Wonderlike dat jy tyd maak vir jou kind – dit is DIE grondslag van 'n gelukkige huis!

SourceText: Finding time to do something fun with your child can be hard, I understand! The great thing is that spending time together will make other things go easier – you will see!
text: Dit kan moeilik wees om tyd te kry vir lekker dinge doen saam met jou kind, ek verstaan! Die wonderlike ding is dat, as julle saam tyd deurbring, ander dinge makliker gaan raak – jy sal sien!

SourceText: Give yourself credit for trying. A 5 minutes of fun activity with your child a day can make a BIG difference.
text: Gee jouself krediet vir jou poging. 'n Pretaktiwiteit van 5 minute per dag met jou kind kan 'n GROOT verskil maak.

SourceText: Life can get so busy sometimes, I know! If you start spending time together doing one small activity, it will get easier over time!
text: Ek weet die lewe kan soms so besig raak! As julle begin om een klein aktiwiteit saam te doen, sal dit makliker word mettertyd!

SourceText: In our busy lives, it's hard to focus on the positive. How many days in the past week have you praised your child? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)
text: Dis moeilik om op die positiewe te fokus in ons besige lewens. Hoeveel dae in die afgelope week het jy jou kind geprys? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

SourceText: We all sometimes feel like our children are causing more negativity than positivity. Try to see through negative attitudes and praise any positive behaviour you notice. With time, you will see the change!
text: Ons almal voel soms dat ons kinders meer negatiwiteit as positiwiteit veroorsaak. Probeer om deur die negatiewe houdings te kyk en enige positiewe gedrag wat jy raaksien, te prys. Mettertyd sal jy die verandering sien!

SourceText: This is a very stressful time for families. How many days in the past week did you feel very stressed as a parent/caregiver? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)
text: Dit is 'n baie stresvolle tyd vir gesinne. Hoeveel dae in die afgelope week het jy gestres gevoel as ouer/versorger? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

SourceText: Would you like a brief activity to help you with stress?
text: Wil jy 'n vinnige aktiwiteit hê om jou met stres te help?

SourceText: Would like a brief relaxing activity now?
text: Wil jy nou 'n kort ontspanningsaktiwiteit hê?

SourceText: Sometimes our children make us really upset. How many days in the past week did you shout, scream, or yell at your children? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)
text: Soms ontstel ons kinders ons baie. Op hoeveel dae die afgelope week het jy op jou kinders geskree of gegil? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

SourceText: It can be difficult to control our anger, especially when they make us really angry. Take a deep breath, and be proud of yourself when you manage to do it!
text: Dit kan moeilik wees om jou woede te beheer, veral wanneer hulle ons regtig kwaad maak. Haal diep asem, en wees trots op jouself as jy dit regkry!

SourceText: Sorry that you are having a difficult time with your child. It happens to all of us. Remember, we can choose to behave differently next time.
text: Jammer dat jy sukkel met jou kind. Dit gebeur met ons almal. Onthou, ons kan volgende keer kies hoe ons optree.

SourceText: Being a parent is not easy. Try to be patient with yourself and your family, and take some space if you need it. By talking about our challenges calmly, we can solve them together!
text: Dis nie maklik om 'n ouer te wees nie. Probeer om geduldig met jouself en jou gesin te wees, en vat 'n blaaskans as jy dit nodig het. Saam kan ons probleme oplos as ons kalm daaroor praat!

SourceText: Great work! When we respond calmly, our teens are more likely to do the same.
text: Mooi gedoen! As ons kalm reageer, sal ons tieners meer geneig wees om dieselfde te doen.

SourceText: Our children can really drive us crazy sometimes. By responding calmly, they will learn to do the same when something upsets them at home or outside. Your patience will pay off, you will see!
text: Ons kinders kan ons soms mal maak. As ons kalm reageer, sal hulle leer om dieselfde te doen wanneer iets by die huis of buite hulle ontstel. Jou geduld sal beloon word, jy sal sien!

SourceText: It is so stressful when children misbehave. How many days in the past week did you physically discipline your children by hitting, spanking, or slapping with your hand or an object like a stick or a belt? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)
text: Dis so stresvol as kinders stout of ongehoorsaam is. Hoeveel keer in die afgelope week het jy jou kinders fisies gedissiplineer deur hulle te klap, pak te gee of te slaan met jou hand of 'n voorwerp soos 'n stok of 'n belt? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

SourceText: We all struggle to stay calm sometimes. Take a deep breath and remember that mistakes are human. Talking to your child will help more in the end – you are an awesome parent!
text: Ons almal sukkel soms om kalm te bly. Haal diep asem en onthou dat alle mense foute maak. Op die ou end is dit beter om met jou kind te praat – jy is 'n ongelooflike ouer!

SourceText: It can be so difficult to keep calm when things get out of hand. Try again next time – each day is a new opportunity!
text: Dit kan so moeilik wees om kalm te bly as dinge hand uit ruk. Probeer volgende keer weer – elke dag is 'n nuwe geleentheid!

SourceText: It sounds like you are having a difficult time with your child. This can be really hard so be patient with yourself. Try to take a pause (even one deep breath!) next time and respond differently. You can do it!
text: Dit klink of jy deur 'n rowwe tyd met jou kind gaan. Dit kan regtig moeilik wees, so wees geduldig met jouself. Probeer volgende keer 'n blaaskans vat (al haal jy net een keer diep asem!) en anders reageer. Jy kan dit doen!

SourceText: Money is one of the biggest stresses for families now. How many days in the past week have you felt very worried or anxious about money? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)
text: Geld is een van die dinge wat nou die meeste stres by gesinne veroorsaak. Hoeveel dae die afgelope week het jy bekommerd of gespanne gevoel oor geld? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

SourceText: How many days in the past month (30 days) did you run out of money to pay for food? (0, 1, 2, 3, ... 30)?

SourceText: It can sometimes be difficult to have a positive relationship with our children. How confident do you feel about your ability as a parent/caregiver to have a positive relationship with your children? (0=not confident to 7=extremely confident)
text: Dis soms moeilik om 'n positiewe verhouding met ons kinders te hê. Hoe seker voel jy oor jou vermoë om as ouer/versorger 'n positiewe verhouding met jou kinders te hê? (0=nie seker nie tot 7=uiters seker)

SourceText: Having a positive relationship with our children can be difficult, especially during stressful times. You might want to try spending a little more One-on-One Time with your child. It will show them that they are valued and loved.
text: 'n Positiewe verhouding met ons kinders kan moeilik wees, veral in stresvolle tye. Dalk moet jy probeer om 'n bietjie meer Een-tot-Een-Tyd met jou kind te spandeer. Dit sal hulle wys dat jy hulle waardeer en liefhet.

SourceText: It is so wonderful to hear that you are able to maintain a positive relationship with your children. They really benefit from having you as a source of love and support in their lives.
text: Dit is so wonderlik om te hoor dat jy 'n positiewe verhouding met jou kinders kan handhaaf. Hulle trek beslis voordeel daardeur om jou as bron van liefde en steun in hulle lewe te hê.

SourceText: Bonus question: We all want to keep our children safe. In the past month, have you talked with your child about keeping safe from sexual violence online or offline? This could be when they are going out with friends, or talking about the websites they use.
text: Bonusvraag: Ons almal wil ons kinders veilig hou. Het jy die afgelope maand met jou kind gepraat oor veiligheid as dit kom by seksuele geweld aanlyn of elders? Dit kan wees as hulle saam met vriende uitgaan, of praat oor webwerwe wat hulle gebruik.

SourceText: Would you like to review the content?

SourceText: It can be hard to find time during your day, with work, chores, and everything else. Can you think of even 30 minutes this week to do this activity? It will make a big difference in keeping you safe online. You can do it!
text: Dit kan moeilik wees om deur die dag tyd te kry, met jou werk, huistake en alle ander dinge. Kan jy selfs aan 30 minute dink wanneer jy hierdie week die aktiwiteit kan doen? Dit kan 'n groot verskil maak om jou veilig aanlyn te hou. Jy kan dit doen!

SourceText: That is okay! Here is a list of some of the risks and dangers that you may encounter online:
text: Dit is oukei! Hier is 'n lys van 'n paar risiko’s en gevare wat jy aanlyn kan teëkom:

SourceText: • Adults targeting people for sexual purposes on social media, gaming, and messaging platforms.
text: • Volwassenes wat mense op sosiale media, rekenaarspeletjies en boodskap-platforms teiken vir seksuele doeleindes.

SourceText: • Harmful content – like violence, hating women, hating foreigners, encouraging suicide and self-harm, misinformation, pornography
text: • Skadelike inhoud – soos geweld, haat teen vroue, haat teen buitelanders, aanmoediging tot selfdood en selfskending, waninligting, pornografie

SourceText: • Sharing personal information and sexual photos or videos.
text: • Persoonlike inligting en seksuele foto’s of video’s wat gedeel word.

SourceText: • Cyberbullying from other people and strangers.
text: • Kuberboelies, hetsy mense wat jy ken of vreemdelinge.

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are finding this challenging. Here is a review on quick technical fixes:
text: Jammer om te hoor dis 'n uitdaging vir jou. Hier is 'n oorsig van vinnige tegniese verstellings:

SourceText: • Turn on SafeSearch on your browser to filter adult content.
text: • Skakel SafeSearch aan op jou blaaier om volwasse inhoud te filtreer.

SourceText: https://www.internetmatters.org/blog/parental-controls/entertainment-search-engines/
text: https://www.internetmatters.org/blog/parental-controls/entertainment-search-engines/

SourceText: • Set up parental controls.
text: • Stel ouerkontrole in.

SourceText: https://www.internetmatters.org/parental-controls/
text: https://www.internetmatters.org/parental-controls/

SourceText: • Set up strict privacy settings on online apps and games.
text: • Stel streng privaatheidsinstellings in op aanlyn toeps en speletjies.

SourceText: https://www.internetmatters.org/blog/parental-controls/social-media/
text: https://www.internetmatters.org/blog/parental-controls/social-media/

SourceText: • Cover webcams when not in use.
text: • Bedek webkameras wanneer jy dit nie gebruik nie.

SourceText: That is okay! Here are some websites where you can report to and seek help from:

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are finding this challenging. Try balancing the time that you spend online and offline. Set an amount of time that you can spend online and try it for a week. If you succeed, try adding a little bit more offline time every week. You can do this!

SourceText: It is completely normal to experience this. You don’t have to reveal the exact amount you earn; you could give an estimate. You could say, “In this household, we have this amount of money every month” rather than, “I make this amount of money”.
text: Dis heeltemal normaal om so te voel. Jy hoef nie die presiese bedrag te gee wat jy verdien nie; jy kan 'n skatting gee. Jy kan sê: "In hierdie huis het ons elke maand hierdie bedrag geld" eerder as: "Ek maak hierdie bedrag geld."

SourceText: It is completely normal to experience this challenge. People’s wants and needs are different sometimes. Talking about them together can help you and your family to understand each other, respect your differences, and see where you can compromise.
text: Dis heeltemal normaal om te voel dit is 'n uitdaging. Mense se behoeftes en begeertes verskil soms. Dis belangrik om saam daaroor te praat. Dit sal jou en jou gesin help om mekaar te verstaan, julle verskille te respekteer en te kyk waar julle toegewings kan maak.

SourceText: It is completely normal to experience this challenge. Try making the budget alone first and then try and include family members. Try reminding them that budgeting is important and it can help the family save money.
text: Dis heeltemal normaal om te voel dit is 'n uitdaging. Probeer eers om die begroting alleen op te stel en daarna gesinslede betrokke te kry. Probeer hulle herinner dat 'n begroting belangrik is en dat dit julle gesin kan help om geld te spaar.

SourceText: It can be hard to find time during your day, with work, chores, and everything else. Can you think of even 30 minutes this week to do this activity? You can even break each step up into shorter activities and spread it across the week. You can do it!
text: Dit kan moeilik wees om deur die dag tyd te kry, met jou werk, huistake en alle ander dinge. Kan jy selfs aan 30 minute dink wanneer jy hierdie week die aktiwiteit kan doen? Jy kan selfs elke stap opbreek in korter aktiwiteite en dit oor die week versprei. Jy kan dit doen!

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are finding this challenging! Try summarising what someone has said before responding: “What I hear you saying is…”. This will show them that you have listened to what they said and also gives them the chance to clarify anything that may have been misunderstood. This helps build effective communication skills.

Dit sal hulle wys jy luister na wat hulle sê en gee hulle ook die kans om enigiets wat jy dalk verkeerd verstaan het, op te klaar. Dit help om doeltreffende kommunikasievaardighede te bou.

SourceText: We completely understand! You can try by modeling behaviour that you want to see in others. How we talk and behave is a big influence on how our children behave too! Try to talk kindly to everyone in the family, adults and children...and see what happens!

SourceText: This programme is for parents and caregivers like you (aged 18 or older).
text: Hierdie program is vir ouers en versorgers soos jy (18 jaar en ouer).

SourceText: Over the next few weeks, you will receive messages to help you manage stress and maintain positive relationships at home.

SourceText: Your participation and any information you provide will be used anonymously by researchers to learn about how to better support families like yours.

SourceText: Name that tune
text: Liedjie-raai

SourceText: First person gets to choose or sing a song.
text: Eerste persoon kan 'n liedjie kies of sing.

SourceText: Everyone else must guess the name of the tune (to make it harder they can guess the singer).
text: Elkeen moet die naam van die liedjie raai (om dit moeiliker te maak, kan hulle die sanger raai).

SourceText: The first one to guess it right becomes the next leader who will choose or sing the next song.
text: Die eerste een wat reg raai word die volgende leier wat die volgende liedjie kan kies of sing.

SourceText: Hi @fields.user_name! How are you feeling?
text: Hi @fields.user_name! Hoe voel jy?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Hi! How are you feeling?
text: Hi! Hoe voel jy?

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are not having a good day. It is completely normal to be going through a difficult time now. Remember that you are not alone.
text: Jammer om te hoor jy het nie 'n lekker dag nie. Dit is heeltemal normaal om nou deur 'n rowwe tyd te gaan. Onthou, jy is nie alleen nie.

SourceText: Here's a video to help you get through the day!
text: Hier is 'n video om jou te help om deur die dag te kom!

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you get through the day!
text: Hier is 'n oudioboodskap om jou te help om deur die dag te kom!

SourceText: Here is a short activity that can help when you are feeling like needing some more support to get through the day.
text: Hier is 'n kort aktiwiteit wat jou kan help as dit voel of jy bietjie meer steun nodig het om deur die dag te kom.

SourceText: Recognise what is happening for you in this moment. What are you thinking? Are your thoughts positive or negative. How do you feel? Do you feel pleasant or unpleasant? How does your body feel? Do you feel tense or relaxed?
text: Erken waardeur jy gaan op hierdie oomblik. Waaraan dink jy? Is jou gedagtes positief of negatief. Hoe voel jy? Voel jy aangenaam of onaangenaam? Hoe voel jou liggaam? Voel jy gespanne of ontspanne?

SourceText: Sit comfortably and close your eyes. Connect to your heart in a kind and gentle way. You may want to place one hand on your heart or chest. Say the following words silently to yourself:
text: Sit gemaklik en maak jou oë toe. Raak op rustige manier bewus van wat in jou hart omgaan. Jy kan jou een hand op jou hart of bors sit. Sê die volgende woorde sag vir jouself:

SourceText: Take a moment to reflect on your experience. Notice if you feel any different.
text: Dink 'n oomblik na oor wat jy ervaar. Let op of jy enige verskil voel.

SourceText: May I be peaceful.
text: Mag ek rustig wees.

SourceText: May I be safe.
text: Mag ek veilig wees.

SourceText: May I be healthy.
text: Mag ek gesond wees.

SourceText: May I be happy.
text: Mag ek gelukkig wees.

SourceText: May there be love in my family.
text: Mag daar liefde in my gesin wees.

SourceText: May I feel loved.
text: Mag ek geliefd voel.

SourceText: Hi! Have you tried involving your partner when making decisions recently?
text: Hi! Het jy onlangs probeer om jou maat te betrek wanneer jy besluite neem?

SourceText: How was your experience?
text: Hoe het jy dit beleef?

SourceText: That is fantastic!
text: Dit is fantasties!

SourceText: Would you like to review the content on this?
text: Wil jy weer na die inhoud hieroor kyk?

SourceText: It can be difficult to find the time to ask our partners for their opinions when we are making decisions. Can you think of a time during the day when both you and your partner might be less busy, such as early in the morning or later in the evening?
text: Dit kan moeilik wees om tyd te kry om ons maats se opinie te vra wanneer ons besluite neem. Kan jy dink aan 'n tyd deur die dag wanneer jy en jou maat dalk minder besig is, soos vroeg in die oggend of laat in die aand?

SourceText: Sorry to hear that your partner reacted negatively. Be proud of yourself for trying and be gentle with yourself. Remember you can always get extra support by typing "Help".
text: Jammer om te hoor jou maat het negatief gereageer. Wees trots op jouself dat jy probeer het en moenie hard wees op jouself nie. Onthou, jy kan altyd ekstra ondersteuning kry deur "Help" te tik.

SourceText: It can sometimes be hard to know how to involve your partner when making a decision. Sometimes all you need to do is to ask them what they think. This shows them you care and want them to be involved!
text: Mens weet nie altyd hoe om jou maat te betrek wanneer jy 'n besluit neem nie. Soms is al wat jy moet doen om hulle te vra wat hulle dink. Dit wys vir hulle dat jy omgee en hulle wil betrek!

SourceText: It can be hard to remember to involve our partners in decision making. If you forget, it’s important to try again! Asking them for their opinion shows them that you care and want them to be involved.
text: Mens sukkel soms om te onthou om ons maats te betrek in besluitneming. As jy vergeet is dit belangrik om weer te probeer! As jy hulle opinie vra, wys dit vir hulle dat jy omgee en hulle wil betrek.

SourceText: It can take time to get used to making decisions together. Give yourself time to adjust. Remember that by communicating with your partner and involving them in decision-making, they will start to feel more comfortable doing so too.
text: Dit kan tyd neem om daaraan gewoond te raak om besluite saam te neem. Gun jouself tyd om aan te pas. Onthou, wanneer jy met jou maat kommunikeer en hulle by besluitneming betrek, gaan hulle meer gemaklik hiermee begin voel.

SourceText: We are sorry to hear this. What did you find difficult when trying to involve your partner in making a decision?
text: Ons is jammer om dit te hoor. Wat was vir jou moeilik toe jy probeer het om jou maat in besluitneming te betrek?

SourceText: I am sorry to hear this. What did you find difficult when trying to involve your partner in making a decision?

SourceText: Notice where you feel it in your body. Notice what thoughts are connected to that feeling. Take a deep breath.
text: Let op waar jy dit in jou liggaam voel. Let op na die gedagtes wat saam met hierdie gevoel kom. Haal diep asem.

SourceText: Thank yourself for taking the time to check in with your feelings and thoughts! Remember, you can always type "Help" at anytime if you need an activity to help you relax or reduce stress. Chat later!

SourceText: Would you like to learn more about this tip?
text: Wil jy graag meer uitvind oor hierdie wenk?

SourceText: Here's an audio message to guide you through a fun physical activity!
text: Hier is 'n oudioboodskap om jou deur 'n lekker fisiese aktiwiteit te begelei!

SourceText: Stand up and stretch your arms up like you are reaching to the sky. Pretend to push away any clouds and let the sun shine down on you. Stretch to both sides. Stretch to the front and to the back.
text: Staan op en strek jou arms boontoe asof jy na die lug reik. Maak of jy wolke wegstoot en laat die son op jou skyn. Strek na albei kante toe. Strek vorentoe en agtertoe.

SourceText: Here's a fun video of a physical activity that can help you release stress and keep healthy!
text: Hier is 'n lekker video van 'n fisiese aktiwiteit wat jou kan help om stres te verlig en gesond te bly!

SourceText: Let your hand hang by your side. As you breathe in, squeeze your shoulders tightly up to your ears, scrunch your eyes and face, and hold your breath. Release your breath and then relax your shoulders and body.
text: Laat jou hand langs jou sy hang. Trek jou skouers op tot by jou ore terwyl jy inasem, knyp jou oë styf toe, trek jou gesigspiere saam en hou asem op. Asem uit en ontspan jou skouers en lyf.

SourceText: Relax your arms and let your arms swing sideways, and turn your upper body. Your arms should gently hit your back as you twist from side to side.
text: Ontspan jou arms en swaai hulle kante toe, en draai jou bolyf heen en weer. Jou arms moet liggies teen jou rug slaan soos jy heen en weer draai.

SourceText: Place one foot in front of the other and make small circles from ankles, remember to turn to both sides. Do each foot with four circles in each direction.
text: Sit een voet voor die ander en maak klein sirkelbewegings met jou enkels, na albei kante toe. Doen vier sirkels in elke rigting met albei voete.

SourceText: Now shake your whole body as fast as you can. Shake it up high! Shake it down low! Shake it all around!
text: Skud nou jou hele liggaam so vinnig as wat jy kan. Skud dit hoog! Skud dit laag! Skud dit heen en weer!

SourceText: Close your eyes and raise your arms slowly above your head as you breathe in. Lower your arms slowly to your side as you breathe out.
text: Maak jou oë toe en lig jou arms stadig bo jou kop soos jy inasem. Laat sak jou arms stadig tot langs jou sye soos jy uitasem.

SourceText: Would you like some  other relaxation activities?
text: Wil jy graag ander ontspanningsoefeninge hê?

SourceText: Take a moment to reflect on your experience.
text: Dink 'n oomblik na oor wat jy ervaar.

SourceText: Sometimes it can be hard to find time during the day. Can you think of a time when you’re less busy? For example, maybe it is easier to help out with housework later in the evening when some of the children have gone to sleep. Try to see what works for you!
text: Soms is dit moeilik om tyd te maak deur die dag. Kan jy aan 'n tyd dink wanneer jy minder besig is? Byvoorbeeld, dis dalk makliker om later in die aand met huistake te help wanneer sommige van die kinders al gaan slaap het. Vind uit wat werk vir jou!

SourceText: Ask them! By telling your partner you want to help out but don’t know how, you are showing them you care and are interested in being involved. This can also help family members understand each other better.
text: Vra hulle! As jy vir jou maat sê jy wil uithelp maar weet nie hoe nie, wys jy vir hulle jy gee om en stel belang om betrokke te wees. Dit kan gesinslede ook help om mekaar beter te verstaan.

SourceText: It can be difficult to remember to ask others what they need help with. Once you start offering to help however, others may realise you want to be involved and may ask for help when they need it!
text: Mens sukkel soms om te onthou om ander te vra of hulle hulp met iets nodig het. Sodra jy begin aanbied om te help, sal ander dalk agterkom jy wil betrokke wees en dalk vir hulp vra wanneer hulle dit nodig het!

SourceText: It can be hard to ask for help. Sometimes we expect our partners to know we need help even if we don’t ask them. Once you start telling however, they will likely start offering to help more often in the future.
text: Mens sukkel soms om hulp te vra. Soms verwag ons van ons maats om te weet ons het hulp nodig selfs al vra ons hulle nie. Sodra jy hulle egter sê, sal hulle waarskynlik in die toekoms meer dikwels aanbied om te help.

SourceText: Be kind to yourself - trying something new is often hard at first! Give yourself time to adjust. Also remind yourself that helping your partner with these tasks benefits the whole family!
text: Wees jouself goedgesind – om iets nuuts te probeer, is dikwels moeilik aan die begin! Gun jouself tyd om aan te pas. Herinner jouself ook daaraan dat die hele gesin voordeel trek wanneer jy jou maat met hierdie take help!

SourceText: It looks like you are facing an emergency. Can you please tell us what kind of assistance you require?
text: Dit lyk of jy in nood is. Kan jy asseblief vir ons sê watter soort hulp jy benodig?

SourceText: Type "SOS" at any time if you would like the details of any other emergency service or hotline. Remember everything you say will be completely private!
text: Tik "SOS" enige tyd as jy die besonderhede wil hê van enige nooddiens of blitslyn. Onthou, alles wat jy sê is heeltemal privaat!

SourceText: Let's take a pause together! Take a deep breath and ask yourself, "What am I thinking?"
text: Kom ons vat saam 'n blaaskans! Haal diep asem en vra jouself: "Wat dink ek?"

SourceText: Notice if your thoughts are positive or negative. Notice if your emotions are pleasant or unpleasant. Whatever you are feeling, it is okay. Notice how your body feels. Notice anything that hurts or is tense.
text: Let op of jou gedagtes positief of negatief is. Let op of jou emosies aangenaam of onaangenaam is. Wat jy ook al voel, dit is oukei. Let op hoe jou liggaam voel. Let op na enigiets wat seer of gespanne is.

SourceText: Focus on your breath as it goes in and out. Do this for about 10 breaths.
text: Fokus op jou asemhaling soos dit in en uit gaan. Doen dit vir ongeveer 10 asemteue.

SourceText: Now, expand your awareness to your whole body. Listen to the sounds in the room.
text: Laat jou bewustheid nou uitbrei na jou hele liggaam. Luister na die klanke in die kamer.

SourceText: Take a moment to reflect on whether you feel any different.
text: Dink 'n oomblik na of jy enige verskil voel.

SourceText: Here's a video about how to keep calm and manage stress in our busy lives.
text: Hier is 'n video oor hoe om kalm te bly en stres te hanteer in jou besige lewe.

SourceText: Taking a Pause is a simple relaxation activity that you can do whenever you are feeling stressed or worried. It can also be helpful when you find your child is irritating you or has done something wrong.
text: 'n Blaaskans is 'n eenvoudige ontspanningsaktiwiteit wat jy kan doen wanneer jy ook al gestres of bekommerd voel. Dit kan ook help wanneer jou kind jou irriteer of iets verkeerd gedoen het.

SourceText: Here is a comic to remind you of taking a pause!
text: Hier is 'n strokiesprent om jou te herinner om 'n blaaskans te vat!

SourceText: “How am I going to get through this?”
text: "Hoe gaan ek hierdeur kom?"

SourceText: “Whatever it is, I am okay.”
text: "Wat dit ook al is, ek is oukei."

SourceText: “Breathe in. Breathe out."
text: "Asem in. Asem uit."

SourceText: “I can do this. We will get through it together.”
text: "Ek kan dit doen. Ons sal saam hierdeur kom."

SourceText: Chat later!
text: Praat later!

SourceText: Well done for Taking a Pause @fields.user_name. You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Over the next few days, try taking a pause whenever you are feeling stressed. It gives you a chance to be calmer. Even a few deep breaths or connecting with the ground beneath you can make a difference. You can also Take a Pause with your Child!
text: Mooi so dat jy 'n Blaaskans gevat het @fields.user_name. Jy het nog 'n vaardigheid by jou Ouerskap-gereedskapkis gevoeg! Probeer om oor die volgende paar dae 'n blaaskans te vat wanneer jy ook al gestres voel. Dit gee jou kans om rustig te raak. Selfs 'n paar diep asemteue of bewustheid van die grond onder jou voete kan 'n verskil maak. Jy kan ook 'n Blaaskans saam met jou Kind vat!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

text: Jy het nie toestemming gegee om aan hierdie program deel te neem nie. Wil jy graag deelneem?

text: Wil jy graag weer by die program aansluit?

text: Wil jy van die begin af begin of wil jy begin van waar jy laas die program verlaat het?

text: As jy ooit besluit om aan die program deel te neem, tik "BEGIN_BOODSKAPPE".

SourceText: We hope to see you again soon, and we wish you a happy and peaceful day!
text: Ons hoop ons sien jou gou weer, en ons hoop jy het 'n lekker en rustige dag!

SourceText: Hi @fields.user_name! Were you able to spend 5 minutes or more of One-on-One Time with your children today?
text: Hi @fields.user_name! Kon jy 5 minute of meer Een-tot-Een-Tyd met jou kinders vandag spandeer?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Hi! Were you able to spend 5 minutes or more of One-on-One Time with your children today?
text: Hi! Kon jy 5 minute of meer Een-tot-Een-Tyd met jou kinders vandag spandeer?

SourceText: Wonderful! Spending One-on-One Time with your children may make them more willing to help out more often. You are doing great!
text: Wonderlik! Een-tot-Een-Tyd met jou kinders kan hulle meer gewillig maak om jou meer dikwels uit te help. Jy vaar uitstekend!

SourceText: We understand that spending One-on-One Time can sometimes be difficult. Here are some of the main reasons parents struggle. Which one is the closest to you?
text: Ons verstaan dis soms moeilik om Een-tot-Een-Tyd te hê. Hier is van die hoofredes waarom ouers sukkel. Watter een is die meeste soos jy?

SourceText: It can be hard to find time during your day, with work, chores, and everything else. Can you think of a time each day that you can make 5 minutes or a bit more? You can even make household chores into a game to do together. Even 5 minutes can make a big difference!
text: Dit kan moeilik wees om deur die dag tyd te kry, met jou werk, huistake en alle ander dinge. Kan jy dink aan 'n tyd elke dag wat jy 5 minute of 'n bietjie meer kan maak? Jy kan selfs huistake in 'n speletjie omskep om saam te doen. Selfs 5 minute kan 'n groot verskil maak!

SourceText: Children often want to spend time watching T.V. or playing with a gadget. Sometimes you might want to give them some other fun options to do instead (Type: "Help" if you want a suggestion).
text: Kinders wil dikwels tyd spandeer deur TV te kyk of met 'n toestelletjie (‘gadget’) te speel. Soms kan jy vir hulle ander lekker opsies gee om eerder te doen (Tik: "Help" as jy 'n voorstel wil hê).

SourceText: It can make you feel bad if your children do not want to spend One-on-One Time with you. Think to yourself: When are they more open to you? Maybe in the morning or right before bedtime.
text: Mens kan sleg voel as jou kinders nie Een-tot-Een-Tyd met jou wil spandeer nie. Dink by jouself: Wanneer is hulle meer oop teenoor jou? Dalk in die oggend of net voor slaaptyd.

SourceText: Competitive games can be challenging for children (and adults!) if they have difficulty losing. You may want to suggest other activities that you can play together instead of against each other (Type "Help" if you want a suggestion").
text: Kompeterende speletjies kan 'n probleem wees vir kinders (en volwassenes!) as hulle sukkel om te verloor. Jy kan dalk ander aktiwiteite voorstel wat julle saam kan speel in plaas van teen mekaar (Tik "Help" as jy 'n voorstel wil hê).

SourceText: Sometimes our children will suggest activities that are violent or unsafe. Explain why they can't, and try suggesting alternative activities that would be more appropriate. Type "Help" if you want a suggestion.
text: Soms stel ons kinders aktiwiteite voor wat gewelddadig of onveilig is. Verduidelik waarom hulle nie kan nie, en probeer 'n alternatiewe aktiwiteit voorstel wat meer geskik is. Tik "Help" as jy 'n voorstel wil hê.

SourceText: It can be difficult to spend One-on-One Time with each one child when you have more than one child. If possible, you can ask another adult or older sibling to look after the other children while you spend One-on-One Time with one child.
text: Een-tot-Een-Tyd met elke kind kan moeilik wees as jy meer as een kind het. Indien moontlik kan jy 'n ander volwassene of ouer sibbe vra om na die ander kinders om te sien terwyl jy Een-tot-Een-Tyd met een kind het.

SourceText: We are sorry to hear that you have been having some difficulties spending One-on-One Time with your children. Please type "Help" for other advice that might be of use to you. Thank you for trying your best!
text: Ons is jammer om te hoor dat jy gesukkel het om Een-tot-Een-Tyd met jou kinders te spandeer. Tik asseblief "Help" vir ander raad wat nuttig kan wees vir jou. Dankie dat jy jou bes probeer!

SourceText: You can also think of times when it would be easier to spend One-on-One Time each child, like later in the evening with an older child after the others have gone to sleep.
text: Jy kan ook dink aan tye wanneer Een-tot-Een-Tyd met elke kind makliker sal wees, soos laat in die aand met 'n ouer kind terwyl die ander gaan slaap het.

SourceText: You can also spend One-on-One Time with all of your children at once!
text: Jy kan ook Een-tot-Een-Tyd met al jou kinders op een slag spandeer!

SourceText: Type "Help" for activities that you can do as a whole family
text: Tik "Help" vir aktiwiteite wat julle as 'n hele gesin kan saam doen

SourceText: Only give the transition warning once. When One-on-One Time is over, thank @fields.child_nickname for spending time with you. Then enthusiastically redirect @fields.child_nickname to the next activity like washing hands before dinner.

SourceText: Today's tip is about spending One-on-One Time with Our Children.
text: Vandag se wenk is oor Een-tot-Een-Tyd met Ons Kinders.

SourceText: Children learn through play! Here is a comic about spending one-on-one time with your baby!
text: Kinders leer deur te speel! Hier is 'n strokiesprent oor een-tot-een-tyd met jou baba!

SourceText: Parent: "Such a strong baby you are."
text: Ouer: "Jy is so 'n sterk baba."

SourceText: Parent: "We are making a delicious meal together."
text: Ouer: "Ons maak sulke lekker kos saam."

SourceText: Parent: “Here I am?”
text: Ouer: "Hier is ek?"

SourceText: Baby: "Ha ha ha!"
text: Baba: "Ha ha ha!"

SourceText: Parent: "Wow! You have stacked 3 blocks on top of each other. Well done!"
text: Ouer: "Sjoe! Jy het 3 blokkies opmekaar gepak. Mooi gedoen!"

SourceText: I know that you have already received this tip (well done!).Would you like to review it again?
text: Ek weet jy het reeds hierdie wenk gekry (wel gedaan!). Wil jy weer daarna kyk?

SourceText: Invest in One-on-One Time! The more time you spend with your children, the more likely they will listen to you and behave well at other times. It really works!
text: Belê in Een-tot-Een-Tyd! Hoe meer tyd jy met jou kinders spandeer, hoe meer geneig sal hulle wees om na jou te luister en hulle te gedra. Dit werk regtig!

SourceText: That's okay! You can always type "Help" if you want to receive more tips about how to manage your child's behaviour.
text: Dis oukei! Jy kan altyd "Help" tik as jy meer wenke wil kry oor hoe om jou kind se gedrag te hanteer.

SourceText: The first 1000 days of life are a window of opportunity for your baby. It is when their brain develops faster than any other time in their life. When you spend time with your baby, you build a healthy attachment between you both that will make them feel secure and loved.
text: Die eerste 1000 dae van die lewe is 'n venster van geleentheid vir jou baba. Dit is wanneer hulle brein vinniger ontwikkel as enige ander tyd in hulle lewe. Wanneer jy tyd met jou baba spandeer, bou jy 'n gesonde band tussen julle twee wat hulle veilig en gelief sal laat voel.

SourceText: Here are 7 easy tips to make One-on-One Time with your baby a success:
text: Hier is 7 maklike wenke om Een-tot-Een-Tyd met jou baba 'n sukses te maak:

SourceText: 1. Do it every day
text: 1. Doen dit elke dag

SourceText: 2. Be close to your baby
text: 2. Behou fisiese kontak met jou baba

SourceText: 3. Let your baby take the lead
text: 3. Laat jou baba die leiding neem

SourceText: 4. Observe and listen to your child
text: 4. Neem waar en luister na jou kind

SourceText: 5. Play with your baby
text: 5. Speel met jou baba

SourceText: 6. Talk to your baby
text: 6. Praat met jou baba

SourceText: 7. You can have quality time with your baby anytime!
text: 7. Jy kan enige tyd gehaltetyd met jou baba hê!

SourceText: To learn more about one of these tips, type "1" to "7". You can also type "N" to move on.
text: Om meer uit te vind oor hierdie wenke, tik "1" tot "7". Jy kan ook "N" tik en aanbeweeg.

SourceText: 2. Be close to your child.
text: 2. Behou fisiese kontak met jou kind.

SourceText: Skin-to-skin contact is especially important for new-borns and infants. For older toddlers, make sure you are at the same level as they are.
text: Vel-teen-vel-kontak is veral belangrik vir pasgeborenes en babas. Vir ouer kleuters moet jy seker maak jy is ooghoogte met hulle.

SourceText: Children need to do things in their own time. Try to give them time to explore and be patient. Remember that the world is brand new to your child!
text: Kinders moet dinge op hulle eie tyd kan doen. Probeer hulle tyd gee om te verken, en wees geduldig. Onthou dat die wêreld heeltemal nuut is vir jou kind!

SourceText: Use words to describe actions, colours, shapes, numbers, sizes, textures, temperatures, tastes, sounds, and anything else that is happening. Speak with enthusiasm when describing what your child is doing. Here is a comic on how to communicate with your baby.
text: Gebruik woorde om dinge te beskryf soos aksies, kleure, vorms, getalle, groottes, teksture, temperatuur, smake, klanke en enige iets anders wat gebeur. Praat entoesiasties wanneer jy beskryf wat jou kind besig is om te doen. Hier is 'n strokiesprent van hoe om met jou baba te kommunikeer.

SourceText: Parent: "You are such a beautiful person"
text: Ouer: "Jy is so 'n fraaie mensie"

SourceText: Parent: "Buh, buh, buh, big baby!"
text: Ouer: "Boe, boe, boe, groot baba!"

SourceText: Baby: "Buh, buh, buh…"
text: Baba: "Boe, boe, boe…"

SourceText: Parent: "And then there were two green parrots in the mango tree!"
text: Ouer: "En toe was daar twee groen papegaaie in die mangoboom!"

SourceText: Parent: "And now I am cleaning your toes, and your feet, and your knees…"
text: Ouer: "En nou maak ek jou toontjies skoon, en jou voetjies, en jou knietjies..."

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to spend One-on-One Time with your baby:
text: Kies asseblief 'n ander nommer as jy meer wil uitvind oor Een-tot-Een-Tyd met jou baba:

SourceText: You can also type "N" to move on.
text: Jy kan ook "N" tik en aanbeweeg.

SourceText: Would you like some suggestions for activities to do with your baby?
text: Wil jy graag voorstelle hê vir aktiwiteite saam met jou baba?

SourceText: That's okay! You can always type "Help" at anytime if you need an activity.
text: Dis oukei! Jy kan altyd "Help" tik enige tyd as jy 'n aktiwiteit nodig het.

SourceText: It is normal for men of the family to struggle to think of what to do with their babies, especially when it seems they just eat, sleep, cry, poop, and repeat. It can be especially challenging when your baby is very young and not able to talk to you.
text: Alle mans in die gesin sukkel soms om te dink wat om met hulle babas te doen, veral as dit lyk of babas net heeltyd eet, slaap, huil en doeke vuilmaak. Dit kan veral moeilik wees as jou baba baie klein is en nie met jou kan praat nie.

SourceText: It is normal for mothers to struggle to think of what to do with their babies, especially when it seems they just eat, sleep, cry, poop, and repeat. It can be especially challenging when your baby is very young and not able to talk to you.
text: Alle vrouens sukkel soms om te dink wat om met hulle babas te doen, veral as dit lyk of babas net heeltyd eet, slaap, huil en doeke vuilmaak. Dit kan veral moeilik wees as jou baba baie klein is en nie met jou kan praat nie.

SourceText: It is normal to struggle to think of what to do with our babies, especially when it seems they just eat, sleep, cry, poop, and repeat. It can be especially challenging when your baby is very young and not able to talk to you.
text: Ons almal sukkel soms om te dink wat om met ons babas te doen, veral as dit lyk of babas net heeltyd eet, slaap, huil en doeke vuilmaak. Dit kan veral moeilik wees as jou baba baie klein is en nie met jou kan praat nie.

SourceText: That's okay! You can always type "Help" whenever you want to learn more about how to spend One-on-One Time with your baby. Chat to you later @fields.user_name!

note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: That's okay! You can always type "Help" whenever you want to learn more about how to spend One-on-One Time with your baby. Chat to you later!
text: Dis oukei! Jy kan altyd "Help" tik wanneer jy ook al meer wil uitvind oor hoe om Een-tot-Een-Tyd met jou baba te spandeer. Ons praat later!

SourceText: 1. Do it every day!
text: 1. Doen dit elke dag!

SourceText: Try to spend time playing with @fields.child_nickname every day for at least 20 minutes where you are giving them your full attention. Choose a time when you are unlikely to be interrupted. Switch off the television and put away phones.
text: Probeer om elke dag vir ten minste 20 minute met @fields.child_nickname te speel waar jy jou volle aandag gee. Kies 'n tyd wanneer julle nie sommer onderbreek sal word nie. Skakel die televisie af en sit fone weg.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Try to spend time playing with your baby every day for at least 20 minutes where you are giving them your full attention. Choose a time when you are unlikely to be interrupted. Switch off the television and put away phones.

SourceText: 4. Observe your child.
text: 4. Hou jou kind dop.

SourceText: See what facial expressions @fields.child_nickname is making. Notice what @fields.child_nickname is interested in or looking at.
text: Kyk watter gesigsuitdrukkings @fields.child_nickname maak. Let op waarin @fields.child_nickname belangstel of waarna hulle kyk.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: See what facial expressions your child is making. Notice what your child is interested in or looking at.
text: Kyk watter gesigsuitdrukkings jou kind maak. Let op waarin jou kind belangstel of waarna hulle kyk.

SourceText: Give just enough help to let it be the child’s achievement. It is okay to play alongside and copy what they are doing but try to let them keep the initiative. If @fields.child_nickname gets frustrated, you can reassure @fields.child_nickname by gently stroking their back.
text: Gee net genoeg hulp sodat dit die kind se prestasie kan wees. Dit is oukei om langsaan te speel en na te boots wat hulle doen, maar laat hulle die inisiatief behou. As @fields.child_nickname gefrustreerd raak, kan jy @fields.child_nickname gerusstel deur hulle rug saggies te vryf.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Give just enough help to let it be the child’s achievement. It is okay to play alongside and copy what they are doing but try to let them keep the initiative. If your child gets frustrated, you can reassure your child by gently stroking their back.
text: Gee net genoeg hulp sodat dit die kind se prestasie kan wees. Dit is oukei om langsaan te speel en na te boots wat hulle doen, maar laat hulle die inisiatief behou. As jou kind gefrustreerd raak, kan jy jou kind gerusstel deur hulle rug saggies te vryf.

SourceText: Listen to the sounds or words @fields.child_nickname is making. You can even make the same sounds by copying @fields.child_nickname!
text: Luister na die klanke of woorde wat @fields.child_nickname maak. Jy kan selfs dieselfde klanke maak deur @fields.child_nickname na te boots!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Listen to the sounds or words your child is making. You can even make the same sounds by copying your child!
text: Luister na die klanke of woorde wat jou kind maak. Jy kan selfs dieselfde klanke maak deur jou kind na te boots!

SourceText: Babies learn through play! Help your child explore the world through the five senses. Let @fields.child_nickname use all of their senses when exploring the world. Sometimes when you read to @fields.child_nickname, @fields.child_nickname will want to put the book in their mouth. That is okay!
text: Babas leer deur te speel! Help jou kind om die wêreld deur hulle vyf sintuie te verken. Laat @fields.child_nickname al hulle sintuie gebruik wanneer hulle die wêreld verken. Soms wanneer jy vir @fields.child_nickname lees, sal @fields.child_nickname die boek in hulle mond wil sit. Dit is oukei!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Babies learn through play! Help your child explore the world through the five senses. Let your child use all of their senses when exploring the world. Sometimes when you read to your child, your child will want to put the book in their mouth. That is okay!
text: Babas leer deur te speel! Help jou kind om die wêreld deur hulle vyf sintuie te verken. Laat jou kind al hulle sintuie gebruik wanneer hulle die wêreld verken. Soms wanneer jy vir jou kind lees, sal jou kind die boek in hulle mond wil sit. Dit is oukei!

SourceText: Start talking to @fields.child_nickname from the moment they are born (even before when they are in the womb). Did you know @fields.child_nickname can even recognise their name at a very early age? Try saying your baby's name and notice how they respond!
text: Begin met @fields.child_nickname praat die oomblik wanneer hulle gebore is (selfs voor, wanneer hulle in die baarmoeder is). Het jy geweet @fields.child_nickname kan selfs hulle naam op 'n baie vroeë ouderdom herken? Sê bietjie jou baba se naam en kyk hoe hulle reageer!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Start talking to your baby from the moment they are born (even before when they are in the womb). Did you know your baby can even recognise their name at a very early age? Try saying your baby's name and notice how they respond!
text: Begin met jou baba praat die oomblik wanneer hulle gebore is (selfs voor dit, wanneer hulle in die baarmoeder is). Het jy geweet jou baba kan selfs hulle naam op 'n baie vroeë ouderdom herken? Sê bietjie jou baba se naam en kyk hoe hulle reageer!

SourceText: It is okay for @fields.child_nickname to want to do many different things. @fields.child_nickname’s attention may wander to many different things during One-on-One Time. Anything that is happening can grab their attention: the sound of a siren, the feeling of a breeze, feelings in the body. Just keep your attention on @fields.child_nickname.
text: Dit is oukei as @fields.child_nickname baie verskillende dinge wil doen. @fields.child_nickname se aandag kan gedurende Een-tot-Een-Tyd na baie verskillende dinge afdwaal. Enigiets wat gebeur kan hulle aandag trek: die klank van 'n sirene, 'n bries wat oor hulle waai, gevoelens in die liggaam. Hou jou aandag op @fields.child_nickname. gefokus.

SourceText: Well done @fields.user_name! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit. Over the next few days, try spending at least 5 minutes of One-on-One Time with your baby. Quality time is the best gift that you can ever give your child!

SourceText: Here is a comic on spending one-on-one time with your child.
text: Hier is 'n strokiesprent oor een-tot-een-tyd met jou kind.

SourceText: Child: “I’m bored! There is nothing to do.”
text: Kind: "Ek’s verveeld! Daar’s niks om te doen nie."

SourceText: Parent: “Let’s do something together! How about we make some drawings and put them on the gate with messages for people to see?”
text: Ouer: "Kom ons doen iets saam! Hoekom teken ons nie 'n paar prente met boodskappe nie, en dan plak ons dit buite op die hek vir mense om te sien?"

SourceText: Children: “Okay!”
text: Kinders: "Oukei!"

SourceText: Parent: “You make the pictures and I’ll write the messages”
text: Ouer: "Teken julle die prente en dan skryf ek die boodskappe"

SourceText: Child: “Sure!”
text: Kind: "Dis reg!"

SourceText: Parent: "Remember to wash hands! We love our neighbours!”
text: Ouer: "Onthou om hande te was! Ons is mal oor ons bure!"

SourceText: Hi @fields.user_name! Have you tried sharing family responsibilities at home recently?
text: Hi @fields.user_name! Het jy onlangs probeer om gesinsverantwoordelikhede te deel?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Hi! Have you tried sharing family responsibilities at home recently?
text: Hi! Het jy onlangs probeer om gesinsverantwoordelikhede te deel?

SourceText: This can be hard to remember! Establishing a routine around caregiving or housework tasks can sometimes be helpful. This also lets you talk to your partner or other adults about how to share the workload.
text: Mens sukkel soms om dit te onthou! Soms kan dit help om 'n roetine vir versorging- of huistake vas te stel. Dit laat jou ook met jou maat of ander volwassenes praat oor hoe om die werkslading te deel.

SourceText: It is hard to remember to ask for help. Be kind to yourself if you forget to ask and try again another time. Asking for help and sharing family responsibilities benefits the whole family!
text: Mens sukkel om te onthou om hulp te vra. Moenie hard wees op jouself as jy vergeet om te vra nie – probeer volgende keer weer. Om hulp te vra en gesinsverantwoordelikhede te deel strek die hele gesin tot voordeel!

SourceText: It can be difficult to know how to ask for help. Try starting off with suggesting a task you would like help with. Being specific gives your partner a clearer idea of what they can support you with.
text: Mens weet soms nie hoe om hulp te vra. Begin deur 'n voorstel te maak vir 'n taak waarmee jy graag hulp wil hê. Hoe meer spesifiek jy is, hoe duideliker sal jou maat weet waarmee hulle jou kan ondersteun.

SourceText: Trying something new can be hard! To make it easier, ask your partner to do it together with you the first few times. Soon you’ll feel more confident doing it on your own!
text: Dit kan moeilik wees om iets nuuts te probeer! Vra jou maat om dit die eerste paar keer saam met jou te doen – dit sal dinge makliker maak. Jy sal gou meer selfvertroue hê om dit op jou eie te doen!

SourceText: Talk to them! Talking with your partner about how you can share family responsibilities helps both of you understand each other better. It also shows that you care!
text: Praat met hulle! As jy met jou maat praat oor hoe julle die gesinsverantwoordelikhede kan deel, sal julle mekaar beter begin verstaan. Dit wys ook dat jy omgee!

SourceText: It can be difficult to find time during the day sometimes! Can you think of a time when your partner might be less busy, such as early in the morning or later in the evening? Creating a routine around housework can also be helpful.
text: Mens sukkel soms om tyd te kry gedurende die dag! Kan jy aan 'n tyd dink wanneer jou maat minder besig gaan wees, soos vroeg in die oggend of laat in die aand? 'n Roetine vir huistake kan ook nuttig wees.

SourceText: Sharing responsibilities in the home benefits everyone! While trying something new can feel hard at first, soon you will start to feel more comfortable. If it helps, ask your partner to join you in the beginning!
text: Om verantwoordelikhede in die huis te deel, strek almal tot voordeel! Alhoewel dit aan die begin soms moeilik is om iets nuuts te probeer, sal jy gou begin om meer gemaklik te voel. As dit help, vra jou maat om aan die begin saam met jou in te spring!

SourceText: Excellent job @fields.user_name! Sharing the workload benefits the whole family. How was your experience?
text: Uitstekende werk @fields.user_name! Om die werkslading te deel, strek die hele gesin tot voordeel. Hoe het jy dit beleef?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Excellent job! Sharing the workload benefits the whole family. How was your experience?
text: Uitstekende werk! Om die werkslading te deel, strek die hele gesin tot voordeel. Hoe het jy dit beleef?

SourceText: We are sorry to hear this. What was difficult for you about sharing family responsibilities?
text: Ons is jammer om dit te hoor. Wat was vir jou moeilik toe jy gesinsverantwoordelikhede wou deel?

SourceText: I am sorry to hear this. What was difficult for you about sharing family responsibilities?
text: Ek is jammer om dit te hoor. Wat was vir jou moeilik toe jy gesinsverantwoordelikhede wou deel?

SourceText: Hi! Thank you for signing up to receive ParentText tips. Please tell us which language you would like:
text: Hi! Dankie dat jy aangesluit het om ParentText-wenke te kry. Sê asseblief vir ons watter taal jy verkies:

SourceText: Hi! Thank you for signing up to receive ParentText tips. Please tell me which language you would like:
text: Hi! Dankie dat jy aangesluit het om ParentText-wenke te kry. Sê asseblief vir my watter taal jy verkies:

SourceText: How did you find out about ParentText?
text: Hoe het jy van ParentText te hore gekom?

SourceText: Stand up and stretch your arms up to the sky. Push away any clouds and let the Sunshine of Positive Attention shine down on you. Stretch to both sides. Stretch to the front and to the back.
text: Staan op en strek jou arms in die lug op. Stoot die wolke weg en laat die Son van Positiewe Aandag oor jou skyn. Strek na albei kante toe. Strek vorentoe en agtertoe.

SourceText: Place one foot in front of the other and make small circles from your ankles. Remember to turn your foot to both sides - to the left and then to the right. Do each foot with four circles in each direction.
text: Sit een voet voor die ander en maak klein sirkeltjies met jou enkels. Onthou om jou voet albei kante toe te draai – links en dan na regs. Doen vier sirkels in elke rigting met albei voete.

SourceText: Let your hand hang by your side. As you breathe in, squeeze your shoulders up to your ears, scrunch your eyes, and hold your breath. Release your shoulders as you breathe out and relax your body.
text: Laat jou hand langs jou sy hang. Trek jou skouers op tot by jou ore terwyl jy inasem, knyp jou oë styf toe, trek jou gesigspiere saam en hou asem op. Ontspan jou skouers terwyl jy uitasem en jou liggaam laat ontspan.

SourceText: Close your eyes and raise your arms slowly above your head as you breathe in. Lower your arms slowly to your side as you breathe out. Repeat 4 times.
text: Maak jou oë toe en lig jou arms stadig bo jou kop soos jy inasem. Laat sak jou arms stadig tot langs jou sye soos jy uitasem. Herhaal 4 keer.

SourceText: Relax your arms and let them swing to the front and back. Take 4 deep breaths while you do this. This is good for your lower back.
text: Ontspan jou arms en swaai hulle vorentoe en agtertoe. Haal 4 keer diep asem terwyl jy dit doen. Dit is goed vir jou lae rug.

SourceText: Relax your arms and let your arms swing sideways as you turn your upper body. Your arms should gently hit your back as you twist from side to side.
text: Ontspan jou arms en swaai hulle kante toe terwyl jy jou bolyf heen en weer draai. Jou arms moet liggies teen jou rug slaan soos jy heen en weer draai.

SourceText: Take a moment to reflect on your experience. Remember that you can do this activity at any time whenever you feel like you need to release stress and energise your mind and body.
text: Dink 'n oomblik na oor wat jy ervaar. Onthou, jy kan hierdie aktiwiteit doen enige tyd wanneer jy voel jy moet stres verlig en jou liggaam en siel het nuwe energie nodig.

note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Hi! Have you tried resolving conflict in a calm way even when you have felt frustrated recently?
text: Hi! Het jy onlangs probeer om konflik op 'n kalm manier op te los selfs al was jy gefrustreerd?

SourceText: Sorry to hear this. What was difficult for you about resolving conflicts between you and your partner?
text: Jammer om dit te hoor. Wat was vir jou moeilik toe jy konflik tussen jou en jou maat wou oplos?

SourceText: It can be really hard to stay calm when we’re having a disagreement with others. Try to think of something that you can do that might help like taking a couple deep breaths.
text: Ons sukkel soms baie om kalm te bly as ons 'n meningsverskil met iemand het. Probeer dink aan iets wat jy kan doen wat sal help, soos om 'n paar keer diep asem te haal.

SourceText: It can be easy to forget, but don’t give up! Next time when you start feeling angry, try taking a deep breath before responding. You can also try walking away for a bit if you start feeling frustrated.
text: Mens kan maklik vergeet, maar moenie opgee nie! Volgende keer wanneer jy begin kwaad voel, probeer diep asemhaal voordat jy reageer. Jy kan ook eers 'n bietjie wegstap as jy gefrustreerd begin voel.

SourceText: By taking a pause before responding, it can help us stay calm and respond better. When you feel yourself getting angry, try taking a pause. You can do this!
text: 'n Blaaskans voor jy reageer, kan jou help om kalm te bly en beter te reageer. Wanneer jy voel jy begin kwaad word, probeer 'n blaaskans vat. Jy kan dit doen!

SourceText: Sometimes others respond to us negatively when we’re having a disagreement. In these situations, it is sometimes best to walk away for a bit until those involved have calmed down.
text: Soms reageer ander negatief teenoor ons wanneer ons 'n meningsverskil het. Dit is soms die beste in sulke situasies om 'n bietjie weg te stap totdat almal wat betrokke is gekalmeer het.

SourceText: How would you like your messages?
text: Hoe wil jy jou boodskappe hê?

SourceText: How can we help you?
text: Hoe kan ons jou help?

SourceText: Did you manage to establish ONE rule or daily routine together with @fields.child_nickname?
text: Kon jy EEN reël of daaglikse roetine saam met @fields.child_nickname vasstel?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Did you manage to establish ONE rule or daily routine together with your child or teen ?
text: Kon jy EEN reël of daaglikse roetine saam met jou kind of tiener vasstel?

SourceText: Great to hear it this! Remember, the more we involve our children in setting rules, the more our children will be likely to follow them!
text: Wonderlik om dit te hoor! Onthou, hoe meer ons ons kinders betrek in die neerlê van reëls, hoe meer sal hulle geneig wees om daarby te hou!

SourceText: Did you have any challenges when trying to establish a rule or routine together?
text: Was daar enige probleme toe julle probeer het om saam 'n reël of roetine vas te stel?

SourceText: It is always important when establishing rules and routines  as a family to consider the age of each child, so you can come up with age-appropriate routines. This is most important for bedtime, time to come home/play, household chores.
text: Wanneer 'n gesin reëls en roetines vasstel, is dit altyd belangrik om die ouderdom van elke kind in ag te neem, sodat julle roetines kan uitdink wat geskik is vir almal se ouderdomme. Dit geld veral vir slaaptyd, tyd om huis toe te kom/te speel, huistake.

SourceText: We should always remember that children learn best from us. The more we follow the rules, they more they will follow the rules too. You can adjust the rule to make sure that it is realistic for everyone to follow it, considering their responsibilities (for example school or work activities).
text: Ons moet altyd onthou dat kinders die beste leer by ons. Hoe meer ons by die reëls hou, hoe meer gaan hulle ook by die reëls hou. Jy kan die reël aanpas om seker te maak dit is realisties, in die lig van almal se verantwoordelikhede (byvoorbeeld skool- of werkverpligtinge).

SourceText: When we establish rules together with our children or teens, that helps the family to understand each other better. The rules will be more realistic and our children will be more willing and able to follow the rule.
text: Wanneer ons saam met ons kinders of tieners reëls neerlê, help dit die gesin om mekaar beter te verstaan. Die reëls sal meer realisties wees en ons kinders sal meer gewillig en in staat wees om by die reël te hou.

SourceText: When we establish rules together with our children, that helps the family to understand each other better. The rules will be more realistic and our children will be more willing and able to follow the rule.
text: Wanneer ons saam met ons kinders reëls neerlê, help dit die gesin om mekaar beter te verstaan. Die reëls sal meer realisties wees en ons kinders sal meer gewillig en in staat wees om by die reël te hou.

SourceText: Sorry you did not manage to do this yet. Sit down with @fields.child_nickname and try again today - involving your children will make them want to follow the rule more often!
text: Jammer dat jy dit nog nie gedoen kon kry nie. Gaan sit saam met @fields.child_nickname en probeer vandag weer – wanneer jou kinders betrokke is, gaan hulle meer dikwels die reël nakom!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Sorry you did not manage to do this yet. Sit down with your child or teen  and try again today - involving your children will make them want to follow the rule more often!
text: Jammer dat jy dit nog nie gedoen kon kry nie. Gaan sit saam met jou kind of tiener en probeer vandag weer – wanneer jou kinders betrokke is, gaan hulle meer dikwels die reël nakom!

SourceText: What was difficult for you about establishing a rule or routine with @fields.child_nickname?
text: Wat was vir jou moeilik toe jy 'n reël of roetine saam met @fields.child_nickname wou vasstel?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: What was difficult for you about establishing a rule or routine with your child or teen ?
text: Wat was vir jou moeilik toe jy 'n reël of roetine saam met jou kind of tiener wou vasstel?

SourceText: Amazing! Consistent rules and routines help make @fields.child_nickname feel secure. They also keep them safe!
text: Fantasties! Konsekwente reëls en roetines help om @fields.child_nickname geborge te laat voel. Dit hou hulle ook veilig!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Amazing! Consistent rules and routines help make your child or teen  feel secure. They also keep them safe!
text: Fantasties! Konsekwente reëls en roetines help om jou kind of tiener geborge te laat voel. Dit hou hulle ook veilig!

SourceText: The sound of a baby crying can be very distressing, especially for a father It is completely natural to want to make it stop. You might also think that you are not a good parent or that your baby is crying to spite you. But all babies cry. It is one of the main ways a baby can tell you that something is wrong.
text: Die klank van 'n huilende baba kan baie ontstellend wees, veral vir 'n pa. Dit is heeltemal natuurlik om dit te wil stilmaak. Dalk dink jy ook jy is nie 'n goeie ouer nie of dat jou baba aspris huil om jou te irriteer. Maar alle babas huil. Dit is een van die vernaamste maniere waarop 'n baba vir jou kan sê dat iets verkeerd is.

SourceText: The sound of a baby crying can be very distressing, especially for a mother. It is completely natural to want to make it stop. You might also think that you are not a good parent or that your baby is crying to spite you. But all babies cry. It is one of the main ways a baby can tell you that something is wrong.
text: Die klank van 'n huilende baba kan baie ontstellend wees, veral vir 'n ma.  Dit is heeltemal natuurlik om dit te wil stilmaak. Dalk dink jy ook jy is nie 'n goeie ouer nie of dat jou baba aspris huil om jou te irriteer. Maar alle babas huil. Dit is een van die vernaamste maniere waarop 'n baba vir jou kan sê dat iets verkeerd is.

SourceText: The sound of a baby crying can be very distressing, especially for a parent. It is completely natural to want to make it stop. You might also think that you are not a good parent or that your baby is crying to spite you. But all babies cry. It is one of the main ways a baby can tell you that something is wrong.
text: Die klank van 'n huilende baba kan baie ontstellend wees, veral vir 'n ouer. Dit is heeltemal natuurlik om dit te wil stilmaak. Dalk dink jy ook jy is nie 'n goeie ouer nie of dat jou baba aspris huil om jou te irriteer. Maar alle babas huil. Dit is een van die vernaamste maniere waarop 'n baba vir jou kan sê dat iets verkeerd is.

SourceText: I know that you have already received this tip (well done!). Would you like to review it again?
text: Ek weet jy het reeds hierdie wenk ontvang (wel gedaan!). Wil jy weer daarna kyk?

SourceText: 2 Truths, 1 Lie
text: 2 Waarhede, 1 Leuen

SourceText: Think of three statements about yourself. Two must be true and one must be a lie.
text: Dink aan drie stellings oor jouself. Twee moet waar wees en een moet 'n leuen wees.

SourceText: It might help to think of wishes, dreams, likes or dislikes. For example, I hate bananas, I love ice cream and I really wish I could sing.
text: Dink aan wense, drome, voorkeure of afkere. Byvoorbeeld, ek haat piesangs, maar ek hou van roomys, en ek wens ek kon sing.

SourceText: Say them to your partner or friends. Ask them to guess which one is a lie.
text: Noem hierdie dinge vir jou maat of vriende. Vra hulle om te raai watter een 'n leuen is.

SourceText: Did they guess correctly? Was it a surprise?
text: Het hulle reg geraai? Was dit 'n verrassing?

SourceText: Now ask them to do the same. Did you learn something new about each other?
text: Vra hulle nou om dieselfde te doen. Het julle iets nuuts van mekaar geleer?

SourceText: Crazy Chicken
text: Mal Hoender

SourceText: Shake your hand in the air 8 times while counting to 8
text: Skud jou hand 8 keer in die lug terwyl jy tot by 8 tel

SourceText: Do it as fast and loud as you can
text: Doen dit so vinnig en tel so hard as wat jy kan

SourceText: Repeat with your other hand and both feet
text: Herhaal met jou ander hand en albei voete

SourceText: Do it 7 times, then 6 times until you get to 1.
text: Doen dit 7 keer, dan 6 keer totdat jy by 1 kom.

SourceText: Call out “Crazy chicken” as loud as you can!
text: Skree "Mal hoender" so hard as wat jy kan!

SourceText: Have you released all your stress? If not, do it again even faster and louder!
text: Het jy van al jou stres ontslae geraak? Indien nie, doen dit weer, selfs vinniger en harder!

SourceText: Family Work Out
text: Gesin-oefensessie

SourceText: Choose a sport or exercise to do together
text: Kies 'n sport of oefening om saam te doen

SourceText: Decide on a schedule. Are you going to do it every day? For how long?
text: Besluit op 'n skedule. Gaan julle dit elke dag doen? Vir hoe lank?

SourceText: Try it out for a week.
text: Probeer dit vir 'n week.

SourceText: At the end of the week, ask yourself and your family these questions. How’s it going? How did you feel at the start of the week? How do you feel at the end of the week? What can we do differently next week?
text: Vra jouself en jou gesin die volgende vrae aan die einde van die week. Hoe gaan dinge? Hoe het julle aan die begin van die week gevoel? Hoe voel julle aan die einde van die week? Wat kan ons volgende week anders doen?

SourceText: COVID-19 has interrupted our children's education with school closures and remote learning. It is normal to feel overwhelmed about to do this alone, especially when we also have stress about work and money.
text: COVID-19 het ons kinders se opvoeding onderbreek met afstandleer en skole wat sluit. Dit is normaal om oorweldig te voel as mens hierdie dinge alleen te doen, veral wanneer ons ook stres oor werk en geld.

SourceText: Would you like to learn more about how to support your children with remote learning and returning to school?
text: Wil jy graag meer uitvind oor hoe om jou kinders te ondersteun met afstandleer en die terugkeer skool toe?

SourceText: Stop & Listen
text: Stop & Luister

SourceText: • Stop for a moment and close your eyes.
text: • Kom vir 'n oomblik tot stilstand en maak jou oë toe.

SourceText: • How many sounds can you hear? Listen to sounds inside and outside the room. Count them on your fingers. (Pause for 10 seconds)
text: • Hoeveel klanke kan jy hoor? Luister na klanke binne en buite die vertrek. Tel hulle op jou vingers. (Wag vir 10 sekondes)

SourceText: • How many fingers do you have up? What sounds did you hear?
text: • Hoeveel vingers hou jy in die lug? Watter klanke het jy gehoor?

SourceText: • Let’s try again. Can you hear any new sounds this time? Can you hear any sounds inside your own body? (Pause for 10 seconds)
text: • Kom ons probeer weer. Kan jy hierdie keer enige nuwe klanke hoor? Kan jy enige klanke in jou eie liggaam hoor? (Wag vir 10 sekondes)

SourceText: • Open your eyes. What new sounds did you hear?
text: • Maak jou oë oop. Watter nuwe klanke het jy gehoor?

SourceText: A Short Pause
text: 'n Kort Blaaskans

SourceText: Sit down and close your eyes.
text: Gaan sit en maak jou oë toe.

SourceText: Listen to your breath as it goes in and out.
text: Luister na jou asem soos dit in en uit gaan.

SourceText: Notice how you feel.
text: Let op hoe jy voel.

SourceText: Take a few more deep breaths.
text: Haal 'n paar keer diep asem.

SourceText: When you are ready open your eyes again. Do you feel any different?
text: Wanneer jy gereed is, maak weer jou oë oop. Voel jy enige verskil?

SourceText: Remind yourself that “Everything is ok”.
