text: Herinner jouself dat "Alles oukei is".

SourceText: Give Yourself A Hug
text: Gee Jouself 'n Drukkie

SourceText: Bella mama, bella mama hey.
text: Bella mama, bella mama, haai.

SourceText: Hey there! How are you feeling today? Do you feel great?!
text: Haai daar! Hoe voel jy vandag? Voel jy fantasties?!

SourceText: Maybe not. Maybe you shouted again at your children today? Maybe you got angry and said something you don't feel proud of? It’s ok. It’s super stressful right now.
text: Dalk nie. Dalk het jy vandag weer op jou kinders geskree? Dalk het jy kwaad geword en iets gesê waarop jy nie trots is nie? Dis oukei. Dinge is op die oomblik baie stresvol.

SourceText: Take a deep breath and think of one thing you did today that you do feel proud of. It doesn't have to be big. And wrap your arms around your body and give yourself a hug. And now think of one thing you did today that you don't feel proud of. What can you do differently tomorrow? And wrap your arms around your body and give yourself a hug.
text: Haal diep asem en dink aan een ding wat jy vandag gedoen het waarop jy trots is. Dit hoef nie 'n groot ding te wees nie. En vou jou arms om jou lyf en gee jouself 'n drukkie. En dink nou aan een ding wat jy vandag gedoen het waarop jy nie trots is nie. Wat kan jy môre anders doen? En vou jou arms om jou lyf en gee jouself 'n drukkie.

SourceText: Bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama hey”.
text: Bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama haai".

SourceText: Hello @fields.user_name! Did you know that 3 is a magical number? Breathe in to the count of three and breathe out to the count of three. How do you feel now? Do you feel any different?
text: Hallo @fields.user_name! Het jy geweet 3 is ’n towergetal? Asem in vir drie tellings en asem uit vir drie tellings. Hoe voel jy nou? Voel jy enige verskil?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated. @results.count is a number (counter for list)

SourceText: Hello! Did you know that 3 is a magical number? Breathe in to the count of three and breathe out to the count of three. How do you feel now? Do you feel any different?
text: Hallo! Het jy geweet 3 is ’n towergetal? Asem in vir drie tellings en asem uit vir drie tellings. Hoe voel jy nou? Voel jy enige verskil?

SourceText: What are your three favourite foods? Can you name three things you can see right now? Can you hear three sounds you can hear right now? What are three things you are grateful for right now?
text: Wat is jou drie gunsteling-kosse om te eet? Kan jy drie dinge noem wat jy nou sien? Kan jy drie dinge noem wat jy nou hoor? Vir watter drie dinge is jy dankbaar op hierdie oomblik?

SourceText: Breathe in to the count of three and breathe out to the count of three? How do you feel now? Do you feel any different? Three is a magical number!
text: Asem in vir drie tellings en asem uit vir drie tellings? Hoe voel jy nou? Voel jy enige verskil? Drie is ’n towergetal!

SourceText: Release Some Energy
text: Stel Energie Vry

SourceText: Baba da bi da ba da baaa! Pause Power!
text: Baba da bi da ba da baaa! Die wonder van 'n Blaaskans!

SourceText: What’s Pause Power I hear you say? It’s the ability to transform from a grumpy, angry person into a calm, clear one.
text: Wat’s so wonderlik aan 'n Blaaskans? Dis die vermoë om 'n knorrige, kwaai mens in 'n kalm, helder een te verander.

SourceText: When I’m feeling frustrated I plant my feet firmly on the ground and I breathe in and out three times as slowly as I can. Sometimes I imagine I’m smelling a flower and blowing out a candle.
text: Wanneer ek gefrustreerd voel, plant ek my voete ferm op die grond en asem drie keer in en uit so stadig as wat ek kan. Soms verbeel ek my ek ruik 'n blom en blaas 'n kers dood.

SourceText: Da ta! Pause Power! My transformation from grumpy to calm is complete!
text: Da ta! Die wonder van 'n Blaaskans! My transformasie van knorrig na kalm is klaar!

SourceText: Taking care of yourself
text: Gee om vir jouself

SourceText: Recognise what is happening for you in this moment. What are you thinking? Are your thoughts positive or negative. How do you feel? Do you feel pleasant or unpleasant? How does your body feel? Do you feel tense or relaxed?
text: Erken waardeur jy gaan op hierdie oomblik. Waaraan dink jy? Is jou gedagtes positief of negatief. Hoe voel jy? Voel jy aangenaam of onaangenaam? Hoe voel jou liggaam? Voel jy gespanne of ontspanne?

SourceText: Connect to your heart in a kind and gentle way. You may want to place one hand on your heart or chest.
text: Raak op rustige manier bewus van wat in jou hart omgaan. Jy kan jou een hand op jou hart of bors sit.

SourceText: You can then say the following words silently to yourself:
text: Jy kan dan die volgende woorde saggies vir jouself sê:

SourceText: Take a moment to reflect on your experience. Remember that you can do this activity at any time whenever you feel like you need extra support.
text: Dink 'n oomblik na oor wat jy ervaar. Onthou, jy kan hierdie aktiwiteit enige tyd doen wanneer jy voel jy het ekstra steun nodig.

SourceText: Cooking together
text: Ons kook saam

SourceText: Children love to do what you do!
text: Kinders is mal daaroor om te doen wat jy doen!

SourceText: Let your baby play with pots and spoons while you are making dinner.
text: Laat jou baba met potte en lepels speel wanneer jy aandete maak.

SourceText: Dance Party
text: Danspartytjie

SourceText: Put on your favourite music or sing your favourite song and dance around the room with your toddler. If you have a baby hold them while you dance.
text: Sit jou gunstelingmusiek op of sing jou gunstelingliedjie en dans in die kamer rond saam met jou kleuter. As jy 'n baba het, hou hulle vas terwyl julle dans.

SourceText: Dance in different ways or with different parts of your body.
text: Dans op verskillende maniere of met verskillende dele van jou lyf.

SourceText: For example, “Dance like a monkey”, “Dance like a chicken” or “Let’s dance with our knees and hips.”
text: Byvoorbeeld, "Dans soos 'n apie", "Dans soos 'n hoender" of "Kom ons dans met ons knieë en heupe".

SourceText: Think up different instructions. Be seriously playful!
text: Dink verskillende instruksies uit. Gaan mal!

SourceText: When the music stops, everyone does a funny freeze.
text: As die musiek stop, moet almal vries so laf soos hulle kan.

SourceText: Notice what rhythms or movements they like!
text: Let op na die ritmes of bewegings waarvan hulle hou!

SourceText: Down in a ditch!
text: Af in die sloot!

SourceText: Sit on a chair and put your toddler on your lap facing you. Hold them firmly under the arms.
text: Sit op 'n stoel en met jou kleuter op jou skoot, hulle gesig na jou gedraai. Hou hulle styf onder die arms vas.

SourceText: Gently bounce your legs and say in a soft voice “Baby horse, baby horse, baby horse, baby horse”
text: Hop hulle saggies op jou bene en sê sag: "Babaperdjie, babaperdjie, babaperdjie, babaperdjie"

SourceText: Bounce your legs a bit more and say a bit louder “Little horse, little horse, little horse, little horse”
text: Hop jou bene 'n bietjie wilder en sê 'n bietjie harder: "Klein perdjie, klein perdjie, klein perdjie, klein perdjie"

SourceText: Bounce your legs more and say louder “Big horse, big horse, big horse, big horse”
text: Hop jou bene nog wilder en sê harder: "Groot perdjie, groot perdjie, groot perdjie, groot perdjie"

SourceText: When you call out “Down in a ditch!” open your knees and let your child drop down between them. Make sure you hold them so they don’t fall far!
text: Wanneer jy uitroep "Af in die sloot!", maak jou knieë oop en laat sak jou kind tussen jou knieë af. Maak seker jy hou hulle styf vas sodat hulle nie ver val nie!

SourceText: Funny Faces
text: Mombakkies

SourceText: Look at your baby in the eyes and make different funny faces.
text: Kyk jou baba in die oë en trek verskillende snaakse gesigte.

SourceText: Make a big face. Make a small face. Make a happy face. Make a surprised face.
text: Trek 'n groot gesig. Trek 'n klein gesig. Trek 'n vrolike gesig. Trek 'n verbaasde gesig.

SourceText: Which ones make your baby smile or laugh? Do them again, even bigger this time!
text: Watter gesigte laat jou baba glimlag of lag? Doen dit weer, selfs groter hierdie keer!

SourceText: Play with different feelings and add sounds.
text: Speel met verskillende gevoelens en maak byklanke.

SourceText: Copy their facial expressions too. Exaggerate them to make them funny.
text: Maak ook hulle gesigsuitdrukkings na. Oordryf dit om dit snaaks te maak.

SourceText: Always end on a positive expression!
text: Eindig altyd met 'n positiewe uitdrukking!

SourceText: Mirror Game
text: Spieëlspeletjie

SourceText: • Get to your baby's level so they can see you and hear you.
text: • Sak tot op jou baba se vlak sodat hulle jou kan sien en hoor.

SourceText: • Copy their facial expressions and sounds.
text: • Boots hulle gesigsuitdrukkings en klanke na.

SourceText: • It is simple and helps create a strong bond between you and your baby!
text: • Dit is eenvoudig en help om 'n sterk band tussen jou en jou baba te vorm!

SourceText: Musical Toes
text: Musikale Toontjies

SourceText: Put your baby on their back.
text: Sit jou baba op jou rug.

SourceText: Wiggle their toe and say, “This little toe goes [funny sound].”
text: Wikkel hulle toontjie en sê: "Hierdie klein toontjie maak [snaakse geluid]."

SourceText: Make a funny sound for each toe.
text: Maak 'n snaakse geluid vir elke toon.

SourceText: Play with different sounds. For example, animal sounds, popping sounds, squeaky sounds, fart sounds.
text: Speel met verskillende klanke. Byvoorbeeld, dieregeluide, plofgeluide, piepgeluide, en lawwe poepgeluide.

SourceText: Repeat this for all ten toes.
text: Herhaal dit vir al tien tone.

SourceText: Try to make the last toe the biggest and funniest sound!
text: Probeer om die laaste toon die hardste en snaaksste geluid te maak!

SourceText: Peek-a-Boo!
text: Kiekeboe!

SourceText: • Cover your face with your hands.
text: • Maak jou gesig toe met jou hande.

SourceText: • Quickly show your face and say "Peek-a-Boo!" or "Hello!" Babies love it!
text: • Maak jou gesig vinnig oop en sê "Kiekeboe!" of "Hallo!" Babas is mal daaroor!

SourceText: See It Be It
text: Sien dit Wees dit

SourceText: Look around you and name something that you can see. For example, a tree or a cup.
text: Kyk om jou rond en noem iets wat jy kan sien. Byvoorbeeld 'n boom of 'n koppie.

SourceText: Say to your child “I see a tree, let’s be it”.
text: Sê vir jou kind "Ek sien 'n boom, kom ons wees dit".

SourceText: Countdown from 5 and make the shape of a tree with your bodies. Be as big and silly as possible.
text: Begin aftel van 5 en maak die vorm van 'n boom met jou lyf. Wees so groot en laf as moontlik.

SourceText: Now let your child have a turn. What can they see?
text: Gee nou vir jou 'n kind 'n beurt. Wat kan hulle sien?

SourceText: If you can, go outside and be in nature. If you can’t, play it inside.
text: Gaan buitentoe in die natuur as julle kan. As julle nie kan nie, speel dit binne.

SourceText: When you’ve done it a few times, add moves and sounds!
text: As julle dit 'n paar keer gedoen het, sit beweging en klank by!

SourceText: Shakers
text: Skud-skud

SourceText: Find an empty, clean plastic bottle or pot with a lid that closes tight.
text: Soek 'n leë, skoon plastiekbottel of pot met 'n deksel wat dig toemaak.

SourceText: Fill it with sand, stones, uncooked rice, beans or any small objects that make an interesting sound.
text: Vul dit met sand, klippies, droë rys of boontjies of enige klein voorwerp wat 'n interessante geluid maak.

SourceText: Move your body as you shake it in front of your baby.
text: Beweeg jou lyf terwyl jy dit skud voor jou baba.

SourceText: If it is safe, give it to your baby to shake!
text: As dit veilig is, gee dit vir jou baba om te skud!

SourceText: Get creative! Can you find something colourful or try it with water?
text: Raak kreatief! Kan jy iets kleurvols kry, of dit met water probeer?

SourceText: What sounds does your baby like?
text: Van watter klanke hou jou baba?

SourceText: The Sun is Coming!
text: Die Son Kom Uit!

SourceText: Lie your baby on their back after washing them or changing their diaper.
text: Sit jou baba op hulle rug neer nadat jy hulle gewas of doek omgeruil het.

SourceText: Tell them the sun is coming! Wiggle your fingers like sun rays above their head and make your face a big smiling sun.
text: Sê vir hulle die son kom uit! Wikkel jou vingers soos sonstrale bo hulle kop en trek jou gesig soos 'n groot glimlaggende son.

SourceText: Tell them the wind is coming! Blow softly over their body.
text: Sê vir hulle die wind is op pad! Blaas saggies oor hulle lyf.

SourceText: Tell them the rain is coming! Use your fingers to gently pat over their whole body like light raindrops.
text: Sê vir hulle die reën is op pad! Gebruik jou vingers om saggies oor hulle hele lyf te tik soos ligte reëndruppels.

SourceText: Tell them the clouds are coming! Wrap the towel or cloth around them like a blanket and cuddle them.
text: Sê vir hulle die wolke kom uit! Draai die handdoek of lap soos 'n kombers om hulle en gee hulle drukkies.

SourceText: Play with different weathers. Which one does your baby like best?
text: Speel met verskillende weerstoestande. Van watter een hou jou baba die meeste?

SourceText: Add sound effects or make it into a little song. Use the tune of another song you know!
text: Sit byklanke by of omskep dit in 'n liedjie. Gebruik die wysie van 'n liedjie wat jy ken!

SourceText: At the End of the Day
text: Aan die Einde van die Dag

SourceText: At the end of each day, take a minute to think about the day.
text: Dink 'n paar oomblik na oor die dag wat verby is.

SourceText: Talk to your child about one positive or fun thing they did.
text: Praat met jou kind oor een positiewe of lekker ding wat hulle gedoen het.

SourceText: Praise yourself for one thing you did well today.
text: Prys jouself vir een ding wat jy goed gedoen het vandag.

SourceText: Think of one thing that you are grateful for.
text: Dink aan een ding waarvoor jy dankbaar is.

SourceText: You are a star!
text: Jy is 'n ster!

SourceText: Lullaby
text: Wiegeliedjie

SourceText: When your baby or toddler cries, sing a soft song to calm you both down.
text: Wanneer jou baba of kleuter huil, sing 'n sagte liedjie om julle albei te kalmeer.

SourceText: Sing a soothing song you know or make up your own with a simple melody and some soothing words.
text: Sing 'n rustige liedjie wat jy ken of maak jou eie liedjie op met 'n eenvoudige melodie en vertroostende woorde.

SourceText: Repeat it over and over in a rhythmical way. For example, “My little one, oh little one”.
text: Herhaal dit ritmies oor en oor. Byvoorbeeld: "My kleintjie, o my kleintjie".

SourceText: Sing the same song regularly so your child gets used to it!
text: Sing dieselfde liedjie gereeld sodat jou kind daaraan gewoond raak!

SourceText: Shake your left hands in the air 8 times while counting to 8
text: Skud julle linkerhande in die lug 8 keer terwyl jy tot 8 tel

SourceText: Repeat with your other hand. Repeat with each foot.
text: Herhaal met julle ander hand. Herhaal met elke voet.

SourceText: Do it 7 times, then 6 times and continue until you get to 1.
text: Doen dit 7 keer, dan 6 keer en hou aan tot julle by 1 kom.

SourceText: Everyone calls out “Crazy chicken” and does their best crazy chicken dance!
text: Almal skree "Mal hoender" en doen hulle beste mal hoender-dans!

SourceText: Dance choreography
text: Danschoreografie

SourceText: Create a dance choreography to your children’s favorite songs.
text: Choreografeer 'n dans op jou kind se gunstelingliedjies.

SourceText: First person does a dance move and everyone else copies.
text: Eerste persoon doen 'n dansbeweging en almal doen dit na.

SourceText: Everyone takes turns being the leader.
text: Elkeen kry 'n beurt om die leier te wees.

SourceText: Perform it for the household!
text: Voer dit op vir almal in die huis!

SourceText: Play or sing your favourite music and dance around the room.
text: Speel of sing jou gunstelingmusiek en dans in die kamer rond.

SourceText: For example, “Dance like a monkey”, “Dance like a chicken” or “Dance with just our knees and hips”.
text: Byvoorbeeld: "Dans soos 'n apie", "Dans soos 'n hoender" of "Dans met net ons knieë en heupe".

SourceText: When the music stops, everyone does a funny freeze.
text: As die musiek stop, moet almal vries so laf soos hulle kan.

SourceText: Give your child a chance to be the one to stop the music!
text: Gee jou kind 'n kans om die een te wees wat die musiek stop!

SourceText: Freeze dance
text: Vries-dans

SourceText: Play music or someone sings a song, and everyone dances.
text: Speel musiek of iemand sing 'n liedjie en almal dans.

SourceText: When the music stops, everyone must freeze.
text: Wanneer die musiek stop, moet almal vries.

SourceText: Last person still dancing becomes the judge for the next round.
text: Laaste persoon wat steeds dans word die beoordelaar vir die volgende rondte.

SourceText: A variation to Freeze Dance is Animal Dance: It’s the same as Freeze Dance but when the music stops, one member of the family calls out the name of an animal, and everyone has to become that animal.
text: 'n Variasie op Vries-dans is Diere-dans: Dis dieselfde as Vries-dans, maar wanneer die musiek stop, roep een lid van die gesin die naam van 'n dier uit, en almal moet daardie dier word.

SourceText: Mirror
text: Spieël

SourceText: This game can be played in pairs or even as a group.
text: Hierdie speletjie kan in pare of selfs in 'n groep gespeel word.

SourceText: Stand facing each other or in a circle.
text: Staan in 'n kring met julle gesigte na mekaar gedraai.

SourceText: One person leads first while everyone else must copy, trying to move exactly at the same time as the leader.
text: Een persoon gaan voor terwyl die ander naboots en probeer om op presies dieselfde tyd as die leier te beweeg.

SourceText: Make sure the leader moves slowly enough for everyone to follow! Explore moving different body parts and in different levels.
text: Maak seker die leier beweeg stadig genoeg vir almal om te volg! Probeer verskillende liggaamsdele op verskillende vlakke beweeg.

SourceText: After a while, switch who is leading. Give everyone a chance to lead.
text: Na 'n rukkie neem iemand anders weer die leiding. Gee almal 'n kans om die leier te wees.

SourceText: Try it with no leaders!
text: Probeer dit met geen leier!

SourceText: Here's a video to help you support your child's learning.
text: Hier is 'n video om jou te help om jou kind se leer te ondersteun.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you support your child's learning.
text: Hier is 'n oudioboodskap om jou te help om jou kind se leer te ondersteun.

SourceText: Here are 5 steps that you can do to help your children continue learning during this time:
text: Hier is 5 stappe wat jy kan volg om jou kind te help om aan te hou leer in hierdie tyd:

SourceText: 1. Create a routine around learning and schoolwork
text: 1. Stel 'n roetine vas vir leer en skoolwerk

SourceText: 2. Make learning fun and playful
text: 2. Maak leer prettig en lekker

SourceText: 3. Remember that you are a parent NOT a substitute teacher
text: 3. Onthou dat jy 'n ouer is, NIE 'n plaasvervanger-onderwyser NIE

SourceText: 4. Stay connected with your child's school and teachers
text: 4. Bly in kontak met jou kind se skool en onderwysers

SourceText: 5. Support your child when they return to school
text: 5. Ondersteun jou kind wanneer hulle teruggaan skool toe

SourceText: Type "1" to "5" to learn more about each tip. Type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Tik "1" tot "5" om meer oor elke wenk uit te vind. Tik "N" om hierdie wenk te stop.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to support your child's learning:
text: Kies asseblief 'n ander nommer as jy meer wil uitvind oor hoe om jou kind se leer te ondersteun:

SourceText: Step 5. Support your child when they go back to school
text: Stap 5. Ondersteun jou kind wanneer hulle teruggaan skool toe

SourceText: Tell @fields.child_nickname that it is okay to feel scared or worried about going back to school. Allow your child to share how they are feeling. It is also normal if your child behaves differently to their usual behaviour. Discuss how going to school might be different and how they can protect themselves from COVID-19. Ask them how their day went and support them if they experienced any difficulties.
text: Sê vir @fields.child_nickname dis oukei om bang of bekommerd te voel om terug te gaan skool toe. Gee jou kind geleentheid om te sê hoe hulle voel. Dit is ook normaal as jou kind anders optree as gewoonlik. Bespreek hoe dit nou anders kan wees om skool toe te gaan en hoe hulle hulself teen COVID-19 kan beskerm. Vra hulle hoe hulle dag was en ondersteun hulle as hulle enige probleme ervaar het.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Tell your child that it is okay to feel scared or worried about going back to school. Allow your child to share how they are feeling. It is also normal if your child behaves differently to their usual behaviour. Discuss how going to school might be different and how they can protect themselves from COVID-19. Ask them how their day went and support them if they experienced any difficulties.
text: Sê vir jou kind dis oukei om bang of bekommerd te voel om terug te gaan skool toe. Gee jou kind geleentheid om te sê hoe hulle voel. Dit is ook normaal as jou kind anders optree as gewoonlik. Bespreek hoe dit nou anders kan wees om skool toe te gaan en hoe hulle hulself teen COVID-19 kan beskerm. Vra hulle hoe hulle dag was en ondersteun hulle as hulle enige probleme ervaar het.

SourceText: Step 2. Make learning fun and playful
text: Stap 2. Maak leer prettig en lekker

SourceText: Children learn best when learning is fun! Try to find ways to make learning playful to keep @fields.child_nickname interested and engaged. Type "Help" if you ever need any fun ideas!
text: Kinders leer die beste wanneer leer pret is! Soek maniere om leer lekker te maak om @fields.child_nickname geïnteresseerd en betrokke te hou. Tik "Help" as jy ooit enige oulike idees wil hê!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Children learn best when learning is fun! Try to find ways to make learning playful to keep your child interested and engaged. Type "Help" if you ever need any fun ideas!
text: Kinders leer die beste wanneer leer pret is! Soek maniere om leer lekker te maak om jou kind geïnteresseerd en betrokke te hou. Tik "Help" as jy ooit enige oulike idees wil hê!

SourceText: Step 3. Remember that you are a father NOT a substitute teacher!
text: Stap 3. Onthou dat jy 'n pa is en NIE 'n plaasvervanger-onderwyser NIE!

SourceText: Your role is to support your child by creating a space to learn. You do not need to know all the answers. Help them explore their interests and ask questions. Go at @fields.child_nickname's pace and be patient with yourself.
text: Jou rol is om jou kind te ondersteun deur 'n omgewing te skep waarin hulle kan leer. Jy hoef nie al die antwoorde te ken nie. Help hulle om hul belangstellings te verken en vrae te vra. Volg @fields.child_nickname se pas en wees geduldig met jouself.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Step 3. Remember that you are a mother NOT a substitute teacher!
text: Stap 3. Onthou dat jy 'n ma is en NIE 'n plaasvervanger-onderwyser NIE!

SourceText: Step 3. Remember that you are a parent NOT a substitute teacher!
text: Stap 3. Onthou dat jy 'n ouer is en NIE 'n plaasvervanger-onderwyser NIE!

SourceText: Your role is to support your child by creating a space to learn. You do not need to know all the answers. Help them explore their interests and ask questions. Go at your child's pace and be patient with yourself.
text: Jou rol is om jou kind te ondersteun deur 'n omgewing te skep waarin hulle kan leer. Jy hoef nie al die antwoorde te ken nie. Help hulle om hul belangstellings te verken en vrae te vra. Volg jou kind se pas en wees geduldig met jouself.

SourceText: Step 1. Create a routine around learning and schoolwork
text: Stap 1. Stel 'n roetine vas vir leer en skoolwerk

SourceText: Make a daily plan with @fields.child_nickname for when they can spend time doing educational activities. This can include structured schoolwork and other activities online, reading, writing, or arts. Allow flexibility and time for play and relaxation too.
text: Stel saam met @fields.child_nickname 'n daaglikse plan vir hulle opvoedkundige aktiwiteite op. Dit kan gestruktureerde skoolwerk en ander aktiwiteite aanlyn, lees, skryf, of kuns insluit. Laat ruimte vir verandering en sit tyd opsy vir speel en ontspan.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Make a daily plan with your child for when they can spend time doing educational activities. This can include structured schoolwork and other activities online, reading, writing, or arts. Allow flexibility and time for play and relaxation too.
text: Stel saam met jou kind 'n daaglikse plan vir hulle opvoedkundige aktiwiteite op. Dit kan gestruktureerde skoolwerk en ander aktiwiteite aanlyn, lees, skryf, of kuns insluit. Laat ruimte vir verandering en sit tyd opsy vir speel en ontspan.

SourceText: Step 4. Stay connected with your child's school and teachers
text: Stap 4. Bly in kontak met jou kind se skool en onderwysers

SourceText: Find out how to stay in touch with @fields.child_nickname’s teacher or school to stay informed, ask questions and get more guidance. If you are struggling or know someone who is struggling with school work or the home situation, please discuss this with a teacher that you feel close to. Parent groups or community groups can also be a good way to support each other with your home schooling.
text: Vind uit hoe om in kontak te bly met @fields.child_nickname se onderwyser of skool, om op hoogte te bly, vrae te vra en meer leiding te kry. As jy sukkel of weet van iemand wat sukkel met skoolwerk of die situasie by die huis, bespreek dit asseblief met 'n onderwyser met wie jy 'n goeie verhouding het. Ouer- of gemeenskapsgroepe kan ook 'n goeie manier wees om mekaar met jou tuisonderrig te ondersteun.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Find out how to stay in touch with your children’s teacher or school to stay informed, ask questions and get more guidance. If you are struggling or know someone who is struggling with school work or the home situation, please discuss this with a teacher that you feel close to. Parent groups or community groups can also be a good way to support each other with your home schooling.
text: Vind uit hoe om in kontak te bly met jou kinders se onderwyser of skool, om op hoogte te bly, vrae te vra en meer leiding te kry. As jy sukkel of weet van iemand wat sukkel met skoolwerk of die situasie by die huis, bespreek dit asseblief met 'n onderwyser met wie jy 'n goeie verhouding het. Ouer- of gemeenskapsgroepe kan ook 'n goeie manier wees om mekaar met jou tuisonderrig te ondersteun.

SourceText: Well done for adding another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Over the next few days, try creating a learning plan with your child that includes both fun and focused educational activities. Helping your child continue learning during this difficult time is so important. Your best efforts will make a difference!
text: Jy het nog 'n vaardigheid by jou Ouerskap-gereedskapkis gevoeg het, wel gedaan! Probeer om oor die volgende paar dae 'n leerplan saam met jou kind op te stel wat lekker sowel as gefokusde opvoedkundige aktiwiteite insluit. Dit is so belangrik dat jy jou kind help om aan te hou leer in hierdie moeilike tyd. Jou beste pogings sal 'n verskil maak!

SourceText: Well done for adding another layer to your House of Support! Over the next few days, try creating a learning plan with your child that includes both fun and focused educational activities. Helping your child continue learning during this difficult time is so important. Your best efforts will make a difference!
text: Jy het nog 'n vlak by jou Huis van Ondersteuning gevoeg het, wel gedaan! Probeer om oor die volgende paar dae 'n leerplan saam met jou kind op te stel wat lekker sowel as gefokusde opvoedkundige aktiwiteite insluit. Dit is so belangrik dat jy jou kind help om aan te hou leer in hierdie moeilike tyd. Jou beste pogings sal 'n verskil maak!

SourceText: We understand that these times can be really difficult. Please type "Help" if you want any extra support or guidance. Chat to you later @fields.user_name!
text: Ons verstaan dat hierdie tye regtig moeilik kan wees. Tik asseblief "Help" as jy enige ekstra ondersteuning of leiding nodig het. Ons praat later @fields.user_name!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: We understand that these times can be really difficult. Please type "Help" if you want any extra support or guidance. Chat to you later!
text: Ons verstaan dat hierdie tye regtig moeilik kan wees. Tik asseblief "Help" as jy enige ekstra ondersteuning of leiding nodig het. Ons praat later!

SourceText: Rain on the Mountain
text: Reën op die Berg

SourceText: Call out, “There’s rain on the mountain”.
text: Roep: "Daar’s reën op die berg".

SourceText: Everyone else replies “Run, run, run” while running around the space.
text: Almal antwoord: "Hardloop, hardloop, hardloop" en hardloop rond in die spasie.

SourceText: Call out different instructions. For example, touch something red or hop like a frog.
text: Roep verskillende instruksies uit. Byvoorbeeld, raak aan iets roois of spring soos 'n padda.

SourceText: Keep playing and change the instructions each time.
text: Hou aan speel en verander die instruksies elke keer.

SourceText: You can use this as a fun way to learn colours or even tidy up!
text: Jy kan dit gebruik as 'n prettige manier om kleure te leer of selfs op te ruim!

SourceText: Run Around and Do This
text: Hardloop Rond en Doen Dit

SourceText: Everyone runs around the room or garden.  Make sure the space is large enough and safe.
text: Almal hardloop in die kamer of tuin rond.  Maak seker daar is genoeg spasie en dis veilig genoeg.

SourceText: At any time, someone can stop somewhere and say, “When you get over here, you do this!”
text: Op enige tyd kan iemand iewers stop en sê: "As jy hiernatoe kom, moet jy dit doen!"

SourceText: What you do can be anything: push-ups, singing a song, crying, jumping…
text: Wat jy moet doen, is: opstote, sing 'n liedjie, huil, spring...

SourceText: The more you play, the more there are things to do in more and more places.
text: Hoe langer jy speel, hoe meer dinge is daar om te doen op meer en meer plekke.

SourceText: Each person can decide where to go and when.
text: Elke persoon kan besluit waarheen om te gaan en wanneer.

SourceText: It’s fun to interact with other people who are doing the same thing as you!
text: Dis pret om met ander mense interaksie te hê wat dieselfde ding as jy doen!

SourceText: Say to your child “I see a tree, let’s be it!”
text: Sê vir jou kind "Ek sien 'n boom, kom ons wees dit!"

SourceText: Ship to Shore
text: Skip na Wal

SourceText: A fun active game where children learn different parts of a boat. Everyone must go to the place or activity that you call out.
text: 'n Aktiewe pretspeletjie waar kinders verskillende dele van 'n skip leer ken. Almal moet gaan na die plek of aktiwiteit wat jy uitroep.

SourceText: “Bow” means run to the front of the boat (room).
text: "Boeg" beteken hardloop na die voorkant van die skip (kamer).

SourceText: “Stern” means run to the back of the boat.
text: "Agterstewe" beteken hardloop na die agterkant van die skip.

SourceText: “Starboard” means run to the right side and “Port” means run to the left side.
text: "Stuurboord" beteken hardloop na die regterkant, en "bakboord" beteken hardloop na die linkerkant.

SourceText: “Climb the rigging”: pretend to climb.
text: "Klim die takelwerk": maak of jy klim.

SourceText: “Clean the deck”: pretend to clean the floor.
text: "Vee die dek": maak of jy die dek skoonmaak.

SourceText: “Lifeboat, [number] people!”: hold hands in a circle with that many people and do knee bends.
text: "Reddingsboot, [getal] mense!": hou hande in 'n kring met soveel mense in en doen kniebuigings.

SourceText: Everyone not in a lifeboat must swim!
text: Almal wat nie in die reddingsboot is nie, moet swem!

SourceText: Stage Directions
text: Verhoogaanwysings

SourceText: This is the same as Ship to Shore but with Stage Directions. This can be done in an elevated and safe area. The director gives the instructions.
text: Dit is dieselfde as Skip na Wal, maar met Verhoogaanwysings. Dit kan gespeel word op 'n veilige plek met 'n verhoogde area soos 'n platform. Die regisseur gee die aanwysings.

SourceText: “Stage Right” means you go to the right.
text: "Verhoogregs" beteken jy moet na die regterkant gaan.

SourceText: “Stage Left” means you go to the left.
text: "Verhooglinks" beteken jy moet na die linkerkant gaan.

SourceText: “Downstage” means you go down.
text: "Vorentoe" of "voor" of "voorverhoog" beteken jy moet af beweeg.

SourceText: “Upstage” means you go up.
text: "Agtertoe of "agter" beteken jy moet op beweeg.

SourceText: “Centre Stage” means you go to the centre of the stage.”
text: "Middelverhoog" beteken jy gaan na die middel van die verhoog.

SourceText: You can have fun actions like “Dramatic Death, Take a Bow, Open the Curtain, Clean the Floor,” etc.
text: Jy kan prettige instruksies gee soos "Dramatiese Sterfte, Ontvang Applous, Lig die Gordyne, Vee die Vloer," ens.

SourceText: Instead of “Lifeboat” you make “Cast of Actors.” Those not in the cast become the director!
text: In plaas van "Reddingsboot" doen jy "Rolverdeling". Die wat nie 'n rol kry nie, word die regisseur!

SourceText: Superpowers
text: Superkragte

SourceText: Think of a superpower. For example, going anywhere instantly, travelling in time, reading minds.
text: Dink aan 'n superkrag. Byvoorbeeld, om dadelik enige plek toe te kan gaan, tydreis, gedagtes lees.

SourceText: Ask your child “If you had the superpower to […] how would you use it?
text: Vra jou kind "As jy die superkrag gehad het om [...] hoe sal jy dit gebruik?

SourceText: Encourage them to give themselves a superhero name and act it out.
text: Moedig hulle aan om vir hulleself 'n superheld-naam te gee en dit uit te beeld.

SourceText: Now let them choose a super power for you!
text: Laat hulle nou vir jou 'n superkrag kies!

SourceText: Make sure you act it out too!
text: Jy moet dit ook uitbeeld!

SourceText: Transform the object
text: Verander die voorwerp

SourceText: Everyday household items like brooms, mops, or scarfs can become fun props for games
text: Alledaagse voorwerpe in die huis soos besems, moppe of serpe kan prettige items vir speletjies word

SourceText: Place an object in the center of the room and whenever someone has an idea, they jump in and show the rest what the object can be
text: Sit 'n voorwerp in die middel van die kamer en wanneer iemand 'n idee het, spring hulle vorentoe en wys vir die res wat die voorwerp kan wees

SourceText: For example, a broom might be ridden as a horse or a microphone or a guitar!
text: Byvoorbeeld, 'n besem kan gery word soos 'n perd of dit kan 'n mikrofoon of 'n kitaar wees!

SourceText: What Are You Doing?
text: Wat Doen Jy?

SourceText: This game is best when more than 2 people play
text: Hierdie speletjie werk die beste as meer as 2 mense speel

SourceText: One person pretends to be doing something – for example, combing hair or making dinner
text: Een persoon maak of hulle iets doen – byvoorbeeld, kam hare of maak kos

SourceText: Another person asks, “What are you doing?”
text: Iemand anders vra: "Wat doen jy?"

SourceText: The first person needs to say something that has nothing to do with combing hair, for example, “Tying my shoes.”
text: Die eerste persoon moet iets sê wat niks te doen het met hare kam nie, soos: “Ek maak my veters vas.”

SourceText: The second person then starts pretending to tie their shoes until a new person asks, “What are you doing?”
text: Die tweede persoon begin dan maak of hulle hul veters vasmaak totdat 'n nuwe persoon vra: "Wat doen jy?"

SourceText: The answer must always be something different than what you are actually doing!
text: Die antwoord moet altyd iets anders wees as wat jy eintlik besig is om te doen!

SourceText: Worms Go Home
text: Wurms Gaan Huis Toe

SourceText: Lie on your tummies and pretend your index fingers are a wiggly worm.
text: Lê op jul mae en maak of julle wysvingers 'n wriemelende wurm is.

SourceText: With your other hand make a worm house by making a circle with your fingers and thumb and place it on the floor.
text: Maak met jou ander hand 'n wurmhuis deur 'n sirkel met jou vingers en duim te maak en dit op die vloer te sit.

SourceText: Call out an instruction for your finger to touch, like “Worms on noses” or “Worms on ears”
text: Roep 'n instruksie uit vir jou vinger om aan te doen, soos "Wurms op neuse" of "Wurms op ore"

SourceText: When you call out “Worms go home”, your wiggly worm has to find a worm house as quickly as possible.
text: Wanneer jy "Wurms gaan huis toe" uitroep, moet jou wriemelende wurm so gou as moontlik 'n wurmhuis kry.

SourceText: The last worm to find a home calls out the instructions next.
text: Die laaste wurm om 'n huis te kry, moet die volgende instruksies uitroep.

SourceText: Keep playing until you feel rejuvenated from lying down.
text: Hou aan speel totdat die platlê julle nuwe energie gegee het.

SourceText: Blind Dragon
text: Blinde Draak

SourceText: This game is great if you have at least 4 people
text: Hierdie speletjie werk wonderlik as daar ten minste 4 mense speel

SourceText: Tell the story about a ferocious dragon who lived near a village. He would sneak into the village at night and steal people’s treasures – anything they loved.  Anybody who tried to take their treasure back would be eaten alive.  This continued for many years until the dragon became old, fat, and blind from sitting on his treasure and gazing at the glare of the gold coins. Then the townspeople could try and sneak into his lair and steal back their relatives’ treasure.
text: Vertel die storie van 'n woeste draak wat naby 'n klein dorpie gewoon het. Hy sluip in die nagte in die dorpie in en steel die mense se skatte – enigiets waarvan hulle hou.  Enigiemand wat hulle skat probeer terugkry, word lewend opgeëet.  Dit hou aan vir baie jare totdat die draak oud, vet en blind word van al die gesit op die skatte en staar na die glansende goue muntstukke. Toe eers kon die dorp se inwoners probeer om in sy lêplek in te sluip en hulle familieskatte terug te steel.

SourceText: One person plays the dragon. Dragon sits blindfolded or with eyes closed surrounded by a pile of treasure.
text: Een persoon speel die draak. Draak sit geblinddoek of met toe oë, omring deur 'n hoop skatte.

SourceText: Everyone has one piece of treasure that they must steal back.
text: Elkeen het een skat wat hulle moet terugsteel.

SourceText: If the dragon hears you and points at you, you must go back to the starting place.
text: As die draak jou hoor en na jou wys, moet jy teruggaan na die begin.

SourceText: Only one person can try to get the treasure at a time.
text: Net een persoon op 'n slag kan probeer om die skat te kry.

SourceText: Dancing with Angels
text: Dans met Engele

SourceText: This activity helps children learn how to lead. It also builds trust between you and your child.
text: Hierdie aktiwiteit help kinders leer hoe om leiding te neem. Dit bou ook vertroue tussen jou en jou kind.

SourceText: Play a piece of music that is gentle and relaxed to encourage smooth and calming movement.
text: Speel 'n stuk musiek wat sag en ontspanne is waarop julle vloeiend en rustig kan beweeg.

SourceText: One person goes first and closes their eyes while the other person is the guardian angel or protector.
text: Een persoon gaan eerste en maak hulle oë toe terwyl die ander persoon die beskermengel of beskermer is.

SourceText: The guardian angel must protect the person with their eyes closed from harm while gently dancing together.
text: Die beskermengel moet die persoon met die toe oë beskerm van ongeluk terwyl hulle rustig saam dans.

SourceText: When the music ends, the dancer can open their eyes before switching roles.
text: Wanneer die musiek klaar is, kan die danser hulle oë oopmaak en rolle omruil.

SourceText: Drawing
text: Teken

SourceText: Children love to draw! It helps build creativity.
text: Kinders is dol oor teken! Dit help om kreatiwiteit te bou.

SourceText: Get some pens or crayons and a piece of paper or cardboard.
text: Kry penne of kryte en 'n stuk papier of karton.

SourceText: Let your children freely draw whatever they want.
text: Laat jou kinders vrylik teken wat hulle wil.

SourceText: While your child is drawing, use words to describe what they are doing: “I see you are drawing a person” or “I see you are making lines with the red crayon.”
text: Terwyl jou kind teken, gebruik woorde om te beskryf wat hulle doen: "Ek sien jy teken 'n mens" of "Ek sien jy maak lyne met die rooi kryt."

SourceText: You can also have fun drawing next to them.
text: Jy kan ook langs hulle sit en teken.

SourceText: Put their drawings up on the wall, refrigerator, or outside to decorate the house – it will make your children feel appreciated!
text: Plak hulle prente teen die muur, yskas of buite om die huis te versier – dit sal jou kinders gewaardeer laat voel!

SourceText: Listening to Sounds
text: Luister na Klanke

SourceText: Sit down and close your eyes
text: Gaan sit en maak jou oë toe

SourceText: How many sounds can you hear? Listen to the sounds inside and outside the room. Count them on your fingers
text: Hoeveel klanke kan jy hoor? Luister na die klanke binne en buite die kamer. Tel hulle op jou vingers

SourceText: After ten seconds, how many fingers do you have up? What sounds did you hear?
text: Hoeveel vingers hou jy in die lug op na tien sekondes? Watter klanke het jy gehoor?

SourceText: Try again for another ten seconds.
text: Probeer weer vir nog tien sekondes.

SourceText: Can you hear any new sounds? Can you hear any sounds inside your own body?
text: Kan jy enige nuwe klanke hoor? Kan jy enige klanke in jou eie liggaam hoor?

SourceText: Notice how you feel and ask your child how they are feeling.
text: Let op hoe jy voel en vra jou kind hoe hulle voel.

SourceText: Memory game – “When COVID-19 ends…”
text: Geheuespeletjie – "As COVID-19 verby is..."

SourceText: First person says, “When COVID-19 ends, I am going to… (e.g., go to the park)”
text: Eerste persoon sê: "As COVID-19 verby is, gaan ek... (bv. na die park toe gaan)"

SourceText: Second person adds to the first person’s plan, “When COVID-19 ends, I am going to the park and… (e.g., visit my best friend)”
text: Tweede persoon las aan by die eerste persoon se plan: "As COVID-19 verby is, gaan ek na die park toe gaan en... (bv. vir my beste maat kuier)"

SourceText: Each person adds to the previous list of plans, trying to think of all of the fun things to do when COVID-19 ends.
text: Elke persoon las iets aan by die vorige lys planne en dink aan al die prettige dinge om te doen as COVID-19 verby is.

SourceText: Self-portrait
text: Selfportret

SourceText: Here’s how your children can draw a picture of themselves!
text: Hier is hoe jou kinders 'n prentjie van hulleself kan teken!

SourceText: Find a big piece of paper or cardboard. It needs to be the same length or slightly longer than the height of your child
text: Kry 'n groot stuk papier of karton. Dit moet dieselfde lengte of effens langer wees as jou kind

SourceText: Ask your child to lie down on the paper. Carefully draw the outline of your child.
text: Vra jou kind om op die papier te lê. Teken versigtig die buitelyne van jou kind.

SourceText: Now let your child fill in the outline: face, hair, clothes, shoes, or anything they want!
text: Laat jou kind nou die buitelyne invul: gesig, hare, klere, skoene of enigiets wat hulle wil!

SourceText: Ask your child to draw things that they like and do not like outside of the outline
text: Vra jou kind om dinge waarvan hulle hou en nie hou nie buite die buitelyn te teken

SourceText: Have a conversation with your child about these things. You may learn something about your child!
text: Gesels met jou kind oor hierdie dinge. Jy leer dalk iets nuuts omtrent jou kind!

SourceText: You can put their outline up in their room or anywhere in the house – it will make your children feel appreciated!
text: Jy kan hulle buitelyn in hulle kamer opplak, of enige plek in die huis – dit sal jou kinders gewaardeer laat voel!

SourceText: Story time
text: Storietyd

SourceText: Start the story with “Once upon a time there was a…”
text: Begin die storie met "Eendag was daar 'n..."

SourceText: Let your child make up the next sentence
text: Laat jou kind die volgende sin opmaak

SourceText: Then you make up a sentence
text: Dan maak jy 'n sin op

SourceText: Take turns until you have a wonderful new story
text: Maak beurte totdat julle 'n wonderlike nuwe storie het

SourceText: Make sure to end the story on a positive note.
text: Maak seker die storie eindig op 'n positiewe noot.

SourceText: Ask your child what was their favourite part of the story!
text: Vra jou kind wat was hulle gunstelingdeel van die storie!

SourceText: The Interrupter
text: Die Onderbreker

SourceText: Choose a storyteller to start making up a story.
text: Kies 'n storieverteller om 'n storie te begin opmaak.

SourceText: Story listeners can interrupt with a word at any time.
text: Die luisteraars kan enige tyd onderbreek met 'n woord.

SourceText: The storyteller needs to fit that word in their story.
text: Die storieverteller moet daardie woord in die storie inpas.

SourceText: Try with a different storyteller!
text: Probeer met 'n ander storieverteller!

SourceText: Three options
text: Drie opsies

SourceText: Think of three different situations. For example, driving a car, sailing a boat or flying a plane
text: Dink aan drie verskillende situasies. Byvoorbeeld, bestuur 'n kar, seil 'n boot of vlieg 'n vliegtuig

SourceText: Say them to your child and ask, “Which would you prefer?”
text: Noem dit vir jou kind en vra: "Watter een verkies jy?"

SourceText: Ask them why?
text: Vra hulle hoekom?

SourceText: Now think of three more situations or ask your child to do it for you
text: Dink nou aan drie ander situasies of vra jou kind om dit vir jou te doen

SourceText: When I Was Younger
text: Toe ek Jonger Was

SourceText: Children love to hear stories about your own life!
text: Kinders is mal oor stories oor jou lewe!

SourceText: Think of a time when you were younger when something BIG happened to you
text: Dink aan 'n tyd toe jy jonger was toe iets GROOTS met jou gebeur het

SourceText: It can be an adventure, happy memory, or challenge that you experienced
text: Dit kan 'n avontuur, gelukkige herinnering, of uitdaging wees wat jy te bowe moes kom

SourceText: Share it with your child and notice how they listen!
text: Deel dit met jou kind en let op hoe hulle luister!

SourceText: Co-chef
text: Mede-kok

SourceText: Ask your teen what kind of meal they would like to eat.
text: Vra jou tiener wat hulle lus is om te eet.

SourceText: Prepare it together! The first time, you may need to guide them.
text: Maak dit saam! Die eerste keer sal jy hulle moet help.

SourceText: Once your teen knows how to prepare the meal, let them take the lead and follow their instructions.
text: Sodra jou tiener weet hoe om die gereg te maak, laat hulle die leiding neem en volg hulle instruksies.

SourceText: Let each child and teen in the house have a turn at being the head chef.
text: Laat elke kind en tiener in die huis 'n beurt kry om die hoofkok te wees.

SourceText: You can even help them make a budget for ingredients!
text: Jy kan hulle selfs help om 'n begroting vir die bestanddele op te stel!

SourceText: Shake your left hands in the air 8 times while counting to 8.
text: Skud julle linkerhande in die lug 8 keer terwyl julle tot by 8 tel.

SourceText: Do it as fast and loud as you can.
text: Doen dit so vinnig en tel so hard as wat julle kan.

SourceText: Repeat with your other hand. Then do it for each foot.
text: Herhaal met julle ander hand. Doen dit dan vir elke voet.

SourceText: Everyone calls out “Crazy chicken” when you’re finished and does their best crazy chicken dance!
text: Almal skree "Mal hoender" as julle klaar is en doen hulle beste mal hoender-dans!

SourceText: Create a dance choreography to your teen's favorite songs.
text: Werk 'n danschoreografie uit op jou tiener se gunstelingliedjies.

SourceText: Get active!
text: Raak aktief!

SourceText: Come up with three types of exercise together. For example, walking, jogging, soccer or dancing
text: Dink saam aan drie soorte oefeninge. Byvoorbeeld, stap, draf, sokker of dans

SourceText: Pick one together and try it out.
text: Kies een en probeer dit.

SourceText: If you both like it, decide how often you are going to do it. Once or twice a week? Every morning?
text: As julle albei daarvan hou, besluit hoe dikwels julle dit gaan doen. Een of twee keer 'n week? Elke oggend?

SourceText: Together think of ways to make it even more fun. Can you jog to a certain point? Take turns in being the coach? Motivate each other with a small free reward?
text: Dink saam aan maniere om dit selfs meer pret te maak. Kan julle tot by 'n sekere punt draf? Maak beurte om die afrigter te wees? Motiveer mekaar met 'n klein, gratis beloning?

SourceText: When we are able to have peaceful and loving relationships, our children feel more secure and loved. Today's tip is about how we can support positive family relationships at home.
text: Wanneer ons vreedsame en liefdevolle verhoudings kan handhaaf, voel ons kinders meer veilig en gelief. Vandag se wenk is oor hoe ons positiewe gesinsverhoudinge by die huis kan bevorder.

SourceText: Everyone else must guess the name of the tune (to make it harder, they can guess the singer).
text: Almal moet raai watter wysie dit is (om dit moeiliker te maak, kan hulle die sanger raai).

SourceText: The first one to guess it right becomes the next leader who will choose or sing the next song.
text: Die eerste een wat reg raai word die volgende leier wat die volgende liedjie kan kies of sing.

SourceText: Pass the Snap
text: Vingerklap

SourceText: This game is best with at least 3 people.
text: Hierdie speletjie werk die beste met ten minste 3 mense.

SourceText: Start in a circle and pass one snap around the circle (or clap if you cannot snap).
text: Staan in 'n kring en gee vir mekaar 'n vingerklap aan (of handeklap as julle nie kan vingerklap nie).

SourceText: You snap once to throw the snap.
text: Klap jou vingers een keer om die vingerklap te "gooi".

SourceText: You can bounce the snap, throw it in the air, and catch it a few times before passing it.
text: Jy kan die vingerklap 'n paar keer hop, in die lug op gooi, en dit vang voor jy dit aangee.

SourceText: The direction (up, down, straight, curved, rolling the ground) and force (hard, soft, medium) that you throw the snap should affect how the person catches it.
text: Die rigting (op, af, reguit, met 'n draai, oor die vloer gerol) en intensiteit (hard, sag, medium) waarmee jy die vingerklap gooi, bepaal hoe die ander persoon dit vang.

SourceText: Look at the person you are throwing the snap to.
text: Kyk na die persoon vir wie jy die vingerklap gooi.

SourceText: The person who will catch it has to snap once to catch it.
text: Die persoon wat dit vang, moet een keer vingerklap om dit te vang.

SourceText: When everyone gets good at this, you can start moving around the room, still passing around the snap.
text: Wanneer almal begin goed raak hiermee, kan julle begin om in die kamer rond te beweeg en steeds vir mekaar vingerklappe aan te gee.

SourceText: Can you throw under the leg?  Behind the back?  Through your head?  Intercept a pass? Have fun with the snap!
text: Kan jy dit onder deur jou been gooi?  Agter jou rug?  Deur jou kop?  Dit onderskep? Gaan mal met die vingerklap!

SourceText: This game is best when more than 2 people play.
text: Hierdie speletjie werk die beste as meer as 2 mense dit speel.

SourceText: One person pretends to be doing something – for example, combing hair.
text: Een persoon maak of hulle iets doen – byvoorbeeld hare kam.

SourceText: A second person asks, “What are you doing?”
text: 'n Tweede persoon vra: "Wat doen jy?"

SourceText: The second person’s answer must always be something different from what they are actually doing!
text: Die tweede persoon se antwoord moet altyd iets anders wees as wat hulle eintlik besig is om te doen!

SourceText: The next person should act out the second person’s answer and when someone asks what they are doing, their answer must be different from what they are actually doing!
text: Die volgende persoon moet die tweede persoon se antwoord uitbeeld en wanneer iemand vra wat hulle doen, moet hulle antwoord verskillend wees van wat hulle eintlik besig is om te doen!

SourceText: What’s new?
text: Wat’s nuut?

SourceText: Think of a new skill you could learn together with your teen. For example, keeping a ball in the air or your foot, juggling, learning a new language, or playing an instrument?
text: Dink aan 'n nuwe vaardigheid wat jy saam met jou tiener kan leer. Byvoorbeeld, hou 'n bal in die lug of jou voet, ‘juggle’, leer 'n nuwe taal, of speel 'n instrument?

SourceText: Take turns in trying the new skill out.
text: Maak beurte om die nuwe vaardigheid te probeer.

SourceText: Make sure to praise each other, and try to learn and play together!
text: Onthou om mekaar te prys, en probeer om saam te leer en te speel!

SourceText: It might help to think of wishes, dreams, experiences at school, likes or dislikes. For example, I hate bananas, my favourite subject is science, and I really wish I could sing.
text: Dit kan help om te dink aan wense, drome, belewenisse by die skool, voorkeure of afkere. Byvoorbeeld, ek haat piesangs, my gunstelingvak is wetenskap, en ek wens ek kon sing.

SourceText: Say them to your teenager. Ask them to guess which one is a lie.
text: Sê dit vir jou tiener. Vra hulle om te raai watter een 'n leuen is.

SourceText: Now ask them to do the same. Did you learn something new about each other?
text: Vra hulle nou om dieselfde te doen. Het julle iets nuuts van mekaar geleer?

SourceText: Talk to your teen about one positive or fun thing they did.
text: Praat met jou tiener oor een positiewe of lekker ding wat hulle gedoen het.

SourceText: Dream Travel
text: Droomreis

SourceText: You can’t travel but you can dream! Ask your teen these questions.
text: Ons mag dalk nie reis nie, maar ons kan droom! Vra jou tiener hierdie vrae.

SourceText: Where do you want to travel? How long will you be away? What will you pack? What will you do? What will you see?
text: Waarheen wil jy graag reis? Hoe lank gaan jy weg wees? Wat gaan jy inpak? Wat gaan jy doen? Wat gaan jy alles sien?

SourceText: Look at a map together if you have one.
text: Kyk saam na 'n kaart as julle een het.

SourceText: Choose a country that they’ve never heard of and look it up together online.
text: Kies 'n land waarvan hulle nog nooit gehoor het nie en soek dit op aanlyn.

SourceText: How was your day?
text: Hoe was jou dag?

SourceText: Ask each other, “What made you happy today?”
text: Vra vir mekaar: "Wat het jou vandag bly gemaak?"

SourceText: Ask each other, “What was difficult today?”
text: Vra vir mekaar: "Wat was vir jou moeilik vandag?"

SourceText: Ask each other, “How can we help you?”
text: Vra vir mekaar: "Hoe kan ons jou help?"

SourceText: Try to do this together every day, when you are eating together or before bed
text: Probeer om dit elke dag saam te doen, wanneer julle saam eet of voor slaaptyd

SourceText: Just a friendly chat
text: Net 'n vriendelike geselsie

SourceText: Have a conversation with your teen about something they like.
text: Gesels met jou tiener oor iets waarvan hulle hou.

SourceText: It can be about anything they choose to talk about: sports, friends, music, celebrities…
text: Hulle kan kies om oor enigiets te praat: sport, vriende, musiek, bekendes...

SourceText: Try to listen to your teen and give them space to talk.
text: Probeer om na jou tiener te luister en gee hulle ruimte om te praat.

SourceText: What new thing did you learn about your teen from your chat?
text: Watter nuwe ding het jy oor jy tiener uitgevind uit hierdie gesprek?

SourceText: Make up a story!
text: Maak 'n storie op!

SourceText: Let your teen make up the next sentence.
text: Laat jou tiener die volgende sin opmaak.

SourceText: Then you make up a sentence.
text: Dan maak jy 'n sin op.

SourceText: Take turns until you have a wonderful new story.
text: Maak beurte totdat julle 'n wonderlike nuwe storie het.

SourceText: Ask your teen what was their favourite part of the story!
text: Vra jou tiener watter deel van die storie was hulle gunsteling!

SourceText: Ask your teen “If you had the superpower to […] how would you use it?”
text: Vra jou tiener: "As jy die superkrag gehad het om [...] hoe sal jy dit gebruik?"

SourceText: Encourage them to give themselves a superhero name and act like a superhero.
text: Moedig hulle aan om hulleself 'n superheld-naam te gee en te maak of hulle 'n superheld is.

SourceText: Now let them choose a super power for you.
text: Laat hulle nou vir jou 'n superkrag kies.

SourceText: Make sure you act it out too!
text: Jy moet dit ook uitbeeld!

SourceText: Think of three different situations. For example, driving a car, sailing a boat, or flying a plane.
text: Dink aan drie verskillende situasies. Byvoorbeeld, bestuur 'n kar, seil 'n boot of vlieg 'n vliegtuig.

SourceText: Say them to your teen and ask, “Which would you prefer?”
text: Noem dit vir jou tiener en vra: "Watter een verkies jy?"

SourceText: Now think of three more situations or ask your teen to do it for you.
text: Dink nou aan nog drie situasies of vra jou tiener om dit vir jou te doen.

SourceText: Second person adds to first person’s plan, “When COVID-19 ends, I am going to the park and… (e.g., visit my best friend)”
text: Tweede persoon las aan by die eerste persoon se plan: "Wanneer COVID-19 verby is, gaan ek park toe gaan en... (bv. by my beste maat gaan kuier)"

SourceText: Yes, No or Maybe
text: Ja, Nee of Miskien

SourceText: Ask each other questions. They can be any questions about things you like or what you did today.
text: Vra mekaar vrae. Dit kan enige vrae wees oor dinge waarvan julle hou of wat julle vandag gedoen het.

SourceText: The only rule is that you can’t answer Yes, No or Maybe
text: Die enigste reël is dat julle nie Ja, Nee of Miskien mag antwoord nie

SourceText: How long can you last? How creative can you get with your answers?
text: Hoe lank kan julle uithou? Hoe kreatief kan julle met julle antwoorde raak?

SourceText: Swap over and play again!
text: Ruil om en speel weer!

SourceText: There are no bad children...only difficult behaviours! All children misbehave but these tips can help.
text: Daar is geen slegte kinders nie...net moeilike gedrag! Alle kinders gedra hulle sleg, maar hierdie wenke kan help.

SourceText: Which child do you want tips for?
text: Vir watter kind wil jy wenke hê?

SourceText: Please select the age of your child:
text: Kies asseblief die ouderdom van jou kind:

SourceText: A. Under 1 month
text: A. Jonger as 1 maand

SourceText: B. 1-2 months
text: B. 1-2 maande

SourceText: C. 3-5 months
text: C. 3-5 maande

SourceText: D. 6-9 months
text: D. 6-9 maande

SourceText: E. 10 -14 months
text: E. 10-14 maande

SourceText: F. 15-18 months
text: F. 15-18 maande

SourceText: G. 19-23 months
text: G. 19-23 maande

SourceText: Which behaviour is most like the one you want support for?
text: Watter gedrag is die meeste soos die gedrag waarvoor jy ondersteuning wil hê?

SourceText: Here are 8 simple tips to help you with your teen:
text: Hier is 8 eenvoudige wenke om jou met jou tiener te help:

SourceText: 1. Keep it positive
text: 1. Hou dinge positief

SourceText: 2. Invest in time
text: 2. Belê in tyd

SourceText: 3. Create routines
text: 3. Stel roetines vas

SourceText: 4. Be open to your children
text: 4. Wees oop teenoor jou kinders

SourceText: 5. Use reasonable consequences
text: 5. Gee keuses met redelike gevolge

SourceText: 6. Solve problems with your teen
text: 6. Los probleme saam met jou tiener op

SourceText: 7. Keeping your teen safe online
text: 7. Beveilig jou tiener aanlyn

SourceText: 8. Resolving crises when they happen
text: 8. Los krisisse op soos dit julle pad kruis

SourceText: Type "1" to "8" if you want to learn more about a specific strategy.
text: Tik "1" tot "8" as jy meer oor 'n spesifieke strategie wil uitvind.

SourceText: Here are 5 simple tips to help you with your babies:
text: Hier is 5 eenvoudige wenke om jou te help met jou babas:

SourceText: 1. Play with your baby
text: 1. Speel met jou baba

SourceText: 2. Create routines
text: 2. Stel roetines vas

SourceText: 3. Share books with your baby
text: 3. Lees boeke saam met jou baba

SourceText: 4. Cope with crying
text: 4. Hanteer huilery

SourceText: 5. Redirect them to positive behaviours
text: 5. Herlei hulle aandag na positiewe gedrag

SourceText: Type "1" to "5" if you want to learn more about a specific strategy.
text: Tik "1" tot "5" as jy meer oor 'n spesifieke strategie wil uitvind.

SourceText: Here are 9 simple tips to help you with your children:
text: Hier is 9 eenvoudige wenke om jou met jou kinders te help:

SourceText: 6. Ignore attention seeking and demanding behaviours
text: 6. Ignoreer aandagsoekende en veeleisende gedrag

SourceText: 7. Use reasonable consequences
text: 7. Gee keuses met redelike gevolge

SourceText: 8. Solving problems with your child
text: 8. Los probleme saam met jou kind op

SourceText: 9. Keeping your child safe online
text: 9. Beveilig jou kind aanlyn

SourceText: Type "1" to "9" if you want to learn more about a specific strategy.
text: Tik "1" tot "9" as jy meer oor 'n spesifieke strategie wil uitvind.

SourceText: Remember that you’re in charge of what they eat, but not how much. Newborns have stomach the size of a grape! They need to eat often (sometimes in the middle of the night.
text: Onthou, jy is in beheer van wat hulle eet, maar nie hoe baie hulle eet nie. Pasgeborenes se mae is so groot soos 'n druiwekorrel! Hulle moet dikwels eet (soms in die middel van die nag).

SourceText: It’s important to build trust around eating, especially as your baby starts on solid food. Let them know you are listening to their wishes in the eating department. They’ll be ravenous again soon!
text: Dis belangrik om vertroue te bou rondom eet, veral wanneer jou baba met vaste kos begin. Laat hulle weet jy luister na hulle wense wanneer dit by eet kom. Hulle gaan gou-gou weer rasend honger wees!

SourceText: Would you like suggestions for active and calm things to do with @fields.child_nickname?
text: Wil jy graag voorstelle hê vir aktiewe en rustige dinge om met @fields.child_nickname te doen?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: When your children ask you about COVID-19, be willing to talk. They will already have heard something. Silence and secrets do not protect our children. Honesty and openness do. Think about how much they will understand. You know them best.
text: Wanneer jou kinders jou oor COVID-19 uitvra, wees gewillig om te praat. Hulle sou reeds dinge gehoor het. Stilte en geheime beskerm nie ons kinders nie. Eerlikheid en openlikheid beskerm hulle wel. Dink oor hoeveel hulle sal verstaan. Jy ken hulle die beste.

SourceText: Here's a video to help you talk about COVID-19 with your children!
text: Hier is 'n video om jou te help om met jou kinders oor COVID-19 te praat!

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you talk about COVID-19 with your children!
text: Hier is 'n oudioboodskap om jou te help om met jou kinders oor COVID-19 te praat!

SourceText: That's okay! You can always type "Help" if you want to learn more about how to talk about COVID-19 with your child. Chat to you later!
text: Dis oukei! Jy kan altyd "Help" tik as jy meer wil uitvind oor hoe om met jou kind oor COVID-19 te praat. Ons praat later!

SourceText: Here are 4 simple steps that you can do when talking about COVID-19 with your children:
text: Hier is 4 eenvoudige stappe wat jy kan volg wanneer jy met jou kinders oor COVID-19 praat:

SourceText: 1. Be open, honest, and supportive
text: 1. Wees oop, eerlik en ondersteunend

SourceText: 2. It is okay not to know the answers
text: 2. Dit is oukei as jy nie die antwoorde het nie

SourceText: 3. Be a hero not a bully
text: 3. Wees 'n held, nie 'n boelie nie

SourceText: 4. End on a good note
text: 4. Eindig op 'n goeie noot

SourceText: Type "1" to "4" to learn more about each tip. Type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Tik "1" tot "4" om meer oor elke wenk uit te vind. Tik "N" om hierdie wenk te stop.

SourceText: Step 3. Be a hero not a bully
text: Stap 3. Wees 'n held, nie 'n boelie nie

SourceText: Explain that COVID-19 has nothing to do with the way someone looks, where they are from, or what language they speak.
text: Verduidelik dat COVID-19 niks te doen het met hoe iemand lyk, waar hulle vandaan kom, of watter taal hulle praat nie.

SourceText: Here is a comic on how to talk to your child about COVID-19.
text: Hier is 'n strokiesprent oor hoe om met jou kind oor COVID-19 te praat.

SourceText: Child: “Am I going to get coronavirus?”
text: Kind: "Gaan ek die koronavirus kry?"

SourceText: Parent: “It is very possible that we will all get coronavirus. But younger people do not normally get very sick.”
text: Ouer: "Dit is baie moontlik dat ons almal die koronavirus gaan kry. Maar jonger mense word gewoonlik nie baie siek nie."

SourceText: Child: “I am scared…”
text: Kind: "Ek is bang..."

SourceText: Parent: “It is okay to be afraid. We are all a bit scared about this. But we have each other and can do our best to keep ourselves and other people safe and healthy.”
text: Ouer: "Dis oukei om bang te wees. Ons almal is 'n bietjie bang hiervoor. Maar ons het mekaar en ons kan ons bes doen om onsself en ander veilig en gesond te hou."

SourceText: Child: “How can we keep safe?”
text: Kind: "Hoe kan ons veilig bly?"

SourceText: Parent: “We can wash our hands regularly for 20 seconds. We can also keep a good physical distance away from people. We also need to try to avoid touching our faces as much as possible.”
text: Ouer: "Ons kan ons hande gereeld was vir 20 sekondes. Ons kan ook 'n goeie fisiese afstand van mense af bly. Ons moet ook probeer om so min as moontlik aan ons gesigte te vat."

SourceText: Child, “Okay…”
text: Kind: "Oukei..."

SourceText: Child: “What happens to your body when you get coronavirus?”
text: Kind: "Wat gebeur met jou liggaam as jy die koronavirus kry?"

SourceText: Parent: “To tell you the truth, I don’t know exactly. How about we look on the UNICEF website together?”
text: Ouer: "Om eerlik te wees, weet ek nie presies nie. Kom ons kyk bietjie op UNICEF se webwerf?"

SourceText: WHO: https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019/advice-for-public
text: WGO: https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019/advice-for-public

SourceText: UNICEF: https://www.unicef.org/coronavirus/covid-19
text: UNICEF: https://www.unicef.org/coronavirus/covid-19

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to talk about COVID-19 with your children:
text: Kies asseblief 'n ander nommer as jy meer wil uitvind oor hoe om met jou kinders oor COVID-19 te praat:

SourceText: Step 1. Be open, honest, and supportive
text: Stap 1. Wees oop, eerlik en ondersteunend

SourceText: Allow @fields.child_nickname to talk freely. Ask them open questions and find out how much they already know.
text: Gee @fields.child_nickname kans om vrylik te praat. Vra oop vrae en vind uit hoeveel hulle reeds weet.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Allow your child to talk freely. Ask them open questions and find out how much they already know.
text: Gee jou kind kans om vrylik te praat. Vra oop vrae en vind uit hoeveel hulle reeds weet.

SourceText: Always answer their questions truthfully. Think about how old @fields.child_nickname is and how much they can understand.
text: Beantwoord altyd hulle vrae met die waarheid. Dink aan hoe oud @fields.child_nickname is en hoeveel hulle reeds kan verstaan.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: @fields.child_nickname may be scared or confused. Give them space to share how they are feeling and let them know you are there for them.
text: @fields.child_nickname is dalk bang of verward. Gee hulle ruimte om te deel hoe hulle voel en laat hulle weet jy is daar vir hulle.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Always answer their questions truthfully. Think about how old your child is and how much they can understand.
text: Beantwoord altyd hulle vrae met die waarheid. Dink aan hoe oud jou kind is en hoeveel hulle reeds kan verstaan.

SourceText: Your child may be scared or confused. Give them space to share how they are feeling and let them know you are there for them.
text: Jou kind is dalk bang of verward. Gee hulle ruimte om te deel hoe hulle voel en laat hulle weet jy is daar vir hulle.

SourceText: Step 4. End on a good note
text: Stap 4. Eindig op 'n goeie noot

SourceText: Check to see if @fields.child_nickname is okay. Remind them that you care and that they can talk to you anytime. Then do something fun together!
text: Kyk of @fields.child_nickname oukei is. Herinner hulle dat jy omgee en dat hulle enige tyd met jou kan praat. Doen dan iets lekkers saam!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Check to see if your child is okay. Remind them that you care and that they can talk to you anytime. Then do something fun together!
text: Kyk of jou kind oukei is. Herinner hulle dat jy omgee en dat hulle enige tyd met jou kan praat. Doen dan iets lekkers saam!

SourceText: Step 2. It is OK not to know the answers.
text: Stap 2. Dit is OK as jy nie die antwoorde het nie.

SourceText: It is fine to say “We don’t know, but we are working on it; or we don’t know, ‘but we think’.”  Use this as an opportunity to learn something new with @fields.child_nickname. The WHO and UNICEF websites are great first steps to learn.
text: Dit is oukei om te sê "Ons weet nie, maar ons werk daaraan; of ons weet nie, ‘maar ons dink’."  Gebruik dit as 'n geleentheid om iets nuuts saam met @fields.child_nickname. te leer. Die WGO en UNICEF se webwerwe is wonderlike eerste stappe hiervoor.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: It is fine to say “We don’t know, but we are working on it; or we don’t know, ‘but we think’.”  Use this as an opportunity to learn something new with your child. The WHO and UNICEF websites are great first steps to learn.
text: Dit is oukei om te sê "Ons weet nie, maar ons werk daaraan; of ons weet nie, ‘maar ons dink’."  Gebruik dit as 'n geleentheid om iets nuuts saam met jou kind te leer. Die WGO en UNICEF se webwerwe is wonderlike eerste stappe hiervoor.

SourceText: Tell @fields.child_nickname that we can be compassionate to people who are sick and those who are caring for them.
text: Sê vir @fields.child_nickname dat ons deernis kan hê met mense wat siek is en dié wat vir hulle sorg.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Tell your child that we can be compassionate to people who are sick and those who are caring for them.
text: Sê vir jou kind dat ons deernis kan hê met mense wat siek is en dié wat vir hulle sorg.

SourceText: Well done for adding another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Over the next few days, try to talk about COVID-19 with your child in a supportive way. It will make them feel loved and safe. You are the hero of this story!
text: Jy het nog 'n vaardigheid by jou Ouerskap-gereedskapkis gevoeg het, wel gedaan! Probeer om oor die volgende paar dae op 'n ondersteunende manier met jou kind oor COVID-19 te praat. Dit sal hulle gelief en veilig laat voel. Jy is die held van hierdie storie!

SourceText: Well done for adding another layer to your House of Support! Over the next few days, try to talk about COVID-19 with your child in a supportive way. It will make them feel loved and safe. You are the hero of this story!
text: Jy het nog 'n vlak by jou Huis van Ondersteuning gevoeg het, wel gedaan! Probeer om oor die volgende paar dae op 'n ondersteunende manier met jou kind oor COVID-19 te praat. Dit sal hulle gelief en veilig laat voel. Jy is die held van hierdie storie!

SourceText: I understand that these times can be really difficult.  Please type "Help" if you want any extra support or guidance. Chat to you later!
text: Ek verstaan dat hierdie tye regtig moeilik kan wees.  Tik asseblief "Help" as jy enige ekstra ondersteuning of leiding nodig het. Ons praat later!

SourceText: Sometimes we feel frustrated with our children because we expect them to behave in ways that they are not yet developmentally ready for.
text: Soms voel ons gefrustreerd met ons kinders omdat ons van hulle verwag om bo hulle ontwikkelingsvlak op te tree.

SourceText: Learning about child development means we can have realistic expectations and also to spot any problems with their growth and development.
text: Met kennis van kinderontwikkeling kan ons realistiese verwagtinge hê en ook enige probleme met hulle groei en ontwikkeling raaksien.

SourceText: All children develop at different rates. Here's a video to help you understand what to expect from your children.
text: Alle kinders ontwikkel teen verskillende tempo’s. Hier is 'n video om jou te help verstaan wat om van jou kinders te verwag.

SourceText: All children develop at different rates. Here's an audio message to help you understand what to expect from your children.
text: Alle kinders ontwikkel teen verskillende tempo’s. Hier is 'n oudioboodskap om jou te help verstaan wat om van jou kinders te verwag.

SourceText: That's okay! You can always type "Help" if you want to learn more about child development.
text: Dis oukei! Jy kan altyd "Help" tik as jy meer oor kinderontwikkeling wil uitvind.

SourceText: All children develop at different rates. But there are some things that we expect children to be able to do at an age. These are called ‘development’ milestones.
text: Alle kinders ontwikkel teen verskillende tempo’s. Maar daar is sommige dinge wat van kinders op 'n sekere ouderdom verwag word. Dit word "ontwikkelingsmylpale" genoem.

SourceText: Many things affect our children's development. For example, development is helped by eating healthy food, having immunisations, and parents or caregivers who talk to them a lot.
text: Baie dinge het 'n uitwerking op ons kinders se ontwikkeling. Byvoorbeeld, ontwikkeling word aangehelp deur gesonde kos, immunisering, en ouers en versorgers wat baie met hulle praat.

SourceText: Which child development milestones do you want to learn about?
text: Oor watter ontwikkelingsmylpale wil jy meer weet?

SourceText: Sorry I don't understand what you mean.
text: Jammer ek verstaan nie wat jy bedoel nie.

SourceText: Young children have similar needs as toddlers.  Here's an audio message to help you understand your child's developmental needs better.
text: Jong kinders het soortgelyke behoeftes as kleuters.  Hier is 'n oudioboodskap om jou te help om jou kind se ontwikkelingsbehoeftes beter te verstaan.

SourceText: Babies from 0 to 1 year need lots of play and attention. Here's a video to help you understand your child's developmental needs better.
text: Babas van 0 tot 1 jaar moet baie speel en het baie aandag nodig. Hier is 'n video om jou te help om jou kind se ontwikkelingsbehoeftes beter te verstaan.

SourceText: Babies from 0 to 1 year need lots of play and attention. Here's an audio message to help you understand your child's developmental needs better.
text: Babas van 0 tot 1 jaar moet baie speel en het baie aandag nodig. Hier is 'n oudioboodskap om jou te help om jou kind se ontwikkelingsbehoeftes beter te verstaan.

SourceText: Young children have similar needs as toddlers.  Here's a video to help you understand your child's developmental needs better.
text: Jong kinders het soortgelyke behoeftes as kleuters.  Hier is 'n video om jou te help om jou kind se ontwikkelingsbehoeftes beter te verstaan.

SourceText: Young children (4-6 years):
text: Jong kinders (4-6 jaar):

SourceText: • Same as toddlers, but also...
text: • Dieselfde as kleuters, maar ook...

SourceText: • Learn through actions and play.
text: • Leer deur dinge te doen en te speel.

SourceText: • Develop friendships with other children
text: • Ontwikkel vriendskappe met ander kinders

SourceText: • Find it difficult to separate make-believe from reality. Still express feelings in dramatic ways!
text: • Sukkel om speel-speel van die realiteit te onderskei. Wys hulle gevoelens steeds op dramatiese maniere!

SourceText: Young teenagers (10-12 years)
text: Jong tieners (10-12 jaar)

SourceText: • More interested in learning in school.
text: • Stel meer belang in leer in die skool.

SourceText: • Start to want independence and trust.
text: • Wil begin onafhanklik wees en vertrou word.

SourceText: • Want to spend time with other children and young teenagers.
text: • Wil tyd met ander kinders en jong tieners spandeer.

SourceText: • May be interested in religion or spirituality
text: • Kan dalk in godsdiens of spiritualiteit belangstel

SourceText: • May answer back to adults to show that they “know”.
text: • Kan terugantwoord op volwassenes om te wys hulle "weet".

SourceText: • Can be very self-conscious and sensitive
text: • Kan baie selfbewus en sensitief wees

SourceText: • Can learn to better manage anger and tolerate frustration.
text: • Kan leer om woede beter te hanteer en frustrasie te verdra.

SourceText: Infant (0–1 year) needs:
text: Baba/peuter (0-1 jaar) het die volgende nodig:

SourceText: • Us to provide food, sleep, cleaning, comfort and safety.
text: • Dat ons voorsien in hulle behoeftes van eet, slaap, skoon en gemaklik wees, en veilig wees.

SourceText: • A strong bond with parent/ caregiver.
text: • 'n Sterk band met ouer/versorger.

SourceText: • Lots of play and attention - the most active time of brain development is during the first 1000 days of life!
text: • Baie speel en aandag – die mees aktiewe tyd van breinontwikkeling is gedurende die eerste 1000 lewensdae!

SourceText: Middle teenagers (13-14 years)
text: Middel tieners (13-14 jaar)

SourceText: • Begin to challenge adult rules
text: • Begin om volwasse reëls uit te daag

SourceText: • Are often insecure and confused.
text: • Voel dikwels onseker en deurmekaar.

SourceText: • Feelings get hurt easily and have mood swings
text: • Gevoelens kry maklik seer en het gemoedskommelinge

SourceText: • Try to be the boss and are unhappy if they lose.
text: • Probeer baas speel en is ongelukkig as hulle verloor.
