SourceText: Infants (0-1):
text: Babas/peuters (0-1):

SourceText: • 0–6 months: Smile, babble and cry to attract your attention. We should provide care, cuddling and protection.
text: • 0-6 maande: Glimlag, babbel en huil om jou aandag te trek. Ons moet sorg, koestering en beskerming gee.

SourceText: • 6–11 months: Cling to you, especially when feeling insecure or frightened.
text: • 6-11 maande: Klou aan jou, veral as hulle onseker of bang voel.

SourceText: • 12–23 months: Start to walk, talk and explore things around them!
text: • 12-23 maande: Begin loop, praat en dinge rondom hulle verken!

SourceText: • Their friends are important and affect their choices
text: • Hulle vriende is belangrik en beïnvloed hulle besluite

SourceText: • Need some freedom but also reliable rules that don't change
text: • Het 'n mate van vryheid nodig, maar ook standvastige reëls wat nie verander nie

SourceText: • Need affection, reassurance, self-esteem, encouragement to believe in their abilities
text: • Het behoefte aan liefde, gerusstelling, selfagting, aanmoediging om in hulle vermoëns te glo

SourceText: Toddlers (2-3 years):
text: Kleuters (2-3 jaar):

SourceText: • Become a curious little explorer - watch out for climbing!
text: • Word nuuskierige verkennertjies – pasop vir klim!

SourceText: • Learn through play and trying things out
text: • Leer deur speel en dinge uit te probeer

SourceText: • Want to learn how to do new things (like getting dressed) and make their own decisions.
text: • Wil leer hoe om nuwe dinge te doen (soos aantrek) en hulle eie besluite te neem.

SourceText: • Want your praise and your approval
text: • Wil jou lof en goedkeuring hê

SourceText: • May talk a lot; ask many questions. We should be honest when we reply! Our child may ask again if they don't understand or want to know more
text: • Kan baie praat; baie vrae vra. Ons moet eerlik wees wanneer ons antwoord! Ons kind kan dalk weer vra as hulle nie verstaan nie of meer wil weet

SourceText: • Does not like to lose, share or take turns, but losing and taking turns can be taught.
text: • Hou nie van verloor, deel of beurte nie, maar 'n mens kan leer om te verloor en beurte te kry.

SourceText: Older teenagers (15–19 years)
text: Ouer tieners (15-19 jaar)

SourceText: • The teen years are the second most active time of brain development!
text: • Die tienerjare is die tweede mees aktiefste tyd van breinontwikkeling!

SourceText: • Your child is almost an adult, they are able to communicate with you about
text: • Jou kind is amper 'n volwassene, hulle kan met jou kommunikeer oor

SourceText: almost anything.
text: omtrent enigiets.

SourceText: • They can think about new ideas, develop their own ideals and set their own course.
text: • Hulle kan nuwe idees uitdink, hulle eie ideale ontwikkel en hulle eie koers vasstel.

SourceText: • Start speaking in sentences and  learning new words.
text: • Begin praat in sinne en leer nuwe woorde.

SourceText: • Does not like to lose or take turns, but sharing can be taught.
text: • Hou nie van verloor of om beurte te vat nie, maar 'n mens kan leer om te deel.

SourceText: • May express feelings in dramatic ways (like screaming on the floor!). Can start to learn how to manage their feelings.
text: • Kan gevoelens op dramatiese maniere wys (soos skree op die vloer!). Kan begin leer hoe om hulle gevoelens te hanteer.

SourceText: Older children (7-9 years)
text: Ouer kinders (7-9) jaar

SourceText: • Same early childhood, but also…
text: • Dieselfde as vroeë kinderjare, maar ook...

SourceText: • Interested in learning at school.
text: • Stel belang in leer op skool.

SourceText: • Starts to want independence and trust.
text: • Wil begin onafhanklik wees en vertrou word.

SourceText: • Wants to spend time with other children.
text: • Wil tyd met ander kinders spandeer.

SourceText: • They are forming their own identity and have a growing sense of their
text: • Hulle vorm hulle eie identiteit en kry 'n ontluikende gevoel van hulle

SourceText: sexuality
text: seksualiteit

SourceText: • They may prefer being with peers more than with you
text: • Hulle kan dalk eerder by hulle portuur wil wees as by jou

SourceText: • They may show risk-taking behaviours, frequent mood swings, and rebellious
text: • Hulle kan risikogedrag begin toon, gereelde gemoedskommelings, en rebelse

SourceText: • Can be very self-conscious and sensitive. May be very active. By now they should be getting better at managing anger and frustration.

SourceText: • Encourage them to begin to take responsibility for the future

SourceText: All children, including those living with disabilities, need love, respect and time especially at difficult times.
text: Alle kinders, ook dié wat met gestremdhede leef, het liefde, respek en tyd nodig, veral in moeilike tye.

SourceText: Here's a video to help you support children living with disabilities.
text: Hier is 'n video om jou te help om kinders wat met gestremdhede leef, te ondersteun.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you support children living with disabilities.
text: Hier is 'n oudioboodskap om jou te help om kinders wat met gestremdhede leef, te ondersteun.

SourceText: That's okay! You can always type "Help" if you want to learn more about how to support children living with disabilities.
text: Dis oukei! Jy kan altyd "Help" tik as jy meer wil uitvind oor hoe om kinders wat met gestremdhede leef, te ondersteun.

SourceText: Here are 6 simple tips that you can do to support children living with disabilities:
text: Hier is 6 eenvoudige wenke vir dinge wat jy kan doen om kinders wat met gestremdhede leef, te ondersteun:

SourceText: 1. Keep your child safe and well
text: 1. Hou jou kind veilig en gesond

SourceText: 2. Try to understand what they are feeling
text: 2. Probeer om te verstaan hoe hulle voel

SourceText: 3. Communicate and talk with them
text: 3. Kommunikeer en praat met hulle

SourceText: 4. Praise them!
text: 4. Prys hulle!

SourceText: 5. Make things that you do the same every day to help them feel secure
text: 5. Maak dinge wat jy doen elke dag dieselfde om hulle te help veilig voel

SourceText: 6. Ask for help if you can
text: 6. Vra hulp as jy kan

SourceText: Type "1" to "6" to learn more about each tip. Type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Tik "1" tot "6" om meer oor elke wenk uit te vind. Tik "N" om hierdie wenk te stop.

SourceText: Step 4. Praise them!
text: Stap 4. Prys hulle!

SourceText: • Praise them for behaving well, and for trying.
text: • Prys hulle vir goeie gedrag, en vir probeer.

SourceText: • Focus on what they can do, not what they can't.
text: • Fokus op wat hulle kan doen, nie wat hulle nié kan nie.

SourceText: • Only help children when they need it. It is also good to build independence!
text: • Help kinders slegs wanneer hulle dit nodig het. Dit is ook goed om onafhanklikheid te bou!

SourceText: Step 6. Ask for help if you can
text: Stap 6. Vra hulp as jy kan

SourceText: • Share the load with other adult family members.
text: • Deel die lading met ander volwasse gesinslede.

SourceText: •  You are not alone! Keep connected with people who understand your situation.
text: • Jy is nie alleen nie! Bly in kontak met mense wat jou situasie verstaan.

SourceText: Here is a comic on how you can reinforce your child's strength.
text: Hier is 'n strokiesprent oor hoe jy jou kind se innerlike krag kan versterk.

SourceText: • Share your challenges AND your successes.
text: • Deel julle uitdagings EN julle suksesse.

SourceText: • It is normal to feel stressed, frustrated, and afraid at this time.
text: • Dit is normaal om soms gestres, gefrustreerd en bang te voel.

SourceText: • Be kind to yourself and take a break when you need to!
text: • Wees jouself goedgesind en vat 'n blaaskans as jy dit nodig het!

text: Kind: "la la la la…."

SourceText: Teen: "la la la la…"
text: Tiener: "la la la la…"

text: Gestremde kind: "la la la la..."

SourceText: Parent: "It was so lovely to hear you singing while I was preparing dinner. Food is ready! Please tidy the room and put away the toys."
text: Ouer: "Dit was so lekker om julle te hoor sing toe ek aandete gemaak het. Kos is reg! Maak asseblief die kamer aan die kant en bêre die speelgoed."

SourceText: Parent: "Thank you for asking. Let's go together. You are so strong!"

SourceText: Hello! Today we are going to learn what we can do when our children are already misbehaving or have already misbehaved…
text: Hallo! Vandag gaan ons uitvind wat ons kan doen as ons kinders reeds ongehoorsaam is of was...

SourceText: Use consequences for refusing to follow instructions or forgetting household rules. Consequences help teach our children responsibility for what they do. They also allow discipline that is controlled. This is more effective than hitting or shouting.
text: Gee keuses met gevolge as hulle weier om opdragte uit te voer of huisreëls vergeet. Met gevolge help ons om ons kinders verantwoordelikheid vir hulle dade te leer. Dit help ook om dissipline te beheer. Dit is meer doeltreffend as slaan of skree.

SourceText: Children and teens often act disrespectfully or like they only care about themselves. Growing up is a difficult time when they are learning about who they are and how they want to be in the world. Luckily, there are other ways to discipline your teen without using violence…and they work well!
text: Kinders en tieners tree dikwels onbeskof op of asof hulle net vir hulleself omgee. Grootword is 'n moeilike tyd wanneer hulle begin uitvind wie hulle is en hoe hulle in die wêreld wil wees. Gelukkig is daar ander maniere om jou tiener te dissiplineer sonder geweld..…en dit werk goed!

SourceText: Giving calm consequences help teach our children responsibility for what they do. They also allow discipline that is controlled. This is more effective than hitting or shouting.
text: Wanneer ons kalm die gevolge noem, help ons ons kinders om verantwoordelikheid vir hulle dade te leer. Dit help ook om dissipline te beheer. Dit is meer doeltreffend as slaan of skree.

SourceText: Here are 5 tips for using consequences:
text: Hier is 5 wenke vir keuses met gevolge:

SourceText: 1. Give a choice before consequence
text: 1. Gee 'n keuse voor die gevolg

SourceText: 2. Stay calm but be firm
text: 2. Bly kalm maar ferm

SourceText: 3. Be realistic and follow through
text: 3. Wees realisties en voer deur

SourceText: 4. Reconnect afterwards
text: 4. Reik uit na die tyd

SourceText: 5. Consequences for breaking rules
text: 5. Gevolge vir die oortreding van reëls

SourceText: To learn more about one of these tips, type "1" to "5". You can also type "N" to move on.
text: Om meer oor een van hierdie wenke uit te vind, tik "1" tot "5". Jy kan ook "N" tik en aanbeweeg.

SourceText: Consequences can also be used when your children forget a household rule, like going to bed at a certain hour or doing schoolwork before T.V.
text: Gevolge kan ook gegee word wanneer jou kind 'n huisreël vergeet, soos om op 'n sekere tyd bed toe te gaan of huiswerk voor TV-kyk te doen.

SourceText: 2. Try to stay calm but firm when giving the consequence.
text: 2. Probeer kalm maar ferm bly wanneer jy die gevolg gee.

SourceText: If you start yelling, it will just make things worse. Take a deep breath before you speak in a clear, calm, and firm voice.
text: As jy gaan begin skree, gaan dit dinge erger maak. Haal diep asem voor jy duidelik, kalm, maar ferm praat.

SourceText: Make sure you can follow through with the consequence. For example, taking away a teenager’s phone for a week is hard to enforce. Taking it away for one hour is more realistic.
text: Maak seker jy kan die gevolg deurvoer. Byvoorbeeld, om jou tiener se foon vir 'n week weg te neem, kan moeilik wees om af te dwing. Om dit vir een uur weg te neem, is meer realisties.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about using consequences:
text: Kies asseblief 'n ander nommer as jy meer wil uitvind oor hoe om gevolge toe te pas:

SourceText: Here is a comic that shows a parent giving their child a choice to follow the instruction or receive a consequence.
text: Hier is 'n strokiesprent oor 'n ouer wat 'n kind 'n keuse gee om die opdrag te gehoorsaam of 'n gevolg te dra.

SourceText: Parent: “In 5 minutes it will be time to give me back the phone and start your school work.”
text: Ouer: "Oor 5 minute moet jy die foon vir my teruggee en jou skoolwerk begin."

SourceText: Teen (distractedly): “Uh-huh…”
text: Tiener (afgetrokke): "Uh-huh…"

SourceText: Parent: “5 minutes is up. Please give me the phone.”
text: Ouer: "5 minute is verby. Gee asseblief die foon vir my."

SourceText: Teen: “No, I am not done. I just need to get to the next level.”
text: Tiener: "Nee, ek’s nie klaar nie. Ek moet net by die volgende rondte uitkom."

SourceText: Parent: “You have a choice, either you give me the phone now, or you cannot use it after dinner.”
text: Ouer: "Jy het 'n keuse, of jy gee my die foon, of jy mag dit nie na aandete gebruik nie."

SourceText: Teen (not happy but agreeing): “Fine.”
text: Tiener (nie gelukkig nie, maar stem in): "Fine."

SourceText: Parent: “Thank you for giving me the phone back, Carter. Now please do your school work. After that we can take a walk or play a game together.”
text: Ouer: "Dankie dat jy die foon vir my teruggee, Karl. Doen nou asseblief jou skoolwerk. Daarna kan ons bietjie gaan stap of saam iets speel."

SourceText: Well done! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! When your child is behaving badly, try responding in a calm way with a fair consequence. SourceText: Today's Tip is about how we can support our teens when they experience really difficult situations.
text: Vandag se Wenk gaan oor hoe ons ons tieners kan ondersteun wanneer hulle uiters moeilike situasies teëkom.

SourceText: When our children share difficult experiences with us, we may initially get angry because we are afraid for them. But that is when we need to stay calm, listen, and be open.
text: Wanneer ons kinders moeilike ervarings met ons deel, word ons dalk eers kwaad omdat ons namens hulle bang is. Maar dit is juis wanneer ons kalm moet bly, luister, en oop wees.

SourceText: Do you want some tips that can help you respond in a more supportive way?
text: Wil jy graag 'n paar wenke hê oor hoe om op 'n meer ondersteunende manier te reageer?

SourceText: Remember that you can also change the type of messages you receive for an older or younger child. Just select "Technical Support." Chat to you later @fields.user_name!
text: Onthou, jy kan ook die soort boodskappe wat jy ontvang verander vir 'n ouer of jonger kind. Kies net "Tegniese Steun". Ons praat later @fields.user_name!

SourceText: Remember that you can also change the type of messages you receive for an older or younger child. Just select "Technical Support." Chat to you later!
text: Onthou, jy kan ook die soort boodskappe wat jy ontvang verander vir 'n ouer of jonger kind. Kies net "Tegniese Steun". Ons praat later!

SourceText: When our children share something that is especially troubling, we need to remember to stay calm, listen, and be open.
text: Wanneer ons kinders vir ons iets vertel wat besonder kommerwekkend is, moet ons onthou om kalm te bly, te luister en oop te wees.

SourceText: Here's a video on how you can support your teen when they are experiencing difficult situations.
text: Hier is 'n video oor hoe jy jou tiener kan ondersteun wanneer hulle moeilike situasies teëkom.

SourceText: Here's an audio message on how you can support your teen when they are experiencing difficult situations.
text: Hier is 'n oudioboodskap oor hoe jy jou tiener kan ondersteun wanneer hulle moeilike situasies teëkom.

SourceText: Here are some things you can do when your teen shares something difficult with you:
text: Hier is 'n paar dinge wat jy kan doen wanneer jou tiener iets moeiliks met jou deel:

SourceText: • Take a deep breath before you respond.
text: • Haal diep asem voordat jy reageer.

SourceText: • Listen to what your child is saying. Notice how they are feeling.
text: • Luister na wat jou kind sê. Let op hoe hulle voel.

SourceText: • Notice how you feel. Ask yourself, "What does my child need right now?"
text: • Let op hoe jy voel. Vra jouself: "Wat het my kind nou nodig?"

SourceText: • Reassure your child that you are there for them.
text: • Stel jou kind gerus dat jy daar is vir hulle.

SourceText: • You can deal with the consequences later but right now your child needs you.
text: • Jy kan later die gevolge hanteer, maar op hierdie oomblik het jou kind jou nodig.

SourceText: • Discuss possible solutions or next steps to take action.
text: • Bespreek moontlike oplossings of plan van aksie.

SourceText: • Remind your child again that you love them and thank them for sharing with you.
text: • Herinner jou kind weer dat jy lief is vir hulle en bedank hulle dat hulle dit met jou gedeel het.

SourceText: We understand that this can be really difficult. Please type "Help" if you want any extra support or guidance.
text: Ons verstaan dat dit regtig moeilik kan wees. Tik asseblief "Help" as jy enige ekstra ondersteuning of leiding nodig het.

SourceText: Here is a comic that shows how you can support your child during a crisis.
text: Hier is 'n strokiesprent wat wys hoe jy jou kind in 'n krisis kan ondersteun.

SourceText: Parent: “What’s wrong, my dear? Come and sit by me and tell me what happened.”
text: Ouer: "Wat’s fout, my kind? Kom sit hier en vertel my wat gebeur het."

SourceText: Child: “It’s that person…they touched me…”
text: Kind: "Dis daardie persoon...hulle het aan my gevat..."

SourceText: Parent: “Take your time... I am listening.”
text: Ouer: "Vat jou tyd... Ek luister."

SourceText: Child: “… they held me down…told me I would be in trouble if I told anybody…”
text: Kind: "... hulle het my vasgedruk...gesê ek gaan in die moeilikheid kom as ek vir enigiemand sê..."

SourceText: Parent: “I believe you. You are not in trouble. It is not your fault. This is a big thing and we will find a way to get the help you need. I wonder where we can go for help…?”
text: Ouer: "Ek glo jou. Jy is nie in die moeilikheid nie. Dit is nie jou skuld nie. Dis 'n groot ding hierdie en ons sal op 'n manier die hulp kry wat jy nodig het. Ek wonder waarheen ons kan gaan vir hulp...?"

SourceText: Child: “The clinic? But could you come with me?”
text: Kind: "Die kliniek? Maar sal jy saam met my kom?"

SourceText: Parent: “Yes, they will know what to do. Of course, I will come with you. Remember, this is not your fault. I love you and we will get through this.”
text: Ouer: "Ja, hulle sal weet wat om te doen. Natuurlik sal ek saam met jou gaan. Onthou, dis nie jou skuld nie. Ek is lief vir jou en ons sal hierdeur kom."

SourceText: Child: “Thanks so much.”
text: Kind: "Baie dankie."

SourceText: Remember you can always type "Help" if you ever want more parenting tips or support.
text: Onthou, jy kan altyd "Help" tik as jy ooit meer ouerskapwenke of ondersteuning wil hê.

SourceText: Well done @fields.user_name! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Try following these steps whenever your child shares something difficult. Supporting your child through a crisis will also teach them how to support others in difficult times. Good for you!
text: Mooi so @fields.user_name! Jy het nog 'n vaardigheid by jou Ouerskap-gereedskapkis gevoeg! Probeer hierdie stappe wanneer jou kind iets moeiliks vir jou vertel. Jou ondersteuning aan jou kind in 'n krisis sal hulle ook leer hoe om ander in moeilike tye by te staan. Mooi so!

SourceText: When we are able to have peaceful and loving relationships, our children feel more secure and loved. Kindness and taking care of yourself help.
text: Wanneer ons vreedsame en liefdevolle verhoudings kan handhaaf, voel ons kinders meer veilig en gelief. Dit help om vriendelik te wees en om te gee vir jouself.

SourceText: Here's a video to help you support positive family relationships at home.
text: Hier is 'n video om jou te help om positiewe gesinsverhoudinge by die huis te bevorder.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you support positive family relationships at home.
text: Hier is 'n oudioboodskap om jou te help om positiewe gesinsverhoudinge by die huis te bevorder.

SourceText: Here are 6 simple steps that you can do to support family harmony at home:
text: Hier is 6 eenvoudige stappe wat jy kan volg om gesinsharmonie by die huis te bevorder:

SourceText: 1. Be a model of behaviour for your kids
text: 1. Stel 'n voorbeeld van gedrag vir jou kinders

SourceText: 2. Keep it positive
text: 2. Hou dinge positief

SourceText: 3. Listen carefully to others
text: 3. Luister aandagtig na ander

SourceText: 4. Share the load
text: 4. Deel die lading

SourceText: 5. Take care of yourself
text: 5. Pas jouself op

SourceText: 6. Do nice things together as a family.
text: 6. Doen lekker dinge saam as gesin.

SourceText: Type "1" to 6" to learn more about these tips. Type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Tik "1" tot "6" om meer oor hierdie wenke uit te vind. Tik "N" om hierdie wenk te stop.

SourceText: Step 4. Share the load
text: Stap 4. Deel die lading

SourceText: Looking after children and other family members is difficult, but it’s much easier when responsibilities are shared. Try to share household chores, childcare, and other tasks equally amongst family members
text: Dis moeilik om na kinders en ander gesinslede om te sien, maar dis makliker wanneer verantwoordelikhede gedeel word. Probeer om huistake, kindersorg en ander take gelyk tussen gesinslede te verdeel

SourceText: Step 5. Take care of yourself
text: Stap 5. Pas jouself op

SourceText: Create a schedule for time “on” and time “off” with other adults in your household. It is okay to ask for help when you are feeling tired or stressed so that you can take a break
text: Stel 'n skedule op vir tyd "aan" en tyd "af" met ander volwassenes in jou huishouding. Dit is oukei om hulp te vra wanneer jy moeg of gestres voel sodat jy 'n blaaskans kan vat.

SourceText: Step 6. Do nice things together as a family
text: Stap 6. Doen lekker dinge saam as 'n gesin

SourceText: Let each family member take turns choosing a whole family activity. Find ways to spend time alone with other adults in your home, too!
text: Gee elke gesinslid 'n beurt om 'n hele gesinsaktiwiteit te kies. Vind maniere om ook tyd alleen saam met ander volwassenes in jou huis te spandeer!

SourceText: Step 1. Be a model of behaviour for your kids
text: Stap 1. Stel 'n voorbeeld van gedrag vir jou kinders

SourceText: How we talk and behave in front of our children is a big influence on how they behave too! Try to talk kindly to everyone in the family, adults and children.
text: Hoe ons praat en optree voor ons kinders het 'n groot invloed op hulle eie gedrag! Probeer om vriendelik te praat met almal in die gesin, volwassenes en kinders.

SourceText: Step 2. Use positive language. It works!
text: Stap 2. Gebruik positiewe taal. Dit werk!

SourceText: Tell others what you want them to do instead of what you don’t want them to do: Instead of “Stop shouting,” try “Please speak more quietly”
text: Sê vir ander wat jy wil hê hulle moet doen, eerder as om te sê wat jy nie wil hê hulle moet doen nie: In plaas van "Hou op skree", sê dalk eerder "Praat asseblief bietjie sagter"

SourceText: Decide to take a break from arguing when you see arguments building up, and go into another room or outside if you can.
text: Besluit om 'n blaaskans te vat as jy sien argumente bou op, en gaan na 'n ander kamer of buitentoe as jy kan.

SourceText: You can always type "Help" if you need an activity to help you with stress.
text: Jy kan altyd "Help" tik as jy 'n aktiwiteit nodig het om jou met stres te help.

SourceText: Praise others to make them feel appreciated and good about themselves. Simple words like, “Thank you for clearing the dinner,” or “Thank you for watching the baby” can make a big difference
text: Prys ander – dit sal hulle gewaardeer laat voel, én goed oor hulleself. Eenvoudige woorde soos "Dankie dat jy die tafel afgedek het", of "Dankie dat jy na die baba gekyk het" kan 'n groot verskil maak

SourceText: Bad communication between adults in the household can have a negative impact on our children. The more we practice modeling peaceful, loving relationships for our children, the more secure and loved they will feel.
text: Swak kommunikasie tussen volwassenes in die huis kan 'n negatiewe impak op ons kinders hê. Hoe meer ons oefen om 'n voorbeeld van vreedsame, liefdevolle verhoudings vir ons kinders te stel, hoe veiliger en meer gelief gaan hulle voel.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to support family harmony at home:
text: Kies asseblief 'n ander nommer as jy meer wil weet oor hoe om gesinsharmonie in die huis te bevorder:

SourceText: Step 3. Be a great listener
text: Stap 3. Wees 'n goeie luisteraar

SourceText: Listen to others when they are talking with you. Be open and show them that you hear what they are saying. It can help to summarise what you have heard before responding: “What I hear you saying is…”
text: Luister na ander wanneer hulle met jou praat. Wees oop en wys vir hulle dat jy hoor wat hulle sê. Dit help om op te som wat jy gehoor het voor jy reageer: "Wat ek jou hoor sê, is dat..."

SourceText: Well done for adding another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Over the next few days, try taking a deep breath or walking away for a bit when you start getting angry at someone. Every time you find a way to resolve conflicts in a peaceful way, you increase your child's brain development. Be proud of yourself when you do it!
text: Jy het nog 'n vaardigheid by jou Ouerskap-gereedskapkis gevoeg het, wel gedaan! Probeer om oor die volgende paar dae diep asem te haal of eers 'n bietjie weg te stap wanneer jy kwaad begin raak vir iemand. Elke keer as jy 'n manier vind om konflik vreedsaam op te los, verhoog jy jou kind se breinontwikkeling. Wees trots op jouself wanneer jy dit doen!

SourceText: Here are some tips that might help when your baby cries:
text: Hier is 'n paar wenke wat kan help wanneer jou baba huil:

SourceText: 1. Why babies cry
text: 1. Wanneer babas huil

SourceText: 2. Respond as soon as you can
text: 2. Reageer so gou as wat jy kan

SourceText: 3. Check to see why your baby is crying
text: 3. Kyk of jy kan sien waarom jou baba huil

SourceText: 4. Comfort your baby
text: 4. Troos jou baba

SourceText: 5. Take a break if you need it
text: 5. Vat 'n blaaskans as jy dit nodig het

SourceText: 6. Be gentle and patient with yourself
text: 6. Wees sag en geduldig met jouself

SourceText: 7. If you think your baby is injured or sick, call or visit a clinic
text: 7. As jy dink jou baba is beseer of siek, bel of besoek 'n kliniek

SourceText: To learn more about one of these, type "1" to "7". You can also type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Om meer oor een van hierdie wenke uit te vind, tik "1" tot "7". Jy kan ook "N" tik om hierdie wenk te stop.

SourceText: If your baby cries for a long time and does not stop, they might be injured or sick. You should seek medical help immediately.
text: As jou baba vir 'n lang ruk huil en nie ophou nie, is hulle dalk beseer of siek. Jy moet dadelik mediese hulp soek.

SourceText: Go to your baby when you hear them crying. You will not spoil your baby by picking them up. Babies who are carried and cuddled frequently, during both fussy and contented periods, may actually cry less.
text: Gaan na jou baba wanneer jy hulle hoor huil. Jy bederf nie jou baba deur hulle op te tel nie. Babas wat baie opgetel en gekoester word, of hulle nou kerm of tevrede is, kan in werklikheid minder huil.

SourceText: 1. Why do babies cry?
text: 1. Waarom huil babas?

SourceText: Crying is a normal part of your baby's development. Sometimes babies even have crying patterns. Crying usually increases at 2-3 weeks old and is generally highest when your baby is around 6 to 8 weeks. Often babies will start crying less around 3 to 4 months. Of course, remember that every baby is different!
text: Huil is 'n normale deel van jou baba se ontwikkeling. Soms het babas selfs huilpatrone. Babas begin gewoonlik meer huil as hulle 2-3 weke oud is – die ergste is gewoonlik op omtrent 6 tot 8 weke. Babas begin dikwels minder huil rondom 3 tot 4 maande. Maar onthou, elke baba is anders!

SourceText: 3.  Check to see why your baby is crying
text: 3.  Kyk of jy kan sien waarom jou baba huil

SourceText: There are lots of reasons why babies cry. It might be hunger, pain, too much going on, rough handling, feeling cold/hot, wanting contact or attention, or feeling irritable. Babies can cry when they sense tension in the room. And sometimes they cry for no reason at all!
text: Daar is baie redes waarom babas huil. Dis dalk hongerte, pyn, of rowwe hantering. Dalk kry hulle warm/koud of voel knieserig. Dis dalk te bedrywig, of hulle wil aanraking of aandag hê. Babas kan huil wanneer hulle spanning in die kamer aanvoel. En soms huil hulle vir geen rede nie!

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about what to do when your baby is crying:
text: Kies asseblief 'n ander nommer as jy meer wil uitvind oor wat om te doen wanneer jou baba huil:

SourceText: Here is a comic on coping with a colicky baby
text: Hier is 'n strokiesprent oor hoe om 'n koliekbaba te hanteer:

SourceText: Parent 1: "We should do something."
text: Ouer 1: "Ons moet iets doen."

SourceText: Parent 2: "Okay, I'll try feeding them."
text: Ouer 2: "Oukei, ek sal hulle probeer kosgee."

SourceText: Baby: "aaaaaaaa"
text: Baba: "aaaaaaaa"

SourceText: Parent 1:  "What is wrong with them?"
text: Ouer 1:  "Wat’s fout met hulle?"

SourceText: Parent 2: "I don't know. It has been an hour and they are still crying. I cannot take it anymore. They are driving me crazy, I just want to shake them!"
text: Ouer 2: "Ek weet nie. Die huilery gaan nou al vir 'n uur aan. Ek kan dit nie meer vat nie. Dit maak my gek, ek wil hulle sommer skud!"

SourceText: Parent 2: "I can see that this has been a stressful night for you. How about you get some sleep while I take Frankie into the other room. I will try wrapping them up in a blanket."
text: Ouer 2: "Ek kan sien dis 'n stresvolle nag vir jou. Hoekom gaan slaap jy nie bietjie nie terwyl ek Fransi na die ander kamer toe vat. Ek gaan hulle in 'n kombersie probeer toedraai."

SourceText: Parent 1: "Thank you. I was getting so angry at myself."
text: Ouer 1: "Dankie. Ek het so kwaad geword vir myself."

SourceText: Parent 1: "How did you manage to get them to sleep?"
text: Ouer 1: "Hoe het jy dit reggekry om te slaap?"

SourceText: Parent 2: "I think they wore themselves out but we should take them to the clinic tomorrow morning."
text: Ouer 2: "Ek dink hulle het hulself uitgewoed, maar ons moet hulle dalk môreoggend kliniek toe vat."

SourceText: Call someone for help - a family member, a friend. Sometimes just talking with someone is enough, but if you feel overwhelmed, ask someone for help. Calling for help is a sign of strength.
text: Bel iemand om hulp – 'n gesins- of familielid, 'n vriend. Soms is dit genoeg om net met iemand te praat, maar as jy oorweldig voel, vra iemand om hulp. Om hulp te vra, is 'n teken van innerlike krag.

SourceText: Here's a video that might help you when @fields.child_nickname cries.
text: Hier is 'n video wat jou kan help wanneer @fields.child_nickname huil.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you when your baby cries.

SourceText: 5. Take a break!
text: 5. Vat 'n blaaskans!

SourceText: If you are getting angry because @fields.child_nickname won’t stop crying, it’s OK to leave them on their back in a safe place and walk away for a bit. Check on @fields.child_nickname every 5-10 minutes.
text: As jy begin kwaad word omdat @fields.child_nickname nie wil ophou huil nie, is dit OK om hulle 'n bietjie op hulle rug te los op 'n veilige plek en weg te stap vir 'n oomblik. Gaan loer elke 5-10 minute by @fields.child_nickname in.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: If you are getting angry because your baby won’t stop crying, it’s OK to leave them on their back in a safe place and walk away for a bit. Check on your baby every 5-10 minutes.
text: As jy begin kwaad word omdat jou baba nie wil ophou huil nie, is dit OK om hulle 'n bietjie op hulle rug te los op 'n veilige plek en weg te stap vir 'n oomblik. Gaan loer elke 5-10 minute by jou baba in.

SourceText: We know that this is not easy. You are not a bad father if your baby continues to cry after you have done all you can to calm them. You are doing your best!
text: Ons weet dit is nie maklik nie. Jy is nie 'n slegte pa as jou baba aanhou huil nadat jy alles in jou vermoë gedoen het om hulle te kalmeer nie. Jy doen jou bes!

SourceText: Try swaddling, gently rocking, or singing or soft music. You might need to feed @fields.child_nickname or change their diaper. They may be too hot or too cold. Or maybe they just need to be held. Take a Pause and try to relax - @fields.child_nickname can actually sense tension from you, too!
text: Probeer jou baba toewikkel, saggies wieg, of vir hulle sing of sagte musiek speel. Dalk moet jy @fields.child_nickname voed of hulle doek omruil. Dalk kry hulle te warm of te koud. Of dalk wil hulle net vasgehou word. Vat 'n Blaaskans en probeer ontspan – @fields.child_nickname kan in werklikheid jou spanning aanvoel!

SourceText: Try swaddling, gently rocking, or singing or soft music. You might need to feed your baby or change their diaper. They may be too hot or too cold. Or maybe they just need to be held. Take a Pause and try to relax - your baby can actually sense tension from you, too!
text: Probeer jou baba toewikkel, saggies wieg, of vir hulle sing of sagte musiek speel. Dalk moet jy jou baba voed of hulle doek omruil. Dalk kry hulle te warm of te koud. Of dalk wil hulle net vasgehou word. Vat 'n blaaskans en probeer ontspan – jou baba kan in werklikheid jou spanning aanvoel!

SourceText: Today's Tip is about how we can support our children when they are feeling sad, scared, angry, and confused.
text: Vandag se Wenk gaan oor hoe ons ons kinders kan ondersteun wanneer hulle hartseer, bang, kwaad of deurmekaar voel.

SourceText: Remember that you can also change the type of messages you receive for an older or younger child. Just select "Tech Support". Chat to you later @fields.user_name!

SourceText: Remember that you can also change the type of messages you receive for an older or younger child. Just select "Tech Support". Chat to you later!
text: Onthou, jy kan ook die soort boodskappe wat jy ontvang verander vir 'n ouer of jonger kind. Kies net "Tegniese Steun". Ons praat later!

SourceText: Be open to your children. They get stressed too - sometimes from different things from you. Allow them to express how they feel and accept their feelings. Try to listen to them and think about how it must feel for them.
text: Wees oop teenoor jou kinders. Hulle raak ook gestres – soms vir ander dinge as jy. Gee hulle kans om uit te druk hoe hulle voel en aanvaar hulle gevoelens. Probeer om na hulle te luister en dink oor hoe dit vir hulle moet voel.

SourceText: Here are some tips for how we can help our children learn how to cope with their emotions:
text: Hier is 'n paar wenke vir hoe ons ons kinders kan help om hulle emosies te hanteer:

SourceText: 1. Be open to your child
text: 1. Wees oop teenoor jou kind

SourceText: 2. Share your own feelings
text: 2. Deel jou eie gevoelens

SourceText: 3. Help your child learn how to talk about feelings
text: 3. Help jou kind leer hoe om oor gevoelens te praat

SourceText: 4. Talking about difficult emotions
text: 4. Praat oor moeilike emosies

SourceText: 5. Notice the positive emotions
text: 5. Let op na die positiewe emosies

SourceText: 6. Show your child that you care
text: 6. Wys vir jou kind dat jy omgee

SourceText: To learn more about one of these, type "1" to "6". You can also type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Om meer oor een van hierdie wenke uit te vind, tik "1" tot "6". Jy kan ook "N" tik om hierdie wenk te stop.

SourceText: Your child will look to you for support and reassurance. Listen to your children when they share how they are feeling. Accept how they feel and give them comfort.
text: Jou kind gaan ondersteuning en gerusstelling by jou soek. Luister na jou kinders wanneer hulle hul gevoelens deel. Aanvaar hoe hulle voel en stel hulle gerus.

SourceText: When you share your own feelings with your children, you help them recognise their own feelings. It can also help your children learn self-discipline and to understand their own feelings.
text: Wanneer jy jou eie gevoelens met jou kinders deel, help hulle om hul eie gevoelens te herken. Dit kan jou kinders ook selfdissipline leer en om hulle eie gevoelens te verstaan.

SourceText: There are 6 basic emotions: Happy, Sad, Angry, Disgusted, Surprised, and Afraid. Even babies can feel and express these emotions. As children get older, they learn to identify lots of other emotions, like excited, frustrated, proud, lonely, peaceful, guilty, or confused.
text: Daar is 6 basiese emosies: geluk, hartseer, woede, afkeer, verrassing, en vrees. Selfs babas kan hierdie emosies voel en uitdruk. Namate kinders ouer word, leer hulle om baie ander emosies te eien soos opgewondenheid, frustrasie, trots, eensaamheid, kalmte, skuld, of verwarring.

SourceText: It is normal to have difficulty talking about and expressing emotions and feelings. Many of us were told not to cry when we were sad or laugh when we were happy. This may be especially the case for boys and men.
text: Dit is normaal om te sukkel om oor emosies en gevoelens te praat en dit uit te druk. Baie van ons is geleer om nie te huil as ons hartseer is nie, of om te lag wanneer ons bly is. Dit kan veral die geval wees vir seuns en mans.

SourceText: But we all have the same feelings, and  we can learn how to become aware of our own emotions, to experience them in our body, and to communicate about them.
text: Maar ons almal het dieselfde emosies, en ons kan leer hoe om van ons eie emosies bewus te word, om hulle in ons liggaam te ervaar, en daaroor te kommunikeer.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about talking about emotions:
text: Kies asseblief 'n ander nommer as jy meer wil weet oor hoe om oor emosies te praat:

SourceText: Talking about feelings can help children manage anger, disappointment, and frustration. It can also help @fields.child_nickname be more aware of positive emotions such as a sense of peace, happiness, or calmness. It can also allow children to appreciate a beautiful moment or feeling of love!
text: Om oor gevoelens te praat, kan kinders help om woede, teleurstelling en frustrasie te hanteer. Dit kan @fields.child_nickname ook help om meer bewus te word van positiewe emosies soos 'n gevoel van rustigheid, geluk of kalmte. Dit kan kinders ook geleentheid gee om 'n mooi oomblik of gevoel van liefde te waardeer!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Talking about feelings can help children manage anger, disappointment, and frustration. It can also help your child be more aware of positive emotions such as a sense of peace, happiness, or calmness. It can also allow children to appreciate a beautiful moment or feeling of love!

SourceText: Use physical and verbal support to make @fields.child_nickname feel accepted and loved. A hug or saying, "I understand," can mean a lot. Remind @fields.child_nickname that you are there for them and that they can always talk to you.
text: Gebruik fisiese en verbale ondersteuning om @fields.child_nickname aanvaarding en liefde te laat voel. 'n Drukkie of die woorde "Ek verstaan" kan baie beteken. Herinner @fields.child_nickname dat jy daar is vir hulle en dat hulle altyd met jou kan praat.

SourceText: Here is a comic that shows how you can give @fields.child_nickname love and support when they share difficult emotions with you…
text: Hier is 'n strokiesprent wat wys hoe jy @fields.child_nickname liefde en ondersteuning kan gee wanneer hulle moeilike emosies met jou deel...
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Parent: “How are you doing, Andy?”
text: Ouer: "Hoe gaan dit, André?"

SourceText: Teen (looking sad): “I wish I could hang out with my friends.”
text: Tiener (lyk hartseer): "Ek wens ek kon by my vriende wees."

SourceText: Parent (thinking): "Hmmm…that can wait…"
text: Ouer (dink): "Hmmm...dit kan wag..."

SourceText: Parent (looks back to teen):“I understand it is hard to be separate from your friends. Especially since I am sure they are missing you, too. Let’s think of some ways that you could reach out to them.”
text: Ouer (kyk terug na tiener): "Ek verstaan dit is vir jou moeilik om weg te wees van jou vriende. Veral omdat ek seker is hulle mis jou ook. Kom ons dink bietjie hoe jy met hulle kan kontak maak."

SourceText: Teen: "Maybe I can make a TikTok video to share with them. But I am not sure how…can you help me?”
text: Tiener: "Dalk kan ek 'n TikTok-video maak en vir hulle stuur. Maar ek weet nie hoe nie...kan jy my help?"

SourceText: Parent: “I would be happy to help and would like to know more about TikTok, too!”
text: Ouer: "Ek help graag, en wil ook meer weet van TikTok!"

SourceText: Here is a comic that shows how you can give your teen love and support when they share difficult emotions with you…
text: Hier is 'n strokiesprent wat wys hoe jy jou tiener liefde en ondersteuning kan gee wanneer hulle moeilike emosies met jou deel...

SourceText: Child: “Why can’t I go play with my friends today?”
text: Kind: "Hoekom kan ek nie vandag met my maats gaan speel nie?"

SourceText: Parent: “I can see that you are upset, Sam. It can be difficult when we feel separated from our friends.”
text: Ouer: "Ek kan sien jy is ontsteld, Sam. Dit kan moeilik wees wanneer ons afgesonder van ons maats voel."

SourceText: Parent: “We are not allowed to visit other people right now because of COVID-19.
text: Ouer: "Ons mag nie nou by ander mense gaan kuier nie, weens COVID-19.

SourceText: This will keep them and us safe while making sure our health services are able to support those who are sick."
text: Dit hou ons en hulle veilig, en dit help dat die dokters en gesondheidswerkers almal kan help wat siek is."

SourceText: Parent: “As soon as we are able, you can play with your friends. In the meantime, we can draw some pictures of your favourite times playing with them.”
text: Ouer: "Sodra ons weer mag, kan jy weer met jou maats speel. Kom ons teken solank prentjies van die kere wat jy die lekkerste met hulle gespeel het."

SourceText: Child: “Okay!”
text: Kind: "Oukei!"

SourceText: Here is a comic that shows how you can give your child love and support when they share difficult emotions with you…
text: Hier is 'n strokiesprent wat wys hoe jy jou kind liefde en ondersteuning kan gee wanneer hulle moeilike emosies met jou deel...

SourceText: Here are 6 steps on how we can reduce negative attention seeking and demanding behaviours like tantrums using what we call Ignore:
text: Hier is 6 stappe om negatiewe aandagsoekende en veeleisende gedrag soos uitbarstings te verminder met behulp van Ignoreer:

SourceText: 1. Try to redirect your child’s attention
text: 1. Probeer jou kind se aandag aflei

SourceText: 2. Make sure it is a behaviour you can ignore
text: 2. Maak seker dit is gedrag wat jy wel kan ignoreer

SourceText: 3. Ignore the behaviour not your child
text: 3. Ignoreer die gedrag, nie jou kind nie

SourceText: 4. Praise your child immediately for the next positive behaviour
text: 4. Prys jou kind onmiddellik vir die volgende positiewe gedrag wat hulle toon

SourceText: 5. Be consistent when ignoring
text: 5. Wees konsekwent wanneer jy ignoreer

SourceText: 6. Make sure you are giving your child plenty of positive attention at other times.
text: 6. Maak seker jy gee jou kind baie positiewe aandag op ander tye.

SourceText: To learn more about one of these tips, type "1" to "6". You can also type "N" to move on.
text: Om meer oor een van hierdie wenke uit te vind, tik "1" tot "6". Jy kan ook "N" tik en aanbeweeg.

SourceText: Here is a comic on combining consequences and ignore.
text: Hier is 'n strokiesprent oor hoe om gevolge en ignoreer te kombineer.

SourceText: Parent 1: "Bailey, please clear the dishes after dinner"
text: Ouer 1: "Bennie, dek asseblief die tafel af na ete"

SourceText: Parent 2: "Sam, time to get ready for bed. Come with me."
text: Ouer 2: "Sam, dis slapenstyd. Kom saam met my."

SourceText: Parent: "The household rule is that you have to help clean up after dinner before you can play with your toys."
text: Ouer: "Die huis se reël is dat jy help afdek na ete voor jy met jou speelgoed kan speel."

SourceText: Child: "I don't want to clear the dishes. I want to play with my new toy car. "
text: Kind: "Ek wil nie die tafel afdek nie. Ek wil met my nuwe karretjie speel."

SourceText: Parent 1: "Bailey, either you clear the table now, or you will not be able to play with your toys later tonight"
text: Ouer 1: "Bennie, of jy dek die tafel nou af, of jy mag nie later vanaand met jou speelgoed speel nie"

SourceText: Child: "But it is not fair! Sam doesn't have to clean up after dinner!"
text: Kind: "Dis nie reg nie! Sam hoef nie af te dek na ete nie!"

SourceText: Parent 1: "Because you did not listen, you cannot play with your toys. Please get ready for bed.
text: Ouer 1: "Omdat jy nie geluister het nie, kan jy nie met jou speelgoed speel nie. Kom trek asseblief jou nagklere aan.

SourceText: Child: "But that is not fair!"
text: Kind: "Maar dis nie reg nie!"

SourceText: Child: "But that is not fair. Waaaah!"
text: Kind: "Maar dis nie reg nie." Waaaah!"

SourceText: Parent 1: "It is so nice to see that you got ready for bed all by yourself!"
text: Ouer 1: "Ek’s bly om te sien jy het self jou nagklere aangetrek!"

SourceText: Child: "Now can I play with my toy car?"
text: Kind: "Kan ek nou met my karretjie speel?"

SourceText: Parent 1: "You can play with your car tomorrow. It is bedtime. Come, my sweetie, I will tell your favourite bedtime story."
text: Ouer 1: "Jy kan môre met jou karretjie speel. Dis slaaptyd. Kom, my liefie, ek lees vir jou jou gunsteling-slaaptydstorie."

SourceText: Parent 1: "Once upon a time..."
text: Ouer 1: "Eendag was daar..."

SourceText: 1. Try to redirect your child's attention
text: 1. Probeer jou kind se aandag aflei

SourceText: When they start demanding for something or whining, first try to redirect them to a positive behaviour or activity. Praise them for that positive behaviour!
text: Wanneer hulle op iets begin aandring of begin kerm, probeer eers om hulle aandag na 'n positiewe aktiwiteit of gedrag af te lei. Prys hulle vir die positiewe gedrag!

SourceText: These are behaviours like whining, demanding, showing off, tantrums, and lots of other negative attention seeking and demanding behaviours that might make us think of the child as a bad child. But there are no bad children, only difficult behaviours!
text: Dit is gedrag soos 'n gekerm, aandring op iets, vertonerigheid, uitbarstings, en ander negatiewe aandagsoekende en veeleisende gedrag wat dalk maak dat ons dink dis 'n slegte kind. Maar daar is geen slegte kind nie, net moeilike gedrag!

SourceText: When you ignore your child's behaviour (but not your child!), your child learns that the demanding behaviour will not work.
text: Wanneer jy jou kind se gedrag (maar nie die kind nie) ignoreer, gaan jou kind leer dat die veeleisende gedrag nie werk nie.

SourceText: If we respond to these behaviours, our children learn that this behaviour will get them attention. They sometimes also learn that if they increase the demand, they will get their way.
text: As ons op hierdie soort gedrag reageer, leer ons kinders dat hierdie gedrag aandag sal kry. Hulle leer ook soms dat, as hulle harder op iets aandring, hulle hul sin gaan kry.

SourceText: This takes time AND patience. Normally your child will try to test you and behave worse. This is a good time to Take a Pause and Keep Calm.
text: Dit verg tyd EN geduld. Gewoonlik sal jou kind jou toets en erger te kere gaan. Dit is 'n goeie tyd om 'n Blaaskans te Vat en Kalm te Bly.

SourceText: 6. Make sure you are giving your child plenty of positive attention at other times
text: 6. Maak seker jy gee jou kind baie positiewe aandag op ander tye

SourceText: Children need attention. If children get plenty of attention for just being themselves, as well as for the “good” things that they do, it helps them to feel good about themselves, and they do more of what they are asked.
text: Kinders het aandag nodig. As kinders baie aandag kry wanneer hulle net hulleself is, asook wanneer hulle "goeie" dinge doen, help dit hulle om goed te voel oor hulleself – dan doen hulle meer van dit wat ons van hulle vra.

SourceText: Your child's behaviour might continue to get worse.  It is important that you continue to ignore the behaviour.
text: Jou kind se gedrag kan dalk erger word.  Dit is belangrik dat jy aanhou om die gedrag te ignoreer.

SourceText: Often, your child's response will grow more agitated when you start ignoring a specific behaviour as your child tries to test your resolve.
text: Dikwels reageer jou kind hewiger wanneer jy 'n spesifieke gedrag ignoreer omdat hulle probeer kyk of jy gaan ingee.

SourceText: If you find yourself ignoring your child's behaviour a lot, it is either because you are not being consistent (sometimes ignoring and sometimes giving in) OR you are not spending enough positive time with your child. One-on-One Time is super important!
text: As jy agterkom dat jy jou kind se gedrag baie keer ignoreer, is dit of omdat jy nie konsekwent is nie (soms ignoreer jy, soms gee jy in) OF jy spandeer nie genoeg positiewe tyd met jou kind nie. Een-tot-Een-Tyd is verskriklik belangrik!

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to use ignore to reduce tantrums or other difficult behaviours:
text: Kies asseblief 'n ander nommer as jy meer wil uitvind oor hoe Ignoreer kan help om uitbarstings of ander moeilike gedrag te verminder:

SourceText: Ignore negative attention seeking and demanding behaviours like whining or tantrums. Your @fields.child_nickname’s behaviour might at first get worse, but with time they will learn that it does not work. Be consistent and patient. And make sure that you are also giving @fields.child_nickname plenty of positive attention at other times. You can do it!
text: Ignoreer negatiewe aandagsoekende en veeleisende gedrag soos 'n gekerm of uitbarstings. Jou @fields.child_nickname se gedrag kan aan die begin erger raak, maar mettertyd sal hulle agterkom dit werk nie. Wees konsekwent en geduldig. En maak seker jy gee @fields.child_nickname ook baie positiewe aandag op ander tye. Jy kan dit doen!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

Wees konsekwent en geduldig. En maak seker jy gee jou kind ook baie positiewe aandag op ander kere. Jy kan dit doen!

SourceText: 3. Ignore the behaviour not your child.
text: 3. Ignoreer die gedrag, nie die kind nie.

SourceText: Ignoring behaviour means removing physical and verbal attention. You should still be aware of what @fields.child_nickname is doing.
text: Om gedrag te ignoreer, beteken om fisiese en verbale aandag weg te neem. Jy moet steeds bewus wees van wat @fields.child_nickname doen.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Ignoring behaviour means removing physical and verbal attention. You should still be aware of what your child is doing.
text: Om gedrag te ignoreer, beteken om fisiese en verbale aandag weg te neem. Jy moet steeds bewus wees van wat jou kind doen.

SourceText: For example, if @fields.child_nickname whines for sweets at the store, you might initially say “no” but then give in to @fields.child_nickname when they start to have a tantrum. This happens to all of us!
text: Byvoorbeeld, as @fields.child_nickname in die winkel kerm vir lekkergoed, sê jy dalk aan die begin "nee", maar gee dan in wanneer @fields.child_nickname 'n uitbarsting het. Dit gebeur met ons almal!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: For example, if your child whines for sweets at the store, you might initially say “no” but then give in to your child when they start to have a tantrum. This happens to all of us!
text: Byvoorbeeld, as jou kind in die winkel kerm vir lekkergoed, sê jy dalk aan die begin "nee", maar gee dan in wanneer jou kind 'n uitbarsting het. Dit gebeur met ons almal!

SourceText: Having a tantrum can be just as traumatic and difficult for your child as it is for you. Make sure you give @fields.child_nickname plenty of positive attention and love as soon as they have calmed down.
text: 'n Uitbarsting kan net so traumaties en moeilik vir jou kind wees as vir jou. Maak seker jy gee @fields.child_nickname baie positiewe aandag en liefde sodra hulle gekalmeer het.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Having a tantrum can be just as traumatic and difficult for your child as it is for you. Make sure you give your child plenty of positive attention and love as soon as they have calmed down.
text: 'n Uitbarsting kan net so traumaties en moeilik vir jou kind wees as vir jou. Maak seker jy gee jou kind baie positiewe aandag en liefde sodra hulle gekalmeer het.

SourceText: At this time, it is more important that you involve @fields.child_nickname in a positive activity instead of talking about what just happened. You can do that later like at night or the next day. Right now @fields.child_nickname needs love.
text: Op hierdie tydstip is dit belangriker dat jy @fields.child_nickname in 'n positiewe aktiwiteit besig kry eerder as om te praat oor wat pas gebeur het. Jy kan dit later doen, soos in die aand of die volgende dag. Op hierdie oomblik het @fields.child_nickname liefde nodig.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Today's Parenting Tip is all about Praise. How did the above message make you feel? We all appreciate it when the good things we do are recognised by others, especially when it is someone who is close to us.
text: Vandag se Ouerskapwenk gaan oor Lof. Hoe het die vorige boodskap jou laat voel? Ons almal waardeer dit wanneer ander mense die goeie dinge wat ons doen, raaksien, veral as dit iemand naby aan ons is.

SourceText: Praise your children when they are behaving well! They may not show it but you’ll see them doing that good behaviour again…
text: Prys jou kinders vir goeie gedrag! Hulle wys dit dalk nie, maar jy sal sien dat hulle die goeie gedrag herhaal...

SourceText: Hi @fields.user_name! I just wanted to thank you for making this commitment to improve the life of your children. It shows you really care!
text: Hi @fields.user_name! Ek wil net vir jou dankie sê vir jou toegewydheid om jou kinders se lewe te verbeter. Dit wys jy gee regtig om!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Hi! I just wanted to thank you for making this commitment to improve the life of your children. It shows you really care!
text: Hi! Ek wil net vir jou dankie sê vir jou toegewydheid om jou kinders se lewe te verbeter. Dit wys jy gee regtig om!

SourceText: Keep it positive! Make sure your children get lots of praise when they are behaving well. This will make them want to behave that way more often.
text: Hou dit positief! Maak seker jou kinders kry baie lof vir goeie gedrag. Dit sal maak dit hulle meer dikwels so wil optree.

SourceText: We all appreciate it when the good things we do are recognised by others, especially when it is someone who is close to us.
text: Ons almal waardeer dit wanneer ander mense die goeie dinge wat ons doen, raaksien, veral as dit iemand naby aan ons is.

SourceText: Praise works for our children, too. When you bring more attention to positive behaviour, they are likely to do it more often. They also will feel good about themselves!
text: Lof werk ook vir ons kinders. As jy positiewe gedrag meer beklemtoon, sal hulle meer geneig wees om dit meer dikwels te doen. Hulle sal ook goed voel oor hulleself!

SourceText: Here are 3 simple steps to get it right:
text: Hier is 3 eenvoudige stappe om dit reg te kry:

SourceText: 1. Be positive
text: 1. Wees positief

SourceText: 2. Be specific
text: 2. Wees spesifiek

SourceText: 3. Be enthusiastic
text: 3. Wees entoesiasties

SourceText: To learn more about one of these steps, type "1" to "3". You can also type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Om meer oor een van hierdie stappe uit te vind, tik "1" tot "3". Jy kan ook "N" tik om hierdie wenk te stop.

SourceText: Step 3. Be enthusiastic
text: Stap 3. Wees entoesiasties

SourceText: Really mean it when you say it! The more real you are the better it will feel.
text: Bedoel dit opreg wanneer jy dit sê! Hoe meer opreg jy is, hoe beter sal dit voel.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about praise:

SourceText: Parent: “Thank you for being quiet while I talked to my boss. I appreciate it! Here, you can use my phone to WhatsApp your friends”
text: Ouer: "Dankie dat jy stil was toe ek met my baas gepraat het. Ek waardeer dit! Hier, jy kan my foon gebruik om jou maats te WhatsApp"

SourceText: Teen: “Thanks! I really want to see how they are doing.”
text: Tiener: "Dankie! Ek wil graag sien hoe dit met hulle gaan."

SourceText: Silence
text: Stilte

SourceText: Parent: “Thank you for playing quietly while I was doing work. In 5 minutes I will be able to join you.”
text: Ouer: "Dankie dat jy so stil gespeel het toe ek gewerk het. Oor 5 minute gaan ek kom saamspeel."

SourceText: Parent: “I really appreciate you playing quietly together while I worked. Now I can play with you for a bit. What would you like to do?”
text: Ouer: "Ek waardeer baie dat julle so stil saam gespeel het toe ek gewerk het. Nou kan ek bietjie met julle speel. Wat wil julle doen?"

SourceText: Praise @fields.child_nickname for something they have done well. They may not show it, but you’ll see them doing that good thing again. It will also reassure them that you notice and care.

text: Prys jou kind of tiener vir iets wat hulle goed gedoen het. Hulle sal dit dalk nie wys nie, maar jy sal sien dat hulle die goeie gedrag herhaal. Dit sal hulle ook verseker dat jy hulle raaksien en omgee.

SourceText: Praise the behaviour. Use words to describe the behaviour that you are praising. Say, 'Well done for finishing all your chores, @fields.child_nickname,' instead of 'Good job.'

SourceText: Remember that you can also change the type of messages you receive for an older or younger child. Just select "Tech Support." Chat to you later!

SourceText: Challenges are stressful. But problem-solving can really help. There are 6 basic steps for problem solving:
text: Uitdagings is stresvol. Maar probleemoplossing kan regtig help. Daar is 6 basiese stappe vir probleemoplossing:

SourceText: 1. Identify the problem
text: 1. Identifiseer die probleem

SourceText: 2. Think of possible solutions
text: 2. Dink aan moontlike oplossings

SourceText: 3. Figure out what the results of each solution would be
text: 3. Probeer dink wat die resultate van elke oplossing sal wees

SourceText: 4. Choose one solution
text: 4. Kies een oplossing

SourceText: 5. Try it out!
text: 5. Probeer dit!

SourceText: 6. Did it work? Great! If it did not work, then try another solution
text: 6. Het dit gewerk? Wonderlik! As dit nie gewerk het nie, probeer 'n ander oplossing

SourceText: We can also teach our children the same steps.
text: Ons kan ons kinders dieselfde stappe leer.

SourceText: When something bad happens, we often get upset and blame our children. But what they really need is someone to help them work through their problems.
text: As iets sleg gebeur, raak ons dikwels ontsteld en blameer ons ons kinders. Maar wat hulle eintlik nodig het, is iemand om hulle te help om deur die probleme te werk.

SourceText: Take a Pause! Become aware of anger and stress. Take a deep breath or count to 10 before you react. Then respond in a calmer way.
text: Vat 'n Blaaskans! Raak bewus van woede en stres. Haal diep asem of tel tot 10 voor jy reageer. Reageer dan op 'n rustiger manier.

SourceText: Help @fields.child_nickname learn how to solve problems. As children get older, they become more independent and sometimes push the boundaries that we create to keep them safe.
text: Help @fields.child_nickname leer hoe om probleme op te los. Namate kinders ouers raak, raak hulle meer onafhanklik en soms toets hulle die grense wat ons skep om hulle veilig te hou.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Help your child/teen learn how to solve problems. As children get older, they become more independent and sometimes push the boundaries that we create to keep them safe.
text: Help jou kind/tiener leer hoe om probleme op te los. Namate kinders ouers raak, raak hulle meer onafhanklik en soms toets hulle die grense wat ons skep om hulle veilig te hou.

SourceText: We are now spending a lot more time online. Being connected helps us stay positive…but it also presents risks and dangers.

SourceText: Here are 5 tips that can help you keep yourself safe online:

SourceText: 1. Learn about the risks and dangers
text: 1. Vind uit oor die risiko’s en gevare

SourceText: 2. Quick tech fixes
text: 2. Vinnige tegniese verstellings

SourceText: 3. Create healthy and safe online habits

text: 4. Bly privaat

SourceText: 5. Report and seek help

SourceText: To learn more about one of these, type "1" to "5". You can also type "N" to stop this tip.

SourceText: 1. Learn about risks and dangers
text: 1. Vind uit oor risiko’s en gevare

SourceText: Keep personal information private, especially from strangers. – some people are not who they say they are!
text: Hou persoonlike inligting privaat, veral van vreemdelinge – sommige mense is nie wie hulle sê hulle is nie!

SourceText: 2. Quick tech fixes:

SourceText: You can also create healthy and safe online habits like creating device-free spaces and times in your house (eating, playing, schoolwork, and sleeping).
text: Jy kan ook gesonde en veilige aanlyn gewoontes kweek, bv. toestel-vrye ruimtes en tye in jou huis (tydens etes, speeltyd, skoolwerk en slaaptyd).

SourceText: Remember that what goes online stays online (messages, photos, and videos).
text: Onthou, alles wat aanlyn gaan, bly aanlyn (boodskappe, foto’s en video’s).

SourceText: Here are some tips for sharing books with your child:
text: Hier is 'n paar wenke vir boeklees saam met jou kind:

SourceText: 1. Follow your child's interest
text: 1. Volg jou kind se belangstelling

SourceText: 2. Use a lifely voice
text: 2. Lees met 'n lewendige stem

SourceText: 3. Pointing and naming
text: 3. Wys en benoem

SourceText: 4. Be positive and supportive
text: 4. Wees positief en ondersteunend

SourceText: 5. Making actions and links
text: 5. Gebruik gebare en betrek julle leefwêreld

SourceText: 6. Talking about feelings
text: 6. Praat oor gevoelens

SourceText: 7. Babies and books go well together
text: 7. Babas en boeke gaan goed saam

SourceText: 2. Use a lively voice
text: 2. Lees met 'n lewendige stem

SourceText: Speak with a lively or animated voice. This will help to keep the child’s attention on the book.
text: Praat met 'n lewendige of opgewekte stem. Dit sal help om die kind se aandag by die boek te hou.

SourceText: 7. Babies and Books!
text: 7. Babas en Boeke!

SourceText: Even very young babies enjoy book-sharing and looking at the pictures together with a parent or caregiver. In fact, regular book-sharing helps their development and learning. And it is okay for them to put the book in their mouth - they are exploring!
text: Selfs baie jong babas geniet dit om saam met 'n ouer of versorger boeke te lees en prentjies te kyk. Om die waarheid te sê, hulle ontwikkeling en leer word bevorder deur gereelde saamlees. En dit is oukei vir hulle om die boek in hulle mond te sit – dis hoe hulle verken!

SourceText: Here are some examples!
text: Hier is 'n paar voorbeelde!

SourceText: “Look, she is smiling. Why do you think she is smiling? What made you smile today?”
text: "Kyk, sy glimlag. Hoekom dink jy glimlag sy? Wat het jou laat glimlag vandag?"

SourceText: “The monkey is sad because he is all on his own. Can you remember when you were last sad?”
text: "Die apie is hartseer omdat hy alleen is. Kan jy onthou wanneer jy laas hartseer was?"

SourceText: “That tiger looks angry. Why do you think he is angry? Do you remember when I got angry this morning?”
text: "Die tier lyk kwaad. Hoekom dink jy is hy kwaad? Onthou jy toe ek kwaad geword het vanoggend?"

SourceText: Books are a great way for children to learn more about feelings. You can use your face and voice to help them understand emotion words like happy, sad, angry, or scared. You can use what is happening in the book to talk about @fields.child_nickname’s own feelings, and why other people might feel a certain way.

Gebruik dit wat in die boek gebeur om oor @fields.child_nickname se eie gevoelens te praat, en waarom ander mense 'n sekere manier voel.

SourceText: Millions of families are struggling to make ends meet. When money is tight, this can make us feel anxious, stressed, and sad. How we understand and talk about money with our children is important. Our children can also help us to spend and save in ways that will benefit the family.

SourceText: Millions of families are struggling to make ends meet. When money is tight, this can make us feel anxious, stressed, and sad. How we understand and talk about money is important. We can also learn about how we can save in ways that will benefit the family.
text: Miljoene gesinne sukkel om uit te kom met wat hulle het. Wanneer die geld knyp, kan ons gespanne, gestres en hartseer raak. Ons begrip van geld en hoe ons daaroor praat, is belangrik. Ons kan ook leer hoe ons kan spaar op maniere wat die hele gesin bevoordeel.

SourceText: Here's a video to help you make a budget and save money together as a family.
text: Hier is 'n video wat wys hoe julle as gesin 'n begroting kan opstel en geld spaar.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you make a budget and save money together as a family.
text: Hier is 'n oudioboodskap wat vertel hoe julle as gesin 'n begroting kan opstel en geld spaar.

SourceText: Making a budget.
text: Stel 'n begroting op.

SourceText: A budget is how we decide what we will spend our money on, even in stressful times. Making a budget can help you have enough at the end of the month so that you need to borrow less.
text: 'n Begroting is hoe ons besluit waarop ons geld gaan uitgee, selfs in stresvolle tye. 'n Begroting kan jou help om genoeg aan die einde van die maand te hê sodat jy minder hoef te leen.

SourceText: Do you want 4 quick steps to help you make a budget and save money?
text: Wil jy 4 vinnige stappe hê om 'n begroting op te stel en geld te spaar?

SourceText: Step 1: What do we spend on now?
text: Stap 1: Waarop gee ons nou geld uit?

SourceText: • Get a piece of paper (or old newspaper or a cardboard box) and a pen.
text: • Kry 'n stuk papier (of ou koerantpapier of 'n kartonboks) en 'n pen.

SourceText: • Draw pictures of all the things that you and your family spend money on each month.
text: • Teken prentjies van al die dinge waarop jy en jou gesin elke maand geld uitgee.

SourceText: • Write next to each picture how much each thing costs.
text: • Skryf langs elke prent neer hoeveel elke ding kos.

SourceText: • Add up how much money you have to spend each month.
text: • Tel op hoeveel geld jy elke maand moet uitgee.

SourceText: Do you want to receive Step 2?
text: Wil jy Stap 2 ontvang?

SourceText: Step 2: Talk about needs and wants
text: Stap 2: Praat oor behoeftes en begeertes:

SourceText: • Needs: Which things are important or must haves for your family to survive? (like food, soap to wash hands, needs for ill or disabled family members).
text: • Behoeftes: Watter dinge is belangrik of noodsaaklik vir julle gesin om te oorleef? (bv. kos, seep vir hande was, middele vir siek of gestremde gesinslede).

SourceText: • Wants: Which things are nice to have but not essential?
text: • Begeertes: Watter dinge is lekker om te hê maar nie noodsaaklik nie?

SourceText: Do you want to receive Step 3?
text: Wil jy Stap 3 ontvang?

SourceText: Step 3: Build your own budget
text: Stap 3: Stel jou eie begroting op

SourceText: • Find a bag of stones or anything with lots of bits. This is your money for the month.
text: • Kry 'n sak met klippies of enigiets met baie stukkies. Dit is julle geld vir die maand.

SourceText: • As a family, decide what you will spend on what, and put the stones on your picture.
text: • Besluit as gesin waarop julle wil geld spandeer en sit die klippies op die prent.

SourceText: • If you can save even a tiny amount for the future, or for an emergency  – it can make a big difference over time.
text: • As julle net 'n klein bietjie kan wegsit vir die toekoms, of vir 'n noodgeval, kan dit 'n groot verskil maak mettertyd.

SourceText: Do you want to receive Step 4?
text: Wil jy Stap 4 ontvang?

SourceText: Step 4: Find out where you can get extra help
text: Stap 4: Vind uit waar jy ekstra hulp kan kry

SourceText: Your government or community groups may be giving money, vouchers, or food parcels to families in need. Ask about whether places in your community are giving support.
text: Jou regering of groepe in die gemeenskap gee dalk geld, koeponne of kospakkies vir gesinne in nood. Vind uit of plekke in jou gemeenskap ondersteuning gee.

SourceText: Well done for adding another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Over the next few days, try following these steps to create a family budget. You can even involve your partner in the discussion. Millions of families find that learning ways to manage money as a family reduces family arguments and brings everyone together. That's real success!
text: Jy het nog 'n vaardigheid by jou Ouerskap-gereedskapkis gevoeg het, wel gedaan! Probeer hierdie stappe oor die volgende paar dae om 'n gesinsbegroting op te stel. Jy kan selfs jou maat in die bespreking betrek. Miljoene gesinne is dit eens dat meningsverskille afneem en 'n hegter band gevorm word as die gesin saam maniere vind om geld te bestuur. Dis ware sukses!

SourceText: Millions of families are struggling to make ends meet especially due to the COVID-19 pandemic. When money is tight, this can make us feel anxious, stressed, and sad. How we understand and talk about money with our children is important. Our children can also help us to spend and save in ways that will benefit the family.
text: Miljoene gesinne sukkel om uit te kom met wat hulle het, veral weens die COVID-19-pandemie. Wanneer die geld knyp, kan ons gespanne, gestres en hartseer raak. Ons begrip van geld en hoe ons daaroor met ons kinders praat, is belangrik. Ons kinders kan ook help om geld te spandeer en te spaar sodat die hele gesin voordeel trek.

SourceText: Making a budget with your children and teens.
text: Stel 'n begroting op saam met jou kinders en tieners.

SourceText: A budget is how we decide what we will spend our money on, even in stressful times. Making a budget together helps children understand that we all need to make hard decisions in difficult times. It can also help you have enough at the end of the month so that you need to borrow less.
text: 'n Begroting is hoe ons besluit waarop ons geld gaan uitgee, selfs in stresvolle tye. Wanneer die gesin saam 'n begroting opstel, begin kinders verstaan dat ons almal harde besluite in moeilike tye moet neem. Dit kan jou ook help om genoeg aan die einde van die maand te hê sodat jy minder hoef te leen.

SourceText: Do you want 4 quick steps to help you make a budget and save money with your children?
text: Wil jy 4 vinnige stappe hê om saam met jou kinders 'n begroting op te stel en te spaar?

SourceText: • Discuss with your children what things you could try to spend less on as a family.
text: • Bespreek met jou kinders op watter dinge julle moet probeer om minder te spandeer as gesin.

SourceText: Well done for adding another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Over the next few days, try following these steps by involving your child in creating a family budget. Millions of families find that learning ways to manage money as a family reduces family arguments and brings everyone together. That's real success!
text: Jy het nog 'n vaardigheid by jou Ouerskap-gereedskapkis gevoeg het, wel gedaan! Probeer oor die volgende paar dae hierdie stappe om jou kind te betrek in die gesinsbegroting. Miljoene gesinne is dit eens dat meningsverskille afneem en 'n hegter band gevorm word as die gesin saam maniere vind om geld te bestuur. Dis ware sukses!

SourceText: Well done for adding another layer to your House of Support! Over the next few days, try following these steps by involving your child in creating a family budget. Millions of families find that learning ways to manage money as a family reduces family arguments and brings everyone together. That's real success!
text: Jy het nog 'n vlak by jou Huis van Ondersteuning gevoeg het, wel gedaan! Probeer oor die volgende paar dae hierdie stappe om jou kind te betrek in die gesinsbegroting. Miljoene gesinne is dit eens dat meningsverskille afneem en 'n hegter band gevorm word as die gesin saam maniere vind om geld te bestuur. Dis ware sukses!

SourceText: Create routines! Your children will feel more secure and safe when they know what is expected of them and how each day will go. Make a plan with them with time for play, meals, chores, school, and sleep.
text: Stel roetines vas! Jou kinders sal meer veilig en geborge voel as hulle weet wat van hulle verwag word en hoe elke dag gaan verloop. Stel saam met hulle 'n plan op en sit tyd opsy vir speel, etes, huistake, skool en slaap.

SourceText: Here's a video to help you create daily routines with your children.
text: Hier is 'n video om jou te help om roetines saam met jou kinders vas te stel.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you create daily routines with your children.
text: Hier is 'n oudioboodskap om jou te help om roetines saam met jou kinders vas te stel.

SourceText: Daily routines, such as time for schoolwork, play, meals, and sleep, can help our children feel safe and secure. They also give our children a sense of security.
text: Daaglikse roetines, soos tyd vir skoolwerk, speel, etes en slaap, kan jou kinders help om veilig en geborge te voel. Dit gee jou kinders ook 'n gevoel van sekuriteit.

SourceText: Here are 4 simple tips that you can use when establishing routines with your children:
text: Hier is 4 eenvoudige wenke om roetines met jou kinders vas te stel:

SourceText: 1. Give one instruction at a time
text: 1. Gee een opdrag op 'n slag

SourceText: 2. Use transition warnings to help move from one activity to the next one
text: 2. Gebruik oorgangswaarskuwings om van een aktiwiteit na die volgende te beweeg

SourceText: 3. Create regular eating and sleeping times
text: 3. Bepaal gereelde eet- en slaaptye

SourceText: 4. Involve your teen in creating daily routines
text: 4. Betrek jou tiener in die vasstel van daaglikse roetines

SourceText: To learn more about one of these tips, type "1" to 4". You can also type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Tik "1" tot "4" om meer oor hierdie wenke uit te vind. Jy kan ook "N" tik om hierdie wenk te stop.

SourceText: 1. Help your younger children learn routines by taking them through the activity step by step. Give one instruction at a time. Praise them each time they follow!
text: 1. Help jou jonger kinders om roetines te leer deur hulle stap vir stap deur die aktiwiteit te begelei. Geen een opdrag op 'n slag. Prys hulle elke keer as hulle dit volg!

SourceText: 2. Transition warnings can also be very helpful. They give your child some time to prepare for the next activity: "In 5 minutes it will be time to pack up the toys before bedtime…"
text: 2. Oorgangswaarskuwings kan ook baie nuttig wees. Dit gee jou kind 'n bietjie tyd om vir die volgende aktiwiteit voor te berei: "Oor 5 minute is dit tyd om die speelgoed op te pak voor bedtyd..."

SourceText: 3. Regular eating and sleeping times are especially important for babies. Not enough sleep can make your child cranky, irritable, and short tempered.
text: 3. Gereelde eet- en slaaptye is veral belangrik vir babas. 'n Gebrek aan slaap kan jou kind knieserig, geïrriteerd en kort van draad maak.

SourceText: Here are some tips for how to help your child prepare for bedtime:
text: Hier is 'n paar wenke oor hoe om jou kind te help regmaak vir slaaptyd:

SourceText: • Try to have regular bedtimes each day as much as possible.
text: • Probeer om soveel as moontlik slaaptye per dag te hê.

SourceText: • Try to make it quiet and the lights in the room dim.
text: • Maak dit so stil as moontlik en verdoof die ligte in die kamer.

SourceText: • Spend some time with your child. You can sing a lullaby or tell a calm story.
text: • Spandeer bietjie tyd met jou kind. Sing 'n wiegeliedjie of vertel 'n rustige storie.

SourceText: • Give your child a hug and kiss goodnight before leaving the room.
text: • Gee jou kind 'n drukkie en 'n goeienag-soentjie voor jy die kamer verlaat.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about creating daily routines:
text: Kies asseblief 'n ander nommer as jy meer wil uitvind oor hoe om daaglikse roetines vas te stel:

SourceText: 4, Involve your teen in creating daily routines
text: 4, Betrek jou tiener in die vasstel van daaglikse roetines

SourceText: Here are some suggestions for routines that you could establish with your children:
text: Hier is 'n paar voorstelle vir roetines wat jy met jou kinders kan vestig:

SourceText: Bedtime
text: Slaaptyd

SourceText: Schoolwork and Online Classes
text: Skoolwerk en Aanlyn Klasse

SourceText: Chores
text: Huistake

SourceText: Mealtime
text: Etenstyd

SourceText: Play/free time
text: Speel-/vrye tyd

SourceText: T.V. or gadget time
text: TV- of toestelletjie-tyd

SourceText: Storytime
text: Storietyd

SourceText: One-on-One Time
text: Een-tot-Een-Tyd

SourceText: You can add more, too! Here is a comic on creating a daily routine with your child.
text: Jy kan altyd nog bysit! Hier is 'n strokiesprent oor die vasstel van 'n daaglikse roetine met jou kind.

SourceText: Parent: “Now let’s look at the multiplication tables…”
text: Ouer: "Kom ons kyk nou na die maaltafels..."

SourceText: Parent: “Thank you for helping me make lunch, Junior”
text: Ouer: "Dankie dat jy gehelp het met middagete, Jan"

SourceText: Child: “My favourite!”
text: Kind: "My gunsteling!"

SourceText: Parent “And they all lived happily ever after…Goodnight, my love.”
text: Ouer: "En fluit-fluit my storie is uit... Lekker slaap, my liefie."

SourceText: Parent: "Thank you for being so supportive with the kids today.”
text: Ouer: "Dankie dat jy my so gehelp het met die kinders vandag."

SourceText: 4. Involve @fields.child_nickname in creating daily plans. Set goals and rewards together. Let them plan when they do schoolwork and when they can relax!
