SourceText: Being specific is not rude or insensitive, it really helps others understand you clearly and prevents confusion in the family. Emotions like anger and stress are part of our lives. All we need to do when we feel angry and stressed is know how to handle it by taking a few deep breaths before responding.
text: As mens spesifiek is, is jy nie onbeskof of onsensitief nie, dit help ander om jou duidelik te verstaan en verwarring in die gesin te voorkom. Emosies soos woede en stres is deel van ons lewens. Al wat ons moet doen as ons kwaad en gestres voel, is om te weet hoe om dit te hanteer deur 'n paar keer diep asem te haal voor jy reageer.

SourceText: It’s okay to not want to share at that time. Find some time later on when you feel calmer to explain so that everyone can understand.
text: Dis oukei as mens nie op die oomblik wil deel nie. Maak tyd later, wanneer jy rustiger voel, om te verduidelik sodat almal verstaan.

SourceText: Sharing emotions – especially the difficult ones – sets an important example for your child or teen ! It actually makes everyone in the family stronger, because you can understand and support each other better.

SourceText: Sharing emotions is about explaining how you are feeling so @fields.child_nickname is aware and learns to do the same. You can choose how much detail you want to share about the situation. It’s up to you! You can also choose to answer questions later: “I am feeling angry/stressed now, can you please give me some time? We can talk about this more tonight”.
text: Om emosies te deel, beteken jy verduidelik hoe jy voel sodat @fields.child_nickname bewus raak en leer om dieselfde te doen. Jy kan kies hoeveel detail jy wil deel oor die situasie. Dit hang van jou af! Jy kan ook kies om later vrae te beantwoord: "Ek voel kwaad/gestres nou, kan jy my bietjie tyd gee asseblief? Ons kan vanaand meer hieroor praat."

SourceText: Sharing emotions is about explaining how you are feeling so your child or teen  is aware and learns to do the same. You can choose how much detail you want to share about the situation. It’s up to you! You can also choose to answer questions later: “I am feeling angry/stressed now, can you please give me some time? We can talk about this more tonight”.

SourceText: Starting a new thing is always difficult at first. Give yourselves some time to get used to it, and keep giving the good example by noticing and sharing emotions. Over time, your child or teen  will learn to do the same – and they will feel even more loved and cared for.

SourceText: 1. Treat each other as equals
text: 1. Behandel mekaar as gelykes

SourceText: Family and friends might tell you how a husband or a father should act. But both men and women benefit when they talk to each other and make decisions together! For example, next time you’re making a decision, try involving your partner and ask what they think.
text: Familie en vriende sal dalk vir jou sê hoe 'n man of 'n pa moet optree. Maar mans sowel as vroue baat daarby as hulle met mekaar praat en saam besluite neem! Byvoorbeeld, probeer om volgende keer as jy 'n besluit neem jou maat te betrek en te vra wat hulle dink.

SourceText: Family and friends might tell you how a wife or a mother should act compared to a husband or father.  But both men and women benefit when they talk to each other and make decisions together! For example, next time you’re making a decision, try involving your partner and ask what they think.
text: Familie en vriende sal dalk vir jou sê hoe 'n vrou of 'n ma moet optree in vergelyking met 'n man of pa.  Maar mans sowel as vroue baat daarby as hulle met mekaar praat en saam besluite neem! Byvoorbeeld, probeer om volgende keer as jy 'n besluit neem jou maat te betrek en te vra wat hulle dink.

SourceText: Family and friends might tell you how a partner or a parent should act. But both men and women benefit when they talk to each other and make decisions together! For example, next time you’re making a decision, try involving your partner and ask what they think.
text: Familie en vriende sal dalk vir jou sê hoe 'n maat of 'n ouer moet optree. Maar mans sowel as vroue baat daarby as hulle met mekaar praat en saam besluite neem! Byvoorbeeld, probeer om volgende keer as jy 'n besluit neem jou maat te betrek en te vra wat hulle dink.

SourceText: Would you like to see a comic about treating each other as equals?
text: Wil jy graag 'n strokiesprent sien oor hoe om mekaar as gelykes te hanteer?

SourceText: Parent 1: “My dear, you look worried. What’s wrong?”
text: Ouer 1: "Jy lyk bekommerd, skat. Wat’s fout?"

SourceText: Parent 2: “The stove has not been working very well recently. I think the stove might be broken.”
text: Ouer 2: "Die stoof werk nie meer so lekker nie. Ek dink die stoof is dalk gebreek."

SourceText: Parent 1: “I noticed this too when I was cooking last week. I wanted to ask you: do you think we should buy a new one?”
text: Ouer 1: "Ek het dit ook agterkom laas week toe ek kosgemaak het. Ek wou jou nog vra: dink jy ons moet 'n nuwe een koop?"

SourceText: Parent 2: “Buying a new one would be really expensive. How about we talk about it after dinner, and we can make a decision together?
text: Ouer 2: "'n Nuwe een gaan baie duur wees. Dalk kan ons na ete praat vanaand en saam 'n besluit neem?"

SourceText: Parent 1: “That sounds great. Thank you for cooking dinner, my dear!”
text: Ouer 1: "Klink goed. Dankie dat jy aandete maak, skat!"

SourceText: Parent 1: “I am grateful we can talk about this and make this decision together. It makes a lot more sense to try to get it repaired first.”
text: Ouer 1: "Ek is dankbaar ons kan hieroor praat en saam 'n besluit kan neem. Dit maak baie meer sin om dit eers te probeer regmaak."

SourceText: Parent 2: “Me too. I feel a lot better now that we have talked about it together.”
text: Ouer 2: "Vir my ook. Ek voel baie beter noudat ons saam daaroor gepraat het."

SourceText: When mothers and fathers are both engaged with the parenting of their children, everyone benefits, including the children! Show your partner that you appreciate it when they spend quality time with your children.
text: As ma’s en pa’s albei betrokke is by die grootmaak van hulle kinders, baat almal, ook die kinders! Wys vir jou maat dat jy dit waardeer wanneer hulle gehaltetyd met julle kinders spandeer.

SourceText: Would you like to see a comic about becoming a confident parent and a supportive partner?
text: Wil jy graag 'n strokiesprent sien oor hoe om 'n selfversekerde ouer en ondersteunende maat te word?

SourceText: Parent 1: “Good job, Jessie! You are reading very well!”
text: Ouer 1: "Goeie werk, Jessie! Jy lees al so mooi!"

SourceText: Parent 2: “The weather today is so nice. It is a shame I have not had time to go outside for a walk.”
text: Ouer 2: "Die weer is so lekker vandag. Dis jammer ek kon nog nie bietjie gaan stap nie."

SourceText: Parent 1: “If you would like to get some fresh air and exercise, my dear, I can continue helping the children with their homework while you go for your afternoon walk.”
text: Ouer 1: "As jy bietjie vars lug en oefening wil kry, kan ek die kinders verder help met hulle huiswerk, dan kan jy vanmiddag bietjie gaan stap, my skat."

SourceText: Parent 2: “That would be wonderful, my love! Thank you for being so supportive.”
text: Ouer 2: "Dit sal wonderlik wees, my lief! Dankie dat jy so ondersteunend is."

SourceText: Parent 1: “Of course! It is fun to help the children with their reading practice! They are doing so well.”
text: Ouer 1: "Enige tyd! Dis lekker om die kinders met hulle leesoefeninge te help! Hulle vaar so goed."

SourceText: Sharing family responsibilities with your partner can make life less stressful! Can you think of ways you can share the workload? Doing tasks together can also make them more fun!
text: Om gesinsverantwoordelikhede met jou maat te deel, kan die lewe minder stresvol maak! Kan jy dink aan maniere hoe jy die werkslading kan deel? Om take saam te doen, kan dit ook lekkerder maak!

SourceText: Would you like to see a comic about sharing family responsibilities?
text: Wil jy graag 'n strokiesprent sien oor hoe om gesinsverantwoordelikhede te deel?

SourceText: Child: “Wow, there are so many clothes in here!”
text: Kind: "Sjoe, kyk al hierdie klere!"

SourceText: Parent 1: “You’re right, Kyle, there is quite a lot to do.”
text: Ouer 1: "Jy’s reg, Corrie, daar’s baie om te doen."

SourceText: Parent 1: “If we do it together it will take less time!”
text: Ouer 1: "As ons dit saam doen, gaan dit gouer gaan!"

SourceText: Parent 1: “Doing tasks together is also fun”
text: Ouer 1: "Dis lekker om saam te werk."

SourceText: Parent 2: “Thank you, my love. Sharing the workload makes it less stressful.”
text: Ouer 2: "Dankie, my lief. Dis minder stresvol as ons die werkslading deel."

SourceText: All adults have disagreements sometimes. But solving issues through fighting is not effective. Instead, if you start feeling angry, walk away for a bit or take a deep breath before responding in a calmer way.
text: Alle volwassenes het soms meningsverskille. Maar om probleme op te los deur te baklei, is nie doeltreffend nie. As jy kwaad is, moet jy eerder 'n bietjie wegstap of diep asem haal voor jy kalm en rustig reageer.

SourceText: Would you like to see a comic about resolving conflict peacefully?
text: Wil jy graag 'n strokiesprent sien oor hoe om konflik vreedsaam om te los?

SourceText: Parent 1: “Dinner is ready!”
text: Ouer 1: "Etenstyd!"

SourceText: Child: “Look, it is raining so much outside!”
text: Kind: "Kyk hoe reën dit buite!"

SourceText: Parent 1: “I am glad you brought in the laundry earlier, my dear. Otherwise, it would have been soaked by now!”
text: Ouer 1: "Ek is bly jy het vroeër die wasgoed in gebring, my skat. Anders was dit nou papsopnat!"

SourceText: Parent 1: “I thought you said you would bring in the laundry today?”
text: Ouer 1: "Ek dog jy het gesê jý gaan die wasgoed inbring vandag?"

SourceText: Parent 1: “No, I was busy cooking dinner! You told me you would take care of it! How could you forget? Now all the laundry is wet!”
text: Ouer 1: "Nee, ek het kos gemaak! Jy’t gesê jy gaan dit doen! Hoe kon jy vergeet het? Nou is al die wasgoed nat!"

SourceText: Parent 2: “I’m really sorry. It was a mistake!”
text: Ouer 2: "Ek’s regtig jammer. Dit was 'n fout!"

SourceText: Parent 1(thinking): I can’t believe he forgot! But everyone can make mistakes. Take a deep breath…
text: Ouer 1 (dink): Ek kan nie glo hy’t vergeet nie. Maar almal maak foute. Haal diep asem...

SourceText: Parent 1: “I’m sorry if I sounded upset. I just got stressed because I have had a long day.”
text: Ouer 1: "Ek’s jammer as ek vies geklink het. Ek is net gestres na hierdie lang dag."

SourceText: Parent 2: “I am sorry that I forgot the laundry. I know you have had a long day. I will make sure to take care of it after dinner.”
text: Ouer 2: "Ek’s jammer ek het vergeet van die wasgoed. Ek weet jy’t 'n lang dag gehad. Ek sal na ete die wasgoed hanteer."

SourceText: Listening and talking to those around us is key to a more peaceful home. Talking to your partner about issues before they become problems can help avoid arguments from building up.
text: Vir 'n meer vreedsame huis is dit belangrik om na almal te luister en met hulle te praat. Praat met jou maat oor dinge voordat dit probleme raak; dit kan help om te keer dat argumente opbou.

SourceText: Parent 1: “Are you okay, my love? You look tired.”
text: Ouer 1: "Is jy oukei, my lief? Jy lyk moeg."

SourceText: Parent 2: “I didn’t sleep well last night and so I am feeling quite tired.”
text: Ouer 2: "Ek het nie lekker geslaap gisteraand nie, so ek voel nogal moeg."

SourceText: Parent 1: “I am sorry to hear that, Amir. Is there anything I can do to help?”
text: Ouer 1: "Ek’s jammer om dit te hoor, Amir. Is daar iets wat ek kan doen om te help?"

SourceText: Parent 2: “I might try and get an earlier rest this evening.”
text: Ouer 2: "Ek kan probeer om vanaand bietjie vroeër te gaan slaap."

SourceText: Parent 1: “I can take over the children’s bedtime routine after dinner tonight, so that you can get some extra rest.”
text: Ouer 1: "Ek kan vanaand na ete die kinders se slaaptydroetine oorvat, dan kan jy bietjie ekstra rus inkry."

SourceText: Parent 2: “That would be lovely. Thank you so much, my dear.”
text: Ouer 2: "Dit sal wonderlik wees. Baie dankie, my skat."

SourceText: Would you like to see a comic about listening and talking to each other?
text: Wil jy dalk 'n strokiesprente sien oor luister en praat met mekaar?

SourceText: First, we can find ways to encourage our children to behave well more often. Spending One-on-One Time with them is an important first step!

SourceText: Second, we can learn effective ways to manage difficult behaviours in a loving but firm way.
text: Tweedens kan ons doeltreffende maniere leer hoe om moeilike gedrag liefdevol dog ferm te hanteer.

SourceText: Hi! Have you tried to talk to your partner about your feelings and any difficulties you are facing recently?
text: Hi! Het jy onlangs probeer om met jou maat te praat oor jou gevoelens en enige probleme wat jy op die oomblik het?

SourceText: Good for you! Talking about challenges and our emotions can be hard. How was your experience?
text: Mooi so! Dit kan moeilik wees om te praat oor probleme en ons emosies. Hoe het jy dit beleef?

SourceText: Sharing how we feel and talking about the difficulties we’re facing actually makes everyone in the family stronger! By sharing emotions you can better understand and support each other.
text: Wanneer ons praat oor hoe ons voel en oor die probleme waarmee ons sukkel, maak dit eintlik almal in die gesin sterker! Wanneer jy jou emosies deel, kan julle mekaar beter verstaan en ondersteun.

SourceText: Sharing your emotions or difficulties you are facing is about making others more aware of how you are feeling. You get to decide how much you want to share. You can also choose to share more at a later time.
text: Om jou emosies of probleme met ander te deel, beteken dat jy ander bewus maak van hoe jy voel. Jy besluit hoeveel jy wil deel. Jy kan ook kies om meer op 'n later stadium te deel.

SourceText: Talking about our feelings or challenges we’re facing can help others understand and support you better. Emotions and challenges are a part of life and learning how to handle these can help you avoid conflict with loved ones and make life less stressful.
text: Wanneer ons oor ons gevoelens of probleme praat, kan ander jou beter verstaan en ondersteun. Emosies en uitdagings is deel van die lewe, en wanneer ons weet hoe om dit te hanteer, kan ons makliker konflik met geliefdes vermy en die lewe minder stresvol maak.

SourceText: Starting something new can be difficult. Give yourself and others time to get used to it. By setting a good example by sharing your emotions and challenges you’re facing others will feel start to feel more comfortable sharing too.
text: Dit kan moeilik wees om iets nuuts te begin. Gee jouself en ander tyd om daaraan gewoond te raak. Wanneer jy 'n goeie voorbeeld stel deur jou emosies en probleme te deel, sal ander ook meer gemaklik begin voel om te deel.

SourceText: It’s okay if you don’t want to share at that time. You can choose to share how you’re feeling at a later time once you feel calmer.
text: Dis oukei as jy nie op daardie oomblik wil deel nie. Jy kan kies om op 'n later stadium as jy rustiger is jou gevoelens te deel.

SourceText: We are sorry to hear that. What was hard for you when talking about your feelings and challenges you are facing?
text: Ons is jammer om dit te hoor. Wat was moeilik vir jou toe jy gepraat het oor jou gevoelens en probleme waarmee jy tans sukkel?

SourceText: I am sorry to hear that. What was hard for you when talking about your feelings and challenges you are facing?

SourceText: Here's a video to help you keep your children safe online.
text: Hier is 'n video om jou te help om jou kinders aanlyn te beveilig.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you keep your children safe online.
text: Hier is 'n oudioboodskap om jou te help om jou kinders aanlyn te beveilig.

SourceText: Here are 6 tips that can help you keep your children safe online:
text: Hier is 6 wenke wat jou kan help om jou kinders aanlyn te beveilig:

SourceText: 4. Spend time with your child online
text: 4. Spandeer tyd saam met jou kind aanlyn

SourceText: 5. Build open communication
text: 5. Bou oop kommunikasie

SourceText: 6. Report and seek help
text: 6. Meld onaanvaarbare dinge aan en soek hulp

SourceText: • Adults targeting children for sexual purposes on social media, gaming, and messaging platforms.
text: • Volwassenes wat kinders teiken vir seksuele doeleindes op sosiale media, speletjies en boodskapplatforms.

SourceText: • Teens sharing personal information and sexual photos or videos of themselves.
text: • Tieners wat persoonlike inligting en seksuele foto’s of video’s van hulleself deel.

SourceText: • Cyberbullying from other young people and strangers.
text: • Kuberboelies, hetsy ander jong mense of vreemdelinge.

SourceText: 2. Tech fixes to protect your children online:
text: 2. Tegniese verstellings om jou kinders aanlyn te beskerm:

SourceText: This does not mean we should ban our children from spending time online. It just means that we need to learn how to protect them in a new world.
text: Dit beteken nie ons moet ons kinders belet om tyd aanlyn te spandeer nie. Dit beteken net ons moet leer hoe om hulle in 'n nuwe wêreld te beskerm.

SourceText: 5. Build open communication and trusting relationships
text: 5. Bou oop kommunikasie en vertrouensverhoudings

SourceText: Tell your children that if they experience something online (or anywhere) that makes them feel upset, uncomfortable, or scared, they can talk to you and you will not get mad or punish them.
text: Sê vir jou kinders dat as daar iets aanlyn (of enige ander plek) gebeur wat hulle ontstel, ongemaklik of bang laat voel, hulle met jou kan praat en jy nie gaan kwaad word of hulle straf nie.

SourceText: Report to INHOPE Hotlines and IWF portals and the Child Helpline in your country to get support if you or your children experience online violence or other things that are not acceptable.
text: Meld aanlyn geweld of ander onaanvaarbare dinge by INHOPE-blitslyne, IWF-portale en Childline aan om steun te kry as jy of jou kinders aan sulke dinge blootgestel is.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn another way to protect your child online:
text: Kies asseblief 'n ander nommer vir nog 'n manier om jou kind aanlyn te beskerm:

SourceText: Here is a comic on discussing online activities with your child
text: Hier is 'n strokiesprent oor 'n bespreking van aanlyn aktiwiteite met jou kind

SourceText: Parent: "Shani, have you done your homework?"
text: Ouer: "Shani, het jy al jou huiswerk gedoen?"

SourceText: Child: "Just a minute, I'm finishing this tiktok video"
text: Kind: "Ek maak net gou hierdie TikTok-video klaar"

SourceText: Parent: "You are a really great dancer! Tell me about why you like it."
text: Ouer: "Jy dans regtig goed! Hoekom hou jy so baie daarvan?"

SourceText: Child: "All my friends are on it. I have more than 600 likes and 120 followers."
text: Kind: "Al my vriende is daarop. Ek het meer as 600 likes en 120 followers."

SourceText: Parent: "I’m proud of how well you dance, Joey. But we need to make sure you are safe on this. I know your friends look at TikTok, but with an open account there are also paedophiles who look at videos of teenagers. Paedophiles are older people who want to attack young children and teens."
text: Ouer: "Ek is trots op hoe jy dans, Joey. Maar ons moet seker maak jy is veilig hierop. Ek weet jou vriende is op TikTok, maar met 'n oop rekening is daar ook pedofiele wat na video’s van tieners kan kyk. Pedofiele is ouer mense wat jong kinders en tieners wil aanval."

SourceText: Parent: "Let’s look together online at how we can keep this fun for you but also safe. Look – you can make your account private and control who follows you. So you can accept people you know but not strangers. Can we make a rule together that you can use TikTok but with a private account? I trust you to know who to accept!"
text: Ouer: "Kom ons kyk saam aanlyn hoe ons dit lekker kan hou vir jou, maar ook veilig. Kyk – jy kan jou rekening privaat maak en beheer wie jou volg. So, jy kan mense aanvaar wat jy ken, maar nie vreemdelinge nie. Kan ons saam 'n reël maak dat jy TikTok kan gebruik maar met 'n privaat rekening? Ek vertrou jou om te weet wie om te aanvaar!"

SourceText: Parent: "I’m proud of you Shalini..."
text: Ouer: "Ek’s trots op jou Shalini..."

SourceText: It‘s hard to feel positive when our kids or teenagers are driving us crazy. We often end up saying “Stop doing that!” But children are much more likely to do what we ask if we give them positive instructions and lots of praise for what they do right.
text: Dis moeilik om positief te voel wanneer ons kinders of tieners ons mal maak. Op die ou end sê ons dikwels net "Stop dit!" Maar kinders is baie meer geneig om te doen wat ons vra wanneer ons vir hulle positiewe opdragte gee, asook baie lof vir dit wat hulle reg doen.

SourceText: Here's a positive video to help you get your children to follow your instructions more often!
text: Hier is 'n positiewe video wat wys hoe jy jou kinders kan kry om jou opdragte meer dikwels uit te voer!

SourceText: Here's a positive audio message to help you get your children to follow your instructions more often!
text: Hier is 'n positiewe oudioboodskap wat sê hoe jy jou kinders kan kry om jou opdragte meer dikwels uit te voer!

SourceText: Here are 4 steps to help you get your children to follow your instructions more often:
text: Hier is 4 stappe om jou te help om jou kinders te kry om jou opdragte meer dikwels uit te voer:

SourceText: 1. Get their attention
text: 1. Kry hulle aandag

SourceText: 2. Be positive, specific, and realistic
text: 2. Wees positief, spesifiek en realisties

SourceText: 3. One instruction at a time
text: 3. Een opdrag op 'n slag

SourceText: 4. Praise them for doing it!
text: 4. Prys hulle as hulle dit doen!

SourceText: To learn more about one of these steps, type "1" to "4". You can also type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Om meer oor hierdie stappe uit te vind, tik "1" tot "4". Jy kan ook "N" tik om hierdie wenk te stop.

SourceText: Step 3. Give Instructions One at a Time
text: Stap 3. Gee Een Opdrag op 'n Slag

SourceText: Children are much more likely to do what you ask if you break things up into smaller steps.
text: Kinders is baie meer geneig om te doen wat jy vra as jy dinge in kleiner stappe opbreek.

SourceText: Step 4. Praise Your Children When They Follow Instructions
text: Stap 4. Prys Jou Kinders as hulle Opdragte Uitvoer

SourceText: They will feel good about it and be more likely to follow instructions in the future!
text: Hulle sal goed voel daaroor en in die toekoms meer geneig wees om opdragte uit te voer!

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to get your children to follow instructions more often:
text: Kies asseblief 'n ander nommer as jy meer wil uitvind oor hoe om jou kinders te kry om opdragte meer dikwels uit te voer:

SourceText: Can your child actually do what you are asking them? It is very hard for a child to keep quiet inside for a whole day but maybe they can keep quiet for 15 minutes.
text: Is jou kind werklik in staat om te doen wat jy van hulle vra? Dit is baie moeilik vir 'n kind om 'n hele dag lank binne die huis stil te bly, maar dalk kan hulle vir 15 minute stilbly.

SourceText: Here is a comic on using positive words and praise with your teen.
text: Hier is 'n strokiesprent waarin positiewe woorde en lof vir jou tiener gebruik word.

SourceText: Teen: “Can I watch some T.V. after dinner?”
text: Tiener: "Kan ek 'n bietjie TV kyk na ete?"

SourceText: Parent: “When you clear the table, you can watch an hour of T.V.”
text: Ouer: "As jy die tafel afgedek het, kan jy vir 'n uur TV kyk."

SourceText: Parent: “I really appreciate it when you help clean up after dinner. Thank you, Dylan”
text: Ouer: "Ek waardeer dit regtig as jy help opruim na ete. Dankie, Danie"

SourceText: Parent and teen watching T.V. together.
text: Ouer en tiener kyk saam TV.

SourceText: Step 2. Be Specific, Positive, and Realistic!
text: Stap 2. Wees Spesifiek, Positief en Realisties!

SourceText: Household rules can help keep our children safe from potential dangers both inside the house and in the community. They also help children to know what kind of behaviour is expected from them.
text: Huisreëls kan help om ons kinders teen potensiële gevaar binne die huis en buite in die gemeenskap te beskerm. Dit help kinders ook om te weet watter soort gedrag van hulle verwag word.

SourceText: Hello! Today's Parenting Tip is about how we can involve our children in creating consistent household rules.
text: Hallo! Vandag se Ouerskapwenk gaan oor hoe ons ons kinders kan betrek in die neerlê van konsekwente huisreëls.

SourceText: Household rules can help keep our children safe from potential dangers both inside the house and in the community. They also help children to know what kind of behaviour is expected from them.
text: Huisreëls kan help om ons kinders teen potensiële gevaar binne die huis en buite in die gemeenskap te beskerm. Dit help kinders ook om te weet watter soort gedrag van hulle verwag word.

SourceText: Here's an audio message on how you can involve your children in establishing household rules.
text: Hier is 'n oudioboodskap oor hoe jy jou kinders kan betrek in die neerlê van huisreëls.

SourceText: Here's is a video on how you can involve your children in establishing household rules.
text: Hier is 'n video oor hoe jy jou kinders kan betrek in die neerlê van huisreëls.

SourceText: Here are some simple tips on how you can make household rules with your children and teens:
text: Hier is 'n paar eenvoudige wenke oor hoe jy huisreëls saam met jou kinders en tieners kan neerlê:

SourceText: • Involve your child in establishing household rules.
text: • Betrek jou kind in die neerlê van huisreëls.

SourceText: • Make your household rules clear and specific.
text: • Maak huisreëls duidelik en spesifiek.

SourceText: • Make sure your child understands the reasons why you are establishing a household rule.
text: • Maak seker jou kind verstaan die redes waarom jy 'n huisreël neerlê.

SourceText: • Make your household rules fair and realistic (just like instructions).
text: • Maak huisreëls regverdig en realisties (net soos opdragte).

SourceText: • Praise and simple incentives can help support your child in following a household rule.
text: • Lof en eenvoudige aansporings kan nuttig wees om jou kind te help om by 'n huisreël te hou.

SourceText: • Add only 1 household rule at a time.
text: • Voeg slegs 1 huisreël by op 'n slag.

SourceText: Children and teens are spending a lot more time online. Here is a comic on how you can create safe and healthy online habits like scheduling time online and offline.
text: Kinders en tieners spandeer baie meer tyd aanlyn. Hier is 'n strokiesprent oor hoe jy veilige en gesonde aanlyn gewoontes kan kweek, soos skedulering van tye aanlyn en van lyn af.

SourceText: Parent: “Jack, you have been spending a lot of time on your tablet. Why do you think I am concerned about that?”
text: Ouer: "Jan, jy was nou al baie lank op jou tablet. Hoekom dink jy is ek bekommerd daaroor?"

SourceText: Child: “Um…because I am not doing my schoolwork?”
text: Kind: "Um...want ek doen nie my huiswerk nie?"

SourceText: Parent: “Yes, that is one reason. It is important that you make the time for your schoolwork. I also like seeing you being more active. Maybe we can make a household rule about gadget use. What do you think would be a fair limit each day?”
text: Ouer: "Ja, dis een rede. Dit is belangrik dat jy tyd maak vir jou huiswerk. Ek wil ook graag hê jy moet meer aktief wees. Dalk kan ons 'n huisreël maak oor toestelgebruik. Wat dink jy sal 'n billike tyd wees elke dag?"

SourceText: Child: “Um…two hours a day?”
text: Kind: "Um...twee ure per dag?"

SourceText: Parent: “Hmmm…I think that might be too much time. You have so much else to do every day.”
text: Ouer: "Hmmm...dit klink vir my bietjie te veel tyd. Jy het so baie om elke dag te doen."

SourceText: Child: “How about one hour for fun and one hour for learning?
text: Kind: "Wat van een uur vir die lekker en een uur vir leer?"

SourceText: Parent: “That sounds reasonable. I would also like you to do your schoolwork before using any gadgets. So from now on, the household rule is that you do your schoolwork before using gadgets and that you can have 1 hour for free time and 1 hour for educational activities. Okay?”
text: Ouer: "Dit klink redelik. Ek wil ook graag hê jy moet jou skoolwerk doen voordat jy enige toestelle gebruik. So, van jou af, is die huisreël dat jy jou skoolwerk doen voor jy enige toestelle gebruik en dat jy 1 uur vrye tyd en 1 uur vir opvoedkundige aktiwiteite het. Oukei?"

SourceText: Child: “Okay.”
text: Kind: "Oukei."

SourceText: Today's tip is about how we can help to protect our children.
text: Vandag se wenk gaan oor hoe ons kan help om ons kinders te beskerm.

SourceText: The idea of talking to children about abuse can be scary. We don't know what to say. But there are some simple things that can help them understand when it is not OK to be touched, and that they can tell you if something ever happens.
text: Die idee om met ons kinders oor misbruik te praat, is vreesaanjaend. Ons weet nie wat om te sê nie. Maar daar is 'n paar eenvoudige dinge wat hulle kan help om te verstaan wanneer dit nie oukei is as iemand aan hulle vat nie en dat hulle jou kan sê as iets ooit gebeur.

SourceText: When you are walking or doing something together it can be easier to chat.
text: Wanneer julle stap of iets saam doen, kan dit makliker wees om te gesels.

SourceText: Do you want to learn more about how to protect your child from abuse?
text: Wil jy graag meer uit vind oor hoe om jou kind teen misbruik te beskerm?

SourceText: Here are 3 things that you should make sure your child knows to protect them from abuse:
text: Hier is 3 dinge wat jy moet doen om seker te maak jou kind weet van beskerming teen misbruik:

SourceText: 1. Learn about private parts
text: 1. Leer oor privaat dele

SourceText: 2. Your body belongs to you
text: 2. Jou liggaam behoort aan jou

SourceText: 3. Bad secrets should be told
text: 3. Slegte geheime moet vertel word

SourceText: Type "1" to "3" to learn more about these tips. Type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Tik "1" tot "3" om meer oor hierdie wenke uit te vind. Tik "N" om hierdie wenk te stop.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to protect your child from abuse:
text: Kies asseblief 'n ander nommer as jy meer wil uitvind oor hoe om jou kind teen misbruik te beskerm:

SourceText: 3. Bad secrets should be told.
text: 3. Slegte geheime moet vertel word.

SourceText: Your children should tell you if there is a secret that makes them feel worried. You will not be angry. Only nice secrets - like a surprise birthday party - should be kept secret.
text: Jou kinders moet vir jou sê as daar 'n geheim is waaroor hulle bekommerd is. Jy sal nie kwaad wees nie. Net mooi geheime – soos 'n verrassingspartytjie – kan geheim gehou word.

SourceText: The parts of their body that go under people's underwear or a swimsuit are private parts. It is not OK for other people to touch or to ask to look at them, or ask them to look at or touch theirs.
text: Die dele van hulle liggaam wat onder 'n mens se onderklere of swemklere kom, is privaat dele. Dis nie oukei vir iemand om daaraan te vat of te vra of hulle daarna kan kyk nie, óf as iemand jou kind vra om na hulle s’n te kyk of daaraan te vat nie.

SourceText: If someone tries to touch your children's private parts they must say NO and tell a grown up that they trust.
text: As iemand probeer om aan jou kinders se privaat dele te vat, moet hulle NEE sê en dit vertel vir 'n grootmens wat hulle vertrou.

SourceText: Stress from caregiving can make us angry. Here is how we can maintain control and keep calm.
text: Die stres van versorging kan mens kwaad maak. Hier is hoe ons kalm en in beheer kan bly.

SourceText: Here's a video to help you maintain control and keep calm when you get angry.
text: Hier is 'n video om jou te help om kalm en in beheer te bly as jy kwaad word.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you maintain control and keep calm when you get angry.
text: Hier is 'n oudioboodskap om jou te help om kalm en in beheer te bly as jy kwaad word.

SourceText: Think about what makes you angry? When does it happen? How do you normally react?
text: Dink aan wat jou kwaad maak? Wanneer gebeur dit? Hoe reageer jy gewoonlik?

SourceText: Prevent anger from starting in the first place. Get some sleep or rest when you are tired. Try to eat something when you are hungry. Ask someone for support when you are feeling alone.
text: Keer woede nog voor dit begin. Slaap of rus as jy moeg is. Probeer iets eet as jy honger is. Vra iemand vir ondersteuning as jy alleen voel.

SourceText: Here are some things that can prevent bad things from happening when you are angry:
text: Hier is 'n paar dinge wat kan keer dat slegte dinge gebeur wanneer jy kwaad is:

SourceText: 1. Cut back on drinking alcohol or don’t drink, especially when the kids are awake.
text: 1. Drink minder alkohol of moenie drink nie, veral wanneer die kinders wakker is.

SourceText: 2. Do you have weapons or things that can be used to hurt others? Lock them up, hide them or take them out of the home.
text: 2. Het jy wapens of dinge wat gebruik kan word om ander seer te maak? Sluit dit iewers toe, steek dit weg of verwyder dit uit die huis.

SourceText: 3. It’s ok to have your children stay somewhere safe or take them to a place where they can get help.
text: 3. Dis oukei om jou kinders iewers veilig te laat bly of hulle te neem na 'n plek waar hulle kan hulp kry.

SourceText: Well done @fields.user_name! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit. Over the next few days, take 10 deep breaths or do some exercise when you feel angry. Learning how to manage your anger can help you avoid some difficult situations.
text: Mooi so @fields.user_name! Jy het nog 'n vaardigheid by jou Ouerskap-gereedskapkis gevoeg. Probeer oor die volgende paar dae 10 keer diep asemhaal of bietjie oefeninge doen as jy kwaad voel. Wanneer jy weet hoe om jou woede te hanteer, kan jy makliker keer dat situasies hand uitruk.

SourceText: Great job! You should be proud of yourself! Research shows that every time you control your anger in front of your child, you increase your child's brain development.
text: Goeie werk! Dis iets om op trots te wees! Navorsing sê dat elke keer as jy jou woede voor jou kind beheer, verhoog jy jou kind se breinontwikkeling.

SourceText: It is completely normal to experience this challenge. Next time you feel yourself getting angry try to manage this by taking deep breaths in. This can allow you to relax and reduce stress, which can help with managing your emotions. Every time you do this, you increase your child's brain development!
text: Dis heeltemal normaal om te voel dit is 'n uitdaging. Volgende keer as jy voel jy word kwaad, probeer dit beheer deur 'n paar keer diep asem te haal. Dit sal jou help ontspan en jou stres verlig, wat jou weer kan help om jou emosies te hanteer. Elke keer as jy dit doen, verhoog jy jou kind se breinontwikkeling!

SourceText: Hi! Managing anger can be really difficult. Take a break when you feel you are getting angry at your children or someone else.
text: Hi! Om woede te hanteer kan regtig moeilik wees. Vat 'n blaaskans as jy voel jy word kwaad vir jou kinders of iemand anders.

SourceText: Go somewhere else for 5 minutes to regain control of your emotions. If you have safe outdoor space, go outside. You can get through this!
text: Gaan vir 5 minute iewers anders heen om beheer oor jou emosies te kry. As jy veilige ruimte buite het, gaan buitentoe. Jy kan hierdeur kom!

SourceText: Did you know that research shows if you control your anger or do something positive, you increase your child's brain development? Be proud of yourself when you manage to do it!
text: Het jy geweet navorsing sê dat, as jy jou woede beheer of iets positiefs doen, jy jou kind se breinontwikkeling verhoog? Wees trots op jouself as jy dit regkry!

text: Hier is 'n video om jou te help om jou woede te beheer!

SourceText: When you take care of yourself, you take care of your children. We all need to connect. Try to talk to friends, family, and other support networks every day. If it has been a while since you reached out to someone, do it now!
text: As jy vir jouself sorg, sorg jy ook vir jou kinders. Ons almal het nodig om in verbinding te bly. Probeer om daagliks met vriende, familie of enige ander ondersteuningsnetwerk te praat. As jy lanklaas na iemand uitgereik het, doen dit nou!

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are not having a good day. It is completely normal to be going through a difficult time now. Remember that you are not alone. Here is an activity that might also help...
text: Jammer om te hoor jy het nie 'n lekker dag nie. Dit is heeltemal normaal om nou deur 'n rowwe tyd te gaan. Onthou, jy is nie alleen nie. Hier is 'n aktiwiteit wat dalk ook kan help...

SourceText: Make a list of healthy activities that you like to do. Here are some suggestions:
text: Maak 'n lys van gesonde aktiwiteite waarvan jy hou. Hier is 'n paar voorstelle:

SourceText: • Listening to your favourite music
text: • Luister na jou gunstelingmusiek

SourceText: • Going for a walk (if allowed)
text: • Gaan stap 'n bietjie (indien moontlik)

SourceText: • Doing some exercise
text: • Doen bietjie oefeninge

SourceText: • Drinking a cup of tea by yourself
text: • Drink 'n koppie tee op jou eie

SourceText: • Calling up a friend
text: • Bel 'n vriend

SourceText: • Singing, dancing, praying, or reading
text: • Sing, dans, bid of lees

SourceText: • Sitting in the sun with your eyes closed
text: • Sit in die son met jou oë toe

SourceText: • Watching your favourite T.V. show
text: • Kyk jou gunsteling-TV-program

SourceText: Pick one and do it today!
text: Kies een en doen dit vandag!

SourceText: We would love to learn more about how we can improve these messages. Would you be willing to chat with us about your experience? You will receive a free data voucher if you are contacted for an interview!
text: Ons wil graag meer uitvind oor hoe ons hierdie boodskappe kan verbeter. Sou jy gewillig wees om met ons te gesels oor jou ervaring? Jy sal 'n gratis datageskenkbewys ontvang indien jy vir 'n onderhoud gekontak word!

SourceText: Thank you so much! Here is a link to sign up!

SourceText: Hello! Did you know that 3 is a magical number? Breathe in to the count of three and breathe out to the count of three. How do you feel now? Do you feel any different?
text: Hallo! Het jy geweet 3 is ’n towergetal? Asem in vir drie tellings en asem uit vir drie tellings. Hoe voel jy nou? Voel jy enige verskil?

SourceText: Here's an audio message to guide you through this activity!
text: Hier is 'n oudioboodskap om jou deur hierdie aktiwiteit te begelei!

SourceText: What are your three favourite foods? Can you name three things you can see right now?
text: Wat is jou drie gunsteling-kosse om te eet? Kan jy drie dinge noem wat jy nou sien?

SourceText: Can you hear three sounds you can hear right now?
text: Kan jy drie dinge noem wat jy nou hoor?

SourceText: What are the three things you are grateful for right now?
text: Vir watter drie dinge is jy op hierdie oomblik dankbaar?

SourceText: Breathe in to the count of three and breathe out to the count of three. How do you feel now? Do you feel any different?
text: Asem in vir drie tellings en asem uit vir drie tellings. Hoe voel jy nou? Voel jy enige verskil?

SourceText: Three is a magical number!
text: Drie is ’n towergetal!

SourceText: Here's a video to guide through this activity!
text: Hier is 'n video om jou deur hierdie aktiwiteit te begelei!

SourceText: Here is a song made just for parents like you.
text: Hier is 'n liedjie spesiaal geskryf vir ouers soos jy.

SourceText: One-on-One Time with your children is free and fun. It makes children feel loved and secure, and shows them that they are important. It also increases their confidence and self-esteem!
text: Een-tot-Een-Tyd met jou kinders is gratis en pret. Dit laat kinders gelief en veilig voel, en wys vir hulle dat hulle belangrik is. Dit verhoog ook hulle selfvertroue en selfagting!

SourceText: Here are 6 tips to make One-on-One Time with your child a success:
text: Hier is 6 wenke om Een-tot-Een-Tyd met jou kind 'n sukses te maak:

SourceText: 1. Spend at least five minutes with each child
text: 1. Spandeer ten minste vyf minute met elke kind

SourceText: 2. Give your child your full attention
text: 2. Gee jou kind jou volle aandag

SourceText: 3. Let your child choose the activity
text: 3. Laat jou kind die aktiwiteit kies

SourceText: 4. Follow your child's lead
text: 4. Volg jou kind se leiding

SourceText: 5. Use words to describe what your child is doing
text: 5. Gebruik woorde om te beskryf wat jou kind doen

SourceText: 6. Have fun!
text: 6. Geniet jouself!

SourceText: Even 5 minutes a day of quality time makes a big difference. If you have more than one child, try to find time for each individual child. It can be at the same time each day so your children look forward to it.
text: Selfs net 5 minute se gehaltetyd per dag maak 'n groot verskil. As jy meer as een kind het, probeer om vir elke kind individueel tyd te maak. Dit kan op dieselfde tyd elke dag wees sodat jou kinders daarna uitsien.

SourceText: Children need to do things in their own time. Try to give them time to explore and be patient. Play alongside and copy what they are doing but try to let them keep the initiative.
text: Kinders moet dinge op hulle eie tyd kan doen. Probeer hulle tyd gee om te verken, en wees geduldig. Speel langs hulle en boots na wat hulle doen, maar probeer om hulle die inisiatief te laat behou.

SourceText: Choosing builds their self confidence. If they want to do something that isn’t okay, then this is a chance to talk with them about this.
text: Deur keuses te maak, bou hulle hul selfvertroue. As hulle iets wil doen wat nie oukei is nie, is dit 'n geleentheid om met hulle daaroor te praat.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to spend One-on-One Time with your child:
text: Kies asseblief 'n ander nommer as jy meer wil uitvind oor hoe om Een-tot-Een-Tyd met jou kind te spandeer:

SourceText: Here is a comic about spending one-on-one time with your child! Try to follow your child's lead when spending time with them. It will help build self-confidence.
text: Hier is 'n strokiesprent oor een-tot-een-tyd met jou kind! Probeer om jou kind se leiding te volg wanneer jy tyd met hulle spandeer. Dit help om selfvertroue te bou.

SourceText: Parent: "I see you are playing quietly with the lego with concentration, Alex."
text: Ouer: "Ek sien jy speel so soet met die lego, en met soveel konsentrasie, Alex."

SourceText: Parent: "Wow! You are building such a tall and strong wall with those legos."
text: Ouer: "Sjoe! Jy bou so 'n lang en sterk muur met die lego."

SourceText: Child: "It is for cows."
text: Kind: "Dit is vir beeste."

SourceText: Parent: "It will keep the cow safe!"
text: Ouer: "Dit sal die beeste veilig hou!"

SourceText: Child: "Now you can help me build a house for our family to sleep in!"
text: Kind: "Nou kan jy my help om 'n huis te bou vir die gesin om in te slaap!"

SourceText: Parent: "This house is going to keep our family warm and dry. You are such a good builder, Alex!"
text: Ouer: "Hierdie huis gaan ons gesin warm en droog hou. Jy is so 'n goeie bouer, Alex!"

SourceText: Listening to @fields.child_nickname is more important than talking to them at this time. If you do talk you should describe what @fields.child_nickname is doing. Use words to describe actions, colours, shapes, numbers, sizes, textures, temperatures, tastes, sounds, and anything else that is happening!

Gebruik woorde om aksies, kleure, vorms, getalle, groottes, teksture, temperatuur, smake, klanke en enigiets anders wat gebeur, te beskryf!

SourceText: Here is a comic on spending one-on-time with your teen.

SourceText: One-on-One Time with your teen helps build a positive and trusting relationship. When you really notice them and listen to what they are saying and what they like, you make them feel valued and appreciated.
text: Een-tot-Een-Tyd met jou tiener help om 'n positiewe verhouding vol vertroue te bou. Wanneer jy hulle regtig raaksien en luister na wat hulle sê en waarvan hulle hou, voel hulle jy waardeer hulle.

SourceText: Here are 6 tips on how to make One-on-One Time a positive experience for you and your teen:
text: Hier is 6 wenke oor hoe om Een-tot-Een-Tyd 'n positiewe belewenis vir jou en jou tiener te maak:

SourceText: 2. Let your teen choose the activity
text: 2. Laat jou tiener die aktiwiteit kies

SourceText: 3. Follow your teen's lead
text: 3. Volg jou tiener se leiding

SourceText: 4. Give your teen your full attention
text: 4. Gee jou tiener jou volle aandag

SourceText: 5. Show your teen you are really listening
text: 5. Wys jou tiener jy luister regtig

SourceText: Fathers can have difficult relationships with their teenagers, it can be hard to find pleasure from spending time with them. Instead, we spend a lot of time disciplining them or complaining about how they are behaving.

SourceText: Set aside a specific time to spend One-on-One Time with @fields.child_nickname each day. Choose a time when you and @fields.child_nickname will not be interrupted and when @fields.child_nickname does not have something else that they want to do, like watching TV or playing with phones.

SourceText: You can even try rephrasing back what @fields.child_nickname says when they speak to you. For example, when @fields.child_nickname says, “This math problem is really hard,” you can say, “Yeah, I see that you are finding it difficult.” It shows you are really listening to them and will make them feel supported.

text: Tik "SOS" enige tyd as jy graag die details van nooddienste of ander blitslyne wil hê. Onthou, alles wat jy sê is heeltemal privaat!

SourceText: Here are the contact details of your local medical services:
text: Hier is die kontakbesonderhede van jou plaaslike mediese dienste:

SourceText: You should be proud of yourself for exploring ways to get help for you and your family.
text: Wees trots op jouself omdat jy maniere soek om jou en jou gesin te help.

SourceText: Do you need some support with an emotional issue?
text: Het jy ondersteuning nodig vir 'n emosionele probleem?

SourceText: If you ever feel like talking privately to a trained professional, you can call:
text: As jy ooit privaat met 'n opgeleide professionele persoon wil praat, skakel:

SourceText: Do you need some urgent help?
text: Het jy dringende hulp nodig?

SourceText: Here are the contact details of your local emergency services:
text: Hier is die kontakbesonderhede van jou plaaslike nooddienste:

SourceText: Are you experiencing an unsafe situation?
text: Verkeer jy tans in 'n onveilige situasie?

SourceText: Are you currently facing an emergency?
text: Het jy tans 'n noodgeval?

SourceText: Would you like to go back to the previous messages?
text: Wil jy teruggaan na die vorige boodskappe toe?

SourceText: That's okay. Remember you can always type "Help" if you ever need extra support. Chat later!
text: Dis oukei. Onthou, jy kan altyd "Help" tik as jy ooit ekstra ondersteuning nodig het. Praat later!

SourceText: Quick tip: It can be difficult to know how to talk to your children about something like COVID-19, especially since we are learning about it too.
text: Vinnige wenk: Dis soms moeilik om te weet hoe om met jou kinders oor iets soos COVID-19 te praat, veral omdat ons ook steeds daaroor leer.

SourceText: The important thing is to be open and listen to your children. Be honest and supportive. Show them that you care.
text: Die belangrike ding is om oop te wees en na jou kinders te luister. Wees eerlik en ondersteunend. Wys hulle dat jy omgee.

SourceText: Quick tip: It is really hard to help our children continue learning when schools are closed or part-open. One thing that might be helpful is to try and set up a daily schedule that includes time for schoolwork and time for fun.
text: Vinnige wenk: Dit is regtig moeilik om ons kinders te help om aan te hou leer wanneer skole toe is of net gedeeltelik oop. Een ding wat kan help is om 'n daaglikse skedule op te stel wat tyd insluit vir skoolwerk en pret.

SourceText: Quick tip: Caring for yourself is really important. Take five deep breaths when you feel overwhelmed. Try talking to a friend, or doing something relaxing for yourself? You deserve it!
text: Vinnige wenk: Dis baie belangrik om vir jouself te sorg. Haal vyf keer diep asem wanneer jy oorweldig voel. Probeer om met 'n vriend te praat, of doen iets vir jouself wat jou laat ontspan? Jy verdien dit!

SourceText: Quick tip: All children, including those living with disabilities, need love, respect and time especially at difficult times.
text: Vinnige wenk: Alle kinders, ook dié wat met gestremdhede leef, het liefde, respek en tyd nodig, veral in moeilike tye.

SourceText: Quick tip: This is a stressful time for all of us. When a problem comes up, talk about it together! What is the problem exactly? What different solutions are there and what are the consequences of one? That way, you can find a solution that can be OK for everyone.
text: Vinnige wenk: Hierdie is 'n stresvolle tyd vir almal van ons. Praat met mekaar as daar 'n probleem opduik! Wat presies is die probleem? Watter verskillende oplossings is daar en wat is die gevolge van een? So kan julle 'n oplossing vind wat vir almal OK kan wees.

SourceText: Quick tip: It is normal to be stressed about money. Talk to your children about how much money comes in and what you spend money on as a family each month. When everyone sees where the money goes, it is easier to agree on where you can save money together!
text: Vinnige wenk: Dit is normaal om gestres te wees oor geld. Praat met jou kinders oor hoeveel geld inkom en waarop julle as gesin elke maand geld spandeer. As almal sien waarheen die geld gaan, is dit makliker om saam te stem waar julle saam kan geld spaar!

SourceText: Here's another tip! A daily stress-reducer can help us with parenting, and make us feel better.  Let’s start with 30 seconds of relaxation for yourself. You deserve this!
text: Hier’s nog 'n wenk! 'n Daaglikse oefening vir stresverligting kan ons help met ouerskap, en ons beter laat voel.  Kom ons begin met 30 sekondes se ontspanning vir jouself. Jy verdien dit!

SourceText: Would you like to receive this activity now?
text: Wil jy graag nou hierdie aktiwiteit ontvang?

SourceText: That's Ok! You can always type "Relax" whenever you want an activity to help you with stress.
text: Dis oukei! Jy kan altyd "Ontspan" tik wanneer jy ook al 'n aktiwiteit wil hê om te help met stres.

SourceText: Quick tip: All children misbehave. One thing that can help is to praise @fields.child_nickname anytime that they do something good – however small. They may not look like they want your praise but they still really, really do.

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are finding this challenging. When we have a problem, we always want to get to the quickest end result and can forget about the steps. Really understanding the problem and the different solutions first helps to come up with the best solution together. You can do this!

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are finding this challenging. Sometimes it can be difficult to agree with everyone in the family, especially if not everyone is calm yet. SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are finding this challenging. Creating new and healthy habits like device-free space and time in your house (eating, playing, schoolwork, and sleeping) is a learning process. Try slowly introducing  device-free times, and build up from there. Change takes time, you can do this!
text: Jammer om te hoor dis 'n uitdaging vir jou. Om nuwe en gesonde gewoontes te kweek, soos toestel-vrye ruimtes en tye in jou huis (tydens etes, speeltyd, skoolwerk en slaaptyd) is 'n leerproses. Probeer om toestel-vrye tye stadig in te stel, en bou van daar af. Verandering neem tyd, jy kan dit doen!

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are finding this challenging. If you think your child is accessing information online which is not age appropriate discuss with them why you have concerns, and why you are not comfortable. Try having your child involved in the conversation and get them to share their views. Having an open conversation is important, and children are more likely to stick to decisions if they feel that they are fair and their opinions have been heard.
text: Jammer om te hoor dis 'n uitdaging vir jou. As jy dink jou kind kry toegang tot aanlyn inligting wat nie vir hulle ouderdom geskik is nie, bespreek jou bekommernisse met hulle en waarom jy nie gemaklik is nie. Probeer om jou kind in die gesprek te betrek en sover te kry om hulle sienings te deel. 'n Oop gesprek is belangrik, en kinders is meer geneig om by die besluite te hou as hulle voel dis billik en jy het na hulle opinies geluister.

SourceText: It is completely normal to feel overwhelmed as a parent. All parents feel this way. Try calling a family member or a friend. Sometimes just talking with someone is enough, but if you still feel overwhelmed, ask someone for help. Calling for help is a sign of strength. You can do this!

SourceText: Thanks! One helpful way is to create a map with your child or teen that identifies the safe and unsafe places in the community. Here are 3 simple steps:

SourceText: That is a completely normal experience, it is shocking to learn that people who are close to us and who we trust may be a danger to our children. Find someone you can talk to about this, perhaps a friend or support service, so you can get the support your need. Remember to take a pause when you are stressed.

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are finding this challenging. Our children may know things about our communities and technology that we are not aware of. When we actively involve our children in the mapping activity, they feel heard and valued, and it can be easier to come up with a plan that everyone agrees on.

SourceText: It is difficult to know every detail about our communities. Involve another family member or friend in your mapping activity. You can even visit some of the services available and ask what they do. The more we know, the better we can keep our families safe!

SourceText: It is completely normal to experience this. Try creating a safe space to talk with @fields.child_nickname when you are both calm. Listen to their thoughts about why they feel a certain place is safe, and then share your thoughts on why you feel it is not safe. Think about making a rule together that allows them to still have fun but stay safe. Our children will listen better when we speak to them calmly.

SourceText: Hi! Were you able to have a conversation with your child or teen about COVID-19?
text: Hi! Kon jy 'n gesprek met jou kind of tiener oor COVID-19 hê?

SourceText: It is completely normal to feel uncomfortable, confused, or even scared. Everyone feels this way at times. The WHO and UNICEF and websites and local COVID-19 hotlines are great places to find advice on how you and your family can stay safe during COVID-19.
text: Dit is heeltemal normaal om ongemaklik, deurmekaar of selfs bang te voel. Almal voel partykeer so. Die WGO en UNICEF se webwerwe en plaaslike COVID-19-blitslyne is goeie plekke om raad te kry oor hoe jy en jou gesin veilig kan bly gedurende COVID-19.

SourceText: It is completely normal for children to act out or react negatively during these unprecedented times. Give them space to share how they are feeling and let them know you are there for them. You can also try distracting them with fun activities and games.
text: Dit is heeltemal normaal vir kinders om hulle swak te gedra of negatief te reageer in hierdie ongekende tye. Gee hulle ruimte om te deel hoe hulle voel en laat hulle weet jy is daar vir hulle. Jy kan ook probeer om hulle aandag af te lei met lekker aktiwiteite en speletjies.

SourceText: UNICEF: https://www.unicef.org/coronavirus/covid-19
text: UNICEF: https://www.unicef.org/coronavirus/covid-19

SourceText: You could also check your local COVID-19 hotline:
text: Jy kan ook jou plaaslike COVID-19-blitslyn besoek:

text: Hi! Elke kind se gedrag is soms moeilik. Wil jy graag 'n paar wenke hê oor hoe om sulke gedrag te hanteer?

SourceText: That is okay! You can always access parenting tips by typing "Help".
text: Dit is oukei! Jy kan altyd "Help" tik om ouerskapwenke te kry.

SourceText: Remember that One-on-One time, praise for being good, and consistent routines will also help reduce difficult behaviours.
text: Onthou, Een-tot-Een-Tyd, lof vir goeie gedrag, en konsekwente roetines sal ook help om moeilike gedrag minder te maak.

SourceText: Hi @fields.user_name! How are you feeling?
text: Hi @fields.user_name! Hoe voel jy?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Hi! How are you feeling?
text: Hi! Hoe voel jy?

SourceText: Lovely! Take a breath just to appreciate the moment.
text: Uitstekend! Skep bietjie asem om die oomblik te waardeer.

SourceText: Marvellous! When you feel good, it is easier to keep it positive throughout the day.
text: Fantasties! As 'n mens goed voel, is dit makliker om positief deur die dag te gaan.

SourceText: Everyone has challenging days, but you do not need experience it alone. Try reaching out to family and friends for support.
text: Almal het moeilike dae, maar jy hoef nie alleen daardeur te gaan nie. Probeer uitreik na familie en vriende vir ondersteuning.

SourceText: It is completely normal to feel okay. You do not need to feel great everyday.
text: Dit is heeltemal normaal om net oukei te voel. Jy hoef nie elke dag wonderlik te voel nie.

SourceText: Life is filled with ups and downs. It is important to recognise and accept how are you feeling. Please remember to be kind to yourself.
text: Die lewe is maar op en af. Dis belangrik om te erken en te aanvaar hoe jy voel. Onthou asseblief om jouself goedgesind te wees.

SourceText: Thank you for sharing! All feelings, whether they are good, bad, or okay are welcome here.
text: Dankie dat jy dit deel! Alle gevoelens, of dit nou goed, sleg of oukei is, is welkom hier.

SourceText: We are made to feel different emotions, and learning to identify them is a great skill. Good job! You know we are here to support you.
text: Ons is gemaak om verskillende emosies te voel. Om hulle te kan identifiseer, is 'n goeie vaardigheid om aan te leer. Mooi so! Jy weet ons is hier om jou te ondersteun.

SourceText: Thank you for sharing how you are feeling today. If you would like, try this relaxation activity that can help recenter and ground your emotions.
text: Dankie dat jy deel hoe jy voel vandag. Probeer die ontspanningsaktiwiteit as jy wil. Dit kan help om jou emosies weer in balans te bring.

SourceText: Thank you for sharing how you are feeling. Is there anything someone can do to help you feeling better? If so, try reaching out to them, a support system is so important.
text: Dankie dat jy deel hoe jy voel vandag. Is daar iets wat iemand kan doen om jou te help beter voel? Indien wel, probeer uitreik na hulle, 'n ondersteuningstelsel is so belangrik.

SourceText: We have all experienced difficult days, but remember its important to experience all emotions. Try to do something that can help you feel better, like going for a walk or talking to someone you care about.
text: Ons almal beleef moeilike dae, maar onthou, dit is belangrik om alle emosies te ervaar. Probeer iets doen wat jou kan laat beter voel, soos om te gaan stap of te praat met iemand vir wie jy omgee.

SourceText: That is excellent news. When you feel good, your family around you also feels good!
text: Dit is wonderlike nuus. As jy goed voel, voel jou gesin rondom jou ook goed!

SourceText: We all experience days where we just feel fine, and that is completely okay!
text: Ons almal beleef dae wanneer ons net so-so voel, en dit is heeltemal oukei!

SourceText: You should not feel pressured to feel happy and great all the time. All feelings are valid and healthy!
text: Moenie gedruk voel om heeltyd gelukkig en wonderlik te voel nie. Ons gevoelens is geldig en gesond!

SourceText: Feeling okay is perfectly normal. Try asking how your family members are feeling today. This can help everyone to understand each other better.
text: Om oukei te voel, is absoluut normaal. Vra bietjie jou gesinslede hoe hulle voel vandag. Dit kan almal help om mekaar beter te verstaan.

SourceText: Part of keeping healthy is allowing yourself to feel all your emotions: the good, the bad, and the ones in the middle.
text: 'n Deel van gesond bly is om jouself toe te laat om al jou emosies te voel: die goeie, die slegte, en die tussenin.

SourceText: There are days when we just go with the flow and it is completely perfect.
text: Daar is dae wanneer ons net saam met die stroom gaan, en dit is heeltemal goed so.

SourceText: It is completely normal to not feel great all the time. Parents all around the world have felt how you are feeling right now, and it is okay! You are doing great!
text: Dit is heeltemal normaal om nie heeltyd wonderlik te voel nie. Ouers regoor die wêreld het al gevoel soos jy nou voel op die oomblik, en dit is oukei! Jy vaar uitstekend!

SourceText: Just like everyone else, you are allowed to have days where they are not feeling great. Be gentle and patient with yourself. Tomorrow is a new day!
text: Net soos alle ander mense, mag jy dae hê wanneer jy nie wonderlik voel nie. Wees sag en geduldig met jouself. Môre is nog 'n dag!

SourceText: Having a bad day is not a reflection of your abilities or of you as a parent. Just showing up shows you care.
text: 'n Slegte dag is nie 'n weerspieëling van jou vermoëns of jou as ouer nie. Jy wys jy gee om deur net op te daag.

SourceText: We all have difficult days that make us feel upset. Remember to be kind to yourself and others during these days. How you are feeling is not a representation of your abilities!
text: Ons almal het moeilike dae wat ons omkrap. Onthou om op sulke dae jouself en ander goedgesind te wees. Hoe jy voel is nie 'n verteenwoordiging van jou vermoëns nie!

SourceText: We all have bad days, and we know it can sometimes be difficult to deal with your emotions. Learning how to cope with them in a posiitve way, sets you aside from others. If you have a few minutes to spare, use them to take care of yourself and focus on your breathing. Take this time to reflect on your feelings and try and redirect these emotions into something positive.
text: Ons almal het slegte dae, en ons weet dit kan soms moeilik wees om ons emosies te hanteer. Om te leer om emosies op 'n positiewe manier te hanteer, onderskei jou van ander. As jy 'n paar minute kan afknyp, gebruik dit om na jouself om te sien en op jou asemhaling te fokus. Neem hierdie tyd om na te dink oor jou gevoelens en probeer hierdie emosies herlei na iets positiefs.

SourceText: Learning to identify and accept your emotions will allow you to build a stronger relationship with yourself, your family and your community. Well done!
text: Om te leer om jou emosies te identifiseer en te aanvaar, help om sterker verhoudings met jouself, jou gesin en jou gemeenskap te bou. Mooi so!

SourceText: Here is a short relaxation activity for you:
text: Hier is 'n kort ontspanningsaktiwiteit vir jou:

SourceText: Do you ever feel something so strongly that you want to run away from it? Here's a short activity that might help!
text: Het jy soms sulke sterk gevoelens dat jy voel jy wil weghardloop? Hier’s 'n kort aktiwiteit wat kan help!

SourceText: This activity uses the magic power of three breaths to stay connected and relaxed.
text: Hierdie aktiwiteit gebruik die towerkrag van drie asemteue om bewus en ontspanne te bly.

SourceText: Here's an activity to relax your body:
text: Hier’s 'n aktiwiteit om jou liggaam te ontspan:

SourceText: Here is a quick relaxation activity...
text: Hier is 'n vinnige ontspanningsaktiwiteit...

SourceText: How many sounds can you hear? Listen to the sounds inside and outside the room. Count them on your fingers.
text: Hoeveel klanke kan jy hoor? Luister na die klanke binne en buite die kamer. Tel hulle op jou vingers.

SourceText: Try again for another ten seconds. Did you hear any new sounds? Did you hear any sounds inside your own body? Notice how you feel now.
text: Probeer weer vir nog tien sekondes. Het jy enige nuwe klanke gehoor? Kon jy enige klanke in jou eie liggaam hoor? Let op hoe jy nou voel.

SourceText: Breathe in to the count of three.
text: Asem in vir drie tellings.

SourceText: Instead of moving away from the feeling, let’s move towards it for a moment.
text: In plaas van om weg te beweeg van die gevoel, kom ons beweeg nader daaraan vir 'n oomblik.

SourceText: It’s ok. Close your eyes if you feel comfortable. Take a deep breath.
text: Dis oukei. Maak jou oë toe as jy gemaklik voel. Haal diep asem.

SourceText: Become curious. Where are you feeling it in your body? Is it hot or cold? Hard or soft? Tight or loose?
text: Word nuuskierig. Waar voel jy dit in jou liggaam? Is dit warm of koud? Hard of sag? Styf of los?

SourceText: Ask yourself some questions. What is it telling me? What does it need? How can I be kind to myself in this moment?
text: Vra jouself 'n paar vrae. Wat sê dit vir my? Wat wil dit hê? Hoe kan ek myself in hierdie oomblik goedgesind wees?

SourceText: If your mind starts to wander, it’s normal. Just bring it back to the feeling. Keep breathing and feeling.
text: Dis normaal vir jou gedagtes om te begin dwaal. Lei dit bloot terug na die gevoel. Bly asemhaal en bly bewus van die gevoel.

SourceText: Reassure yourself. It’s ok to feel. Feeling is healing!
text: Stel jouself gerus. Dis oukei om te voel. Om te voel is om te genees!

SourceText: Notice your connection with the ground beneath you.
text: Raak bewus van die grond onder jou voete.

SourceText: What parts of your body touch the ground? What parts of your body don’t?
text: Watter dele van jou liggaam raak aan die grond? Watter dele van jou liggaam raak nie aan die grond nie?

SourceText: Notice where it feels warm and where it feels cool.
text: Let op waar dit warm voel en waar dit koud voel.

SourceText: Feel the ground underneath you supporting you. Let your body sink into the support of the ground.
text: Voel hoe die grond onder jou jou liggaam ondersteun. Laat jou liggaam wegsink in die ondersteuning van die grond.

SourceText: Breathe in to the count of three. 1, 2, 3.
text: Asem in vir drie tellings. 1, 2, 3.

SourceText: Breath out to the count of three. 1, 2, 3.
text: Asem uit vir drie tellings. 1, 2, 3.

SourceText: Sit comfortably and close your eyes if you can.
text: Sit gemaklik en maak jou oë toe as jy kan.

SourceText: Imagine a golden ring scanning your body from your feet to your head.
text: Verbeel jou 'n goue ring skandeer jou liggaam van kop tot tone.

SourceText: Pay attention as it moves up and down your body. Are there any areas that feel tense? Numb? Painful?
text: Wees bewus van hoe dit op en af oor jou liggaam beweeg. Is daar enige plekke wat gespanne voel? Wat niks voel nie? Wat seer voel?

SourceText: Focus on those areas for a moment. Breathe in to the area and when you breathe out, try to let go of any tension or pain.
text: Fokus vir 'n oomblik op hierdie plekke. Wees bewus van hierdie plek wanneer jy inasem, en wanneer jy uitasem, probeer om enige pyn of spanning te laat gaan.

SourceText: Do this for a few breaths.
text: Doen dit 'n paar keer.

SourceText: Open your eyes. How does your body feel now?
text: Maak jou oë oop. Hoe voel jou liggaam nou?

SourceText: Try this next time you find yourself lying in bed unable to sleep!
text: Probeer dit volgende keer as jy in die bed lê en nie kan slaap nie!

SourceText: Listen to the sounds.
text: Luister na die klanke.

SourceText: Connection with the ground.
text: Raak bewus van die grond onder jou.

SourceText: Notice how you feel now.
text: Let op hoe jy nou voel.

SourceText: How do you feel now? Do you feel any different? Deep breathing helps our whole body and mind to calm down.
text: Hoe voel jy nou? Voel jy enige verskil? Diep asemhaling help jou hele liggaam en siel om rustig te raak.

SourceText: Dealing with difficult feelings.
text: Dis moeilik om gevoelens te hanteer.

SourceText: Body relaxation.
text: Liggaamontspanning.

SourceText: It’s ok to feel. Feeling is healing!
text: Dis oukei om te voel. Om te voel is om te genees!

SourceText: Let’s use the magic power of three to stay present and relax. At the end of a tough day, thinking of three things to be grateful for can help us find the courage to try again tomorrow.
text: Kom ons gebruik die towerkrag van drie om ontspanne in die oomblik te bly. Aan die einde van 'n rowwe dag, help dit om te dink aan drie dinge waarvoor ons dankbaar is – dit gee ons krag om weer môre te probeer.

SourceText: Here's a short relaxation activity to end the day:
text: Hier’s 'n kort ontspanningsaktiwiteit om jou dag mee af te sluit:

SourceText: Let's take a moment to stop what you are doing and connect with your breath.
text: Stop vir 'n oomblik waarmee jy besig is en raak bewus van jou asemhaling.

SourceText: What is one thing you can be grateful for right now?
text: Wat is een ding waarvoor jy op hierdie oomblik dankbaar kan wees?

SourceText: What is one thing that brings you happiness?
text: Wat is een ding wat jou gelukkig maak?

SourceText: What is one thing that you love?
text: Wat is een ding waarvoor jy lief is?

SourceText: They don't have to be big. Sometimes the small things in life count the most!
text: Dit hoef nie groot dinge te wees nie. Soms is dit die klein dingetjies in die lewe wat die meeste tel!

SourceText: At the end of the day, take a minute to think about the day.
text: Dink 'n bietjie na oor die dag wat verby is.

SourceText: Think about one positive or fun thing you did.
text: Dink aan een positiewe of lekker ding wat jy gedoen het.

SourceText: Think of one thing you can do differently tomorrow.
text: Dink aan een ding wat jy môre anders kan doen.

SourceText: Think of one thing that you are grateful for.
text: Dink aan een ding waarvoor jy dankbaar is.

SourceText: Do you sometimes feel like you are getting everything wrong?  Here's a short activity that might help!
text: Voel jy soms jy doen alles verkeerd?  Hier’s 'n kort aktiwiteit wat kan help!

SourceText: The magic power of three.
text: Die towerkrag van drie.

SourceText: Close your eyes and think about the day. Name 1 thing that you are grateful for. Name 1 thing that you did well. Name 1 think that you love. You earned a goodnight of sleep!
text: Maak jou oë toe en dink aan die dag. Noem 1 ding waarvoor jy dankbaar is. Noem 1 ding wat jy goed gedoen het. Noem 1 ding waarvoor jy lief is. Jy verdien 'n goeie nagrus!

SourceText: Take a moment to think over the day. Think of one thing you did today that you are proud of.
text: Dink vir 'n oomblik na oor die dag. Dink aan een ding wat jy vandag gedoen het waarop jy trots is.

SourceText: Wrap your arms around your body and give yourself a hug.
text: Vou jou arms om jou lyf en gee jouself 'n drukkie.

SourceText: Think of one thing you did today that you don’t feel proud of. What can you do differently tomorrow?
text: Dink aan een ding wat jy vandag gedoen het waarop jy nie trots is nie. Wat kan jy môre anders doen?

SourceText: And wrap your arms around your body and give yourself a hug.
text: En vou jou arms om jou lyf en gee jouself 'n drukkie.

SourceText: Connect with your breath.
text: Raak bewus van jou asemhaling.

SourceText: Take a minute to think about the day.
text: Dink 'n oomblik na oor die dag.

SourceText: End of the day.
text: Einde van die dag.

SourceText: Be kind to yourself.
text: Wees jouself goedgesind.

SourceText: You earned a goodnight of sleep!
text: Jy verdien 'n goeie nagrus!

SourceText: It’s ok. You are doing your best so be kind to yourself. Get some rest and try again tomorrow!
text: Dis oukei. Jy doen jou bes om jouself goedgesind te wees. Rus 'n bietjie en probeer môre weer!

SourceText: Do your children ever make you feel like screaming? Give yourself a 10-second pause.
text: Maak jou kinders partykeer dat jy wil skree? Gee jouself 'n 10-sekonde-blaaskans.

SourceText: Have you only got 30 seconds? Let's take a quick pause together. It might be helpful.
text: Het jy net 30 sekondes? Kom ons vat vinnig 'n blaaskans. Dalk help dit.

SourceText: Do you sometimes feel your feelings are too much?
text: Voel dit soms of jou gevoelens te veel raak?

SourceText: Talk to someone.
text: Praat met iemand.

SourceText: Talk to someone you trust. Talk to a friend. Talk to family. Talk to a plant.
text: Praat met iemand wat jy vertrou. Praat met 'n vriend. Praat met familie. Praat met 'n plant.

SourceText: Get your worries off your chest and then let them go. Even if it’s just for a moment.
text: Stort jou hart uit en laat dit dan gaan. Al is dit net vir 'n oomblik.

SourceText: How do you feel now?
text: Hoe voel jy nou?

SourceText: A joy shared is twice the joy. A problem shared is half the problem.
text: 'n Gedeelde vreugde is 'n dubbele vreugde. 'n Gedeelde probleem is 'n halwe probleem.

SourceText: Here is something fun to help you let go of stress:
text: Hier is iets lekkers wat help om stres te verlig:

SourceText: Sit down, close your eyes and listen to your breath as it goes in and out. Notice how you feel. When you are ready open your eyes again.
text: Gaan sit, maak jou oë toe en luister na jou asem soos dit in en uit gaan. Let op hoe jy voel. Wanneer jy gereed is, maak weer jou oë oop.

SourceText: Breath in and out slowly 5 times. Then try responding in a calmer way.
text: Asem stadig in en uit vir 5 tellings. Probeer dan op 'n rustiger manier reageer.

SourceText: Choose a song that reflects what you need in this moment. Do you need a gentle song to soothe your tired soul or an upbeat song to help you shake some stress out?
text: Kies 'n liedjie wat sê hoe jy voel op hierdie oomblik. Wil jy graag 'n kalm liedjie hoor om rus vir jou moeë siel te bring, of 'n vinnige liedjie om jou te help stres afskud?

SourceText: Make a space and move your body to the music. Remember to breathe while you move. Let your breath and the movement go together.
text: Maak spasie en beweeg saam met die musiek. Onthou om asem te haal terwyl jy beweeg. Laat jou asemhaling en die beweging saamvloei.

SourceText: Even a few minutes of movement can be enough to release stress and lift your mood!
text: Selfs 'n paar minute se beweging kan genoeg wees om jou stres te verlig en jou gemoed te lig!

SourceText: Choose a song that reflects what you need.
text: Kies 'n liedjie wat sê wat jy nodig het.

SourceText: Five deep breaths.
text: Diep asemhaal vir vyf tellings.

SourceText: Listen to your breath.
text: Luister na jou asemhaling.

SourceText: When feelings are too much.
text: Wanneer gevoelens te veel word.

SourceText: Millions of parents say this helps - A LOT.
text: Miljoene ouers sê dit help – BAIE.

SourceText: Try this whenever you are feeling stressed and you need a break to reconnect.
text: Probeer dit wanneer jy ook al gestres voel en bietjie 'n blaaskans wil vat.

SourceText: That's wonderful! We are happy to hear that you are feeling good.
text: Dis wonderlik! Ons is bly om te hoor jy voel goed.

SourceText: That's wonderful! I am happy to hear that you are feeling good.
text: Dis wonderlik! Ek is bly om te hoor jy voel goed.

SourceText: We are sorry to hear that you are not feeling great today. Remember to take it one day at the time. Tomorrow is a new day.
text: Ons is jammer om te hoor jy voel nie goed vandag nie. Onthou, vat dit een dag op 'n slag. Môre is nog 'n dag.

SourceText: I am sorry to hear that you are not feeling great today. Remember to take it one day at the time. Tomorrow is a new day.
text: Ek is jammer om te hoor jy voel nie goed vandag nie. Onthou, vat dit een dag op 'n slag. Môre is nog 'n dag.

SourceText: Hooray! We are delighted to hear that you are doing well.
text: Hoera! Ons is bly om te hoor dit gaan goed met jou.

SourceText: Hooray! I am delighted to hear that you are doing well.
text: Hoera! Ek is bly om te hoor dit gaan goed met jou.

SourceText: Fabulous! We are so happy to hear this.
text: Fantasties! Ons is so bly om dit te hoor.

SourceText: Fabulous! I am so happy to hear this.
text: Fantasties! Ek is so bly om dit te hoor.

SourceText: What a great feeling! We hope that good feeling continues throughout the entire day.
text: Wat 'n wonderlike gevoel! Ons hoop jy voel die hele dag so goed.

SourceText: What a great feeling! I hope that good feeling continues throughout the entire day.
text: Wat 'n wonderlike gevoel! Ek hoop jy voel die hele dag so goed.

SourceText: We are glad to hear this! We are sure your family is happy to see you this way as well.
text: Ons is bly om dit te hoor! Ons is seker jou gesin is ook bly om jou so te sien.

SourceText: I am glad to hear this! I am sure your family is happy to see you this way as well.
text: Ek is bly om dit te hoor! Ek is seker jou gesin is ook bly om jou so te sien.

SourceText: What fantastic news! We hope you continue to feel good throughout the day.
text: Dis nou wonderlike nuus! Ons hoop jy voel regdeur die dag so goed.

SourceText: What fantastic news! I hope you continue to feel good throughout the day.
text: Dis nou wonderlike nuus! Ek hoop jy voel regdeur die dag so goed.

SourceText: It makes us very happy to hear that you are feeling good! Take that good energy and share it with others!
text: Dit maak ons baie gelukkig om te hoor dat jy goed voel! Deel hierdie goeie energie met ander!

SourceText: It makes me very happy to hear that you are feeling good! Take that good energy and share it with others!
text: Dit maak my baie gelukkig om te hoor dat jy goed voel! Deel hierdie goeie energie met ander!

SourceText: Hi @fields.user_name! Could you be spending more time with your children and less time on your phone? Put it down and do something fun together!
text: Hi @fields.user_name! Is dit dalk moontlik vir jou om meer tyd met jou kinders te spandeer en minder op jou foon? Sit dit neer en doen iets lekkers saam!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Hi! Could you be spending more time with your children and less time on your phone? Put it down and do something fun together!

SourceText: That's okay! You can always get suggestions for activities to do by typing "Help". Chat later @fields.user_name!
